email_chain.subject: Request for Insurance Estimate
email_chain.body:

Many thanks,
Feisal

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Insurance Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Feisal,

We received your enquiry concerning the shipping insurance. We will estimate the cost and inform you as soon as possible.

Best regards,
Sadat Fahmy

email_chain.subject: Insurance Approval Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Feisal,

Our underwriter has approved the insurance with the following details:
- Sum insured: USD 125,000.00
- Limit: USD 100,000.00
- Commission: 1% of the sum insured (USD 1,250.00).

Please let us know if you need further clarification.

Best regards,
Sadat Fahmy

email_chain.subject: Re: Insurance Approval Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Feisal,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am pleased to inform you that our underwriters have approved the ship’s temperate with the limits of USD 100,000.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Alexander Chin
Adjuster, Insurance Division

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Insurance Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Feisal,

We would like to confirm the above details. Please confirm that the above details are correct. If there are any other requirements, please let us know.

Shadi Malik
Underwriter

email_chain.subject: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona

I have 4,300MT of wheat from Odessa to Barcelona. Could you advise if you can fit this in early August, and what’s your standard demurrage clause?

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

The answer is yes. Regarding demurrage terms, those are the standard FIOS terms (although please note that you do not mention your demurrage in your offer; it is customary to have the same clause both for buyer and seller). Please let me know whether you want me to send you a full contract asap.

All the best,
Vicente

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Vicente,

Thank you. I don’t require the full contract, just the demurrage clause would do. We will send you the draft offer in the next two days.

Warm regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

Our offer would be based on the FIOS terms. Let me know if you accept and I’ll send you the draft offer asap.

All the best,
Vicente

email_chain.subject: Request for FOB Price and Delivery Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Capt. Hu,

Zoe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for FOB Price and Delivery Details
email_chain.body:
Thank you, Zoe. We’ll send our price list by email. Shall we discuss further details?

Regards,
Hu Gang

email_chain.subject: Cargo Details Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Hu,

We need to discuss more about your cargo details:
1. Is the cargo washed, solvent-free or not?
2. What about the cargo condition and appearance?
3. What about the cargo viscosities, oxidation, and moisture content?
4. Does the cargo have any other special requirements?
5. Can you provide us with the API gravity of the cargo?
6. Can you provide us with a cargo test report and certificate of origin and delivery of your cargo?
7. What is the cargo smell like?
8. What is the cargo condition like?
9. What about the cargo color?

Please reply to the above.

Regards,
Zoe

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Price List and Payment Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Hu,

Just sent you a list of our prices and further contact details by email. We’d like to know if the prices are okay and when we can expect a reply from you. We’d also like to discuss the terms of payment for this cargo and about the parties involved in the loading operation. Do you have any special requirements or special inspection requirements for your cargo?

Thanks!
Regards,
Zoe

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Details Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe,

Please do not respond to our list of questions or the offer. We’re a real transportation company and not a shipper or buyer, so please don’t respond to our offer. Otherwise, we’ll have to blacklist you and will contact the authorities to stop your fraudulent activities.

Thanks.
Regards,
Peter Wong

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Cargo Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Hu,

Just want to know if you still have any cargo for us?

Regards,
Zoe

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up on Cargo Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe,

Not much cargo is available now, but we can’t confirm anything for you. Any deal we discuss would have to be confidential. How much cargo would you be looking for, and when would you be able to load it?

Regards,
Peter Wong

email_chain.subject: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Mundra to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Peter,

We have a cargo to ship from Mundra to Long Beach. I do not anticipate any berth congestion in either port, but would you still please confirm that?

Many thanks,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Mundra to Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Hope you are well.

As far as Mundra is concerned, there will be no berth congestion (whether it be monthly or weekly) in any month of this year.

Regarding the port of Long Beach, the container volume is consistently increasing month on month. It will also increase in the coming month. However, we can see that in February 2019, there were 8 ETDs, whereas in January 2019 there were 7 ETDs. The transhipment movement from West Africa & other major US destinations to Long Beach will increase by more than 10% this year. Hence we may see less berth congestion in the months of January, February & March 2019. However, the probability of berth congestion in April and onward months is very high as long as the CBP do not relax any of their existing regulations to reduce the dwell time.

Best regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Mundra to Long Beach - Historical Data

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry from Mundra to Long Beach - Terminal Changes
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Kindly note the following changes in view of the proposed cut off:

· All STS, which were used in the past to eliminate congestion, will cease by end of March 2019.
· Due to many more factors like larger volume, berth congestion & diversification, the terminal now prefers containers which are loaded on to wagons, trucks, rail heads, special containers (Transponders, Chilled, Refrigerated, etc.) as well as containers which are to be exported via Ocean Terminal, Pier 400, Long Beach Container Terminal (LBCT), ……………… the list goes on.
· Longer term (year on year), terminal hopes that terminal will be able to achieve more in terms of more Gate out/container return, which is the only way the terminal will be able to handle more volume.
· With the above changes, the terminal will be able to improve its efficiency.

Best regards,
Peter

Hi Everyone,

There are some students in a course that I teach who asked me to provide advice in writing a proposal for a project. It seems that the deadline for submitting the proposals is fast approaching, and they have not started to work on writing a proposal yet. Also, one of the students told me that they had asked many of their professors for advice, and most of the professors whom they had contacted did not respond. Therefore, I thought that maybe you would be able to provide them with some advice, if you had time, and also perhaps let them know that they should start as soon as possible.

Best regards,
<another-name>

email_chain.subject: Re: [Question: Proposed projects by students]
email_chain.body:
Hi <recipient-1>, <recipient-2>,

How about the following advice?

A. Proposal.

Generally speaking, the structure of a project proposal is roughly as follows:
1. Introduction
2. Objectives
3. Methodology
4. Timeline
5. Budget

B. Some tips for writing.

If you don't have much time to read through the advice that I send to you, please just look at the tips for writing.

Best regards,
<another-name>

email_chain.subject: Re: Estate of [Deceased] - Probate Inquiry

Thank you for reaching out regarding the Estate of [Deceased]. I will review the Will and provide my opinion on whether it meets the legal requirements for probate. Additionally, I will compile a list of assets owned by [Deceased] at the time of her death and identify any assets not subject to the terms of the Will.

To commence the administration of the Will, we will need to file a petition with the probate court. I will also outline the tax implications associated with the administration process.

Please feel free to call me at (415) 599-2483 or reply to this email if you have any further questions.

Sincerely,
Shari

Admitted in the State of California. The State of Oregon does not permit attorneys to practice under the same terms as other states.

NOTICE OF ELECTRONIC RECORDING: This communication may contain privileged or confidential information. If you are not the intended recipient, please notify the sender immediately and delete this email.

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for 13,000MT of Rice from Colombo to Matadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Morris,

We have an enquiry for 13,000MT of rice from Colombo to Matadi. Could you provide us with a berth congestion forecast and explain how your laytime allowance works in case of port delays?

Many thanks,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for 13,000MT of Rice from Colombo to Matadi
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Matadi is a very busy port, and cargoes are often backed up at the berth. There is no guaranteed transit time for discharging ships. Typically, ships wait in line for 2-4 days to get to the berth, and the number of ships in line can vary unpredictably as ships can arrive at any time without prior notice.

When two berths are available, the Terminal usually handles the berthing order based on when the ship can reach the berth. If your vessel arrives on the scheduled day, your berth time will likely be honored. However, if you are late due to port congestion and cannot reach the reserved berth, your berth may be given to another ship, and you will have to wait in line for the next available slot.

Best regards,
Ms. Morris

Can you deliver 2,000MT of butter to New York as soon as possible, but on a CIF basis with insurance from Kandla? Can you confirm your earliest laycan and available vessel types?

Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping 2,000MT of Butter to New York
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robert,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, your cargo could not be loaded onto the ship today. This is a common occurrence in the shipping industry. Here is the feedback from the captain:

> I cannot explain the reason for the delay since the cargo did not arrive at the port on time. Please check your business documents for details. However, the ship and crew are in good condition.

Regarding your other questions:
1. Please check the bill of lading. If there is no insurance requested, then there is no insurance.
2. If there is no insurance in the bill of lading, please contact the local authorities to arrange for insurance coverage.

Thank you for choosing our service. We look forward to assisting you again.

Best Regards,
Mr. Shipping Agent

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping 2,000MT of Butter to New York
email_chain.body:

2. CFR (Cost and Freight)

Please let me know which option suits your needs.

Thank you for your time, and I hope this helps.

Best Regards,
Mr. Shipping Agent

email_chain.subject: Motion to Compel Deposition of David Pincus
email_chain.body:
Your Honors,

Claimants have moved to compel the deposition of a United States Attorney, David Pincus. Claimants seek an order requiring Mr. Pincus to appear for deposition on October 29, 2019, but have not shown good cause for the relief sought. Accordingly, Claimants’ motion should be denied.

Background:

Mr. Pincus has been involved in this case as a representative of the United States, and his deposition is being sought by the claimants. However, the claimants have failed to demonstrate sufficient grounds for compelling his testimony at this time.

Respectfully submitted,
Kirk M. Stansel
Peter A. Sickels
Joshua R. Hasty
Lawyers for the United States
Indian Towers, LLC
550 West B Street, Suite 540
San Diego, CA 92101
619.230.0903
lktmlts@csus.com

email_chain.subject: Re: Motion to Compel Deposition of David Pincus
email_chain.body:
Mr. Stansel,

Your submission regarding the motion to compel the deposition of David Pincus has been received and will be reviewed by the court. Please ensure all supporting documents are filed promptly.

Sincerely,
Court Clerk
United States Court of Federal Claims

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on LPG/Propane Offers for MR Vessel
email_chain.body:

I am interested in your latest LPG/Propane offers for an MR vessel to Japan. Could you provide quotes for re-laydays from 14 – 28 August, with departure from Japan between 5 – 9 September? Please quote for a duration of 7 days on a voyage basis.

Additionally, I would like to know the company you will charter and request the vessel charter party terms and conditions. We would appreciate it if you could provide the above details at your earliest convenience.

Thank you,
Mohd Asif

email_chain.subject: Request for Charter Party Copy
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Could you kindly send us a copy of the charter party for our further reference?

Regards,
Jaree

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Charter Party Copy
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your email. Please find attached the charter party document for your reference.

Regards,
Nutsaporn

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on LPG/Propane Offers for MR Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mohd Asif,

As per our quotation, we kindly request you to confirm your interest. If interested, please submit the following documents: approved LOI, Performance Bond, current LR3C, current PQS (GAC), COA, and Warranty letter by return email. Upon receipt of these documents, our chartering team will commence negotiations.

CHARTERER’S CRITERIA:
I. Charterer’s Conditions to Apply.
II. The tanker to be bareboat chartered from the Owners. Vessel to remain under Owners’ Management.
III. The charter party to be subject to the Norwegian Sale Form with Tanker Laycan Clause, except as varied below.
IV. The Gas/Bunker Clause to apply.
V. The Captain to be nominated by Charterers.

Regards,
Nutsaporn

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Warranty Clause
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Could you kindly provide the complete terms and conditions? We have a question regarding the warranty clause. Is the warranty limit applicable for the total consumption of the charter period or for each delivery?

Regards,
Jaree

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Warranty Clause
email_chain.body:
Hello Jaree,

Thank you for your email. The warranty limit is applicable for the total consumption of the charter period.

Regards,
Nutsaporn

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on LPG/Propane Offers for MR Vessel
email_chain.body:

We are pleased to learn of your interest in our offer. Below are the answers to your questions:

Your quotation refers to tankers with DWT 6,000.00 – 15,000.00MT, TPC CFT 500 – 6,000.00MT. We will negotiate with our principals and provide further details shortly.

Regards,
Nutsaporn

Could you check on latest bunker cost from Spain to Poland? 6. We also have a shipment from Fos to Tarragona.

email_chain.subject: Reflections on Recent Trip to France
email_chain.body: Dear Mydear, It was a pleasure meeting you last month. I hope you are keeping well. Just a short note to say how much I enjoyed the recent trip to France. It was one of the most memorable holidays I have ever had. The accommodation was beautiful, the food was wonderful and we had a great time at the restaurant on the first night. I am sorry to say that we did not get to see as much as we wanted as we had to return early on the last day. However, I would definitely go again. As you know, we have been discussing this for a long time. I know you are a bit of a Francophile, so I hope you will be interested in the following. I have enclosed a few photos of the holiday. We have a friend in the tourism industry, so we got a discount on some of the expenses.

email_chain.subject: Base Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

We have 7.4kMT of base oil ready in Malta. Is it ready for shipment to Yemen? How long would it take to prepare the necessary documents, and can you accept delivery within 48 hours?

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Mabena,

Thank you for your email.

Unfortunately, the Yemen Embassy in Malta does not accept any visa applications directly. For a visa application, you must go through the company you are working for or a company that will sponsor your trip.

Yours sincerely,
Yasmina

email_chain.subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

Thanks for the info about the company. There are only two people in Malta, and they are both married. For the company, what if I am not working for it? But the company can be the sponsor for me to get the Yemen visa. Can you tell me who to get in contact with? Do you know any sponsor company that I can contact?

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

Thanks for the info. I’ll go there today and will also go to the embassy to make some inquiries.

Regards,
Mabena

email_chain.subject: Re: Base Oil Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasmina,

I was in Malta yesterday. I went to the embassy, and the people there were kind. They informed me that I don’t need any sponsor, but to get a visa, it costs 118 USD.

Hope this information helps you.

Yours sincerely,
Mabena

email_chain.body:

a) Public Liability – not applicable

b) Cargo – cover for theft and damage, cover for transshipment risks, and moisture damage. Cover for a wider risk (negligence of carriers, transport, etc.). Paying shipper.

Your advice?

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 2,000MT Oil Cargo from Singapore to Hamburg
email_chain.body:

Would you be able to handle a 2,000MT cargo of oil from Singapore to Hamburg next month?

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Additional Details for 2,000MT Oil Cargo
email_chain.body:
Good day William,

Below are some preliminary details for your consideration:

- We require a shipment of Fuel Oil (0.5% Sulphur) with 180-day Bunker credit at Hamburg.
- A time charter is preferred for this shipment.
- Please provide a TEU count, as we may be able to arrange for an additional vessel to handle container shipments.

Additionally, we will need the following documentation sent via DHL Express on the morning the vessel is due to berth:

1. Invoices for the cargo
2. B/L’s (Blanket basis)
3. Inspection Certificate
4. Agency Copy of the manifest
5. Charter Party

Let me know your suggestions. You can reach me at:

Email: anthony@example.com
Direct Tel: +852 2869 2131

Thanks,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 2,000MT Oil Cargo from Singapore to Hamburg
email_chain.body:
Good day Anthony,

We can arrange for 2,000 MT of Fuel Oil (0.5% Sulphur) on a time charter to Hamburg with 180 days bunker credit. Please provide your detailed charter party conditions and requirements.

For the charter party conditions, I propose the usual terms and conditions. The vessel must comply with MARPOL 73/78, including equipment for the separation of oily waste and disposal at sea, or a system capable of containing, recovering, and processing oily residue on board. The vessel must also be certified as per MARPOL 73/78 and be seaworthy.

Let me know if you have any further requirements.

Best regards,
William Lee

email_chain.subject: Loading Window and Laycan for 40,000MT of #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

What is the loading window for 40,000MT of #2 fuel oil from Haldia to Singapore? Also, please advise on the laycan.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Laycan for 40,000MT of #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

The answer from someone on the ship side will be most welcomed (current laycan for oil 40k Haldia-Sing). In the meantime, and not to put any undue pressure on the person, but I need an answer by 20:00 Hong Kong time on the 12th. No pressure, I just need an answer by then.

This is especially important because the vessel concerned has to clear their port of 90,000 tonnes of cargo at the same time as loading the product in question. As such, it is best to keep the loading plan as close to the current laycan as possible for reasons of space and availability.

That's why I would be keen to get your laycan in a day or so.

Thank you again for your assistance.

Regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for 40,000MT of #2 Fuel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Mike,

The laycan for the product is as follows: Loading window is as follows: (Laycan 12th Aug/14th Aug; ETA Singapore 15th Aug/16th Aug)

**bold print = from paper**

Regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading Window and Laycan for 40,000MT of #2 Fuel Oil

The laycan for the oil was to be between 12-16 Aug. The opening/closing date of the laycan as well as the ETA for Singapore are critical, therefore it's best that you let me know the exact ETA for Singapore.

The cargoes to be loaded are cargo 1 & 2. The vessel has to load both oil cargoes at Haldia at the same time.

**bold print from paper**

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vanadium Pentoxide Shipment
email_chain.body:

I hope all is well on your side. I’m enquiring about 3,500MT of vanadium pentoxide from South Africa to Fos Sur Mer. I would like to discuss a late-July laycan, and a short lead time of ten days. Please advise the port of loading in South Africa.

email_chain.subject: Vanadium Pentoxide Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jean-Christophe Constantinou,

Thank you for the inquiry about vanadium pentoxide. As requested by your customer, we could offer you Fos Sur Mer for loading late-July. The port of loading is Secunda, South Africa. We can load 3,500MT in bulk, packed in 25kg bags. We will then be able to provide the following documents: the Proforma Invoice, the Commercial Invoice, the Bill of Lading, and the Packing List. The payment will be done by the term L/C at sight.

We are a successful chemical wholesaler, representing many companies, from producers, traders and brokers. We specialize in chemicals, pharmaceuticals, minerals, fertilizer, additives and intermediates, such as Vanadium Pentoxide. We also provide trade support, which includes:

Best regards,
Ms. Sylvia

email_chain.subject: Re: Vanadium Pentoxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Ms. Sylvia,

If you accept this offer, please let me know so I can send you our shipment’s documents.

Best regards,
Jean-Christophe Constantinou

email_chain.subject: Additional Information on Vanadium Pentoxide
email_chain.body:
Ms. Sylvia,

For your reference, here is some additional information on vanadium pentoxide:

A. Verifying the Product
1. Using the Web
Find the product name: vanadium pentoxide
Using Google, find the definition:
http://www.thefreedictionary.com/vanadium+pentoxide
The definition is:
“Vanadium(V) oxide is the inorganic compound with the formula V2O5. It is used industrially as a catalyst for sulfuric acid production and as a catalyst in the exhaust systems of motor vehicles. It is a brown/yellow solid, although when freshly precipitated from aqueous solution, its colour is deep orange. The molecular and crystal structure of V2O5 has been intensively studied by many techniques. The structure of the bulk is well understood.

Best regards,
Jean-Christophe Constantinou

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote - Cargo Transportation
email_chain.body:
Hello Xylo,

My client has 20,000MT of cargo for transportation. Please quote for carriage on single voyage terms from Houston to Antwerp.

Best,
Elena

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Xylo,

This is the third quote we received for this job. Your rate is close to the lowest we received. Can you please make the offer valid for 3 days from the date you received this email?

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best,
Elena

email_chain.subject: Offer Validity and Terms
email_chain.body:
Hello Elena,

The offer is valid only for 3 days. The offer is based on the condition that the cargo is not rejected at final inspection. All relevant documents (Bill of Lading and other documents) will be sent by email on the day of shipment. We accept no liability for errors in email transmissions and reserve the right to withhold payment in respect of cargo received in less than perfect condition.

As we discussed, we are going to charge you the full amount in advance. Please transfer $65,000.00 to our account.

Best,
Xylo

email_chain.subject: Payment Terms and Legal Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Xylo,

Please share your legal terms as we have not seen them. Can we agree on a payment of $20,000.00 in advance?

Best,
Elena

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Previous Emails

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Previous Emails

email_chain.subject: Request for HFO Delivery Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Habib,

Would you please help arrange for a 100,000MT parcel of HFO to be delivered from the Panama Canal to Port Qasim? Could you also provide your LFG rate and expected transit time?

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Update on HFO Delivery - Vessel Sun Dragon
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

The vessel Sun Dragon, which we have arranged for the charter to deliver the parcel of oil you requested, has taken on the cargo at the Panama Canal. It is currently waiting for a berth at Port Qasim. Unfortunately, the ship-to-ship transfer hoses were damaged in a recent collision, and the ship's owner is hesitant to use a new or used set of hoses that might fail again. They have ordered a new set of hoses, which will take a couple of weeks to deliver and install.

Please let me know if there is any alternative means to load the cargo, and I will try to make the necessary arrangements to comply with your request.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of HFO Discharge
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Habib,

This morning we received confirmation that the shipment can be discharged as scheduled into our own terminal.

Regards,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for 2,400MT Fresh Fruit from South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Smith,

Our office is arranging a 2,400MT freight of fresh fruit from South Africa to Antwerp, departing next week. Please confirm your earliest dates, and if you have a standard demurrage rate.

Thanks,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for 2,400MT Fresh Fruit from South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

As you are probably aware, we regularly ship fresh produce out of South Africa to Antwerp. The two ships currently loading are scheduled for departure next week. Should the vessel of your choice not be available, we will be delighted to offer another ship. We attach a charter summary for your information, and confirm our standard rates in accordance with your enquiry.

We look forward to hearing from you in due course.

Yours sincerely,
Juan Du Preez
Umschlagskontor

P.S. We appreciate that your position may be difficult as your vessel will have to load quickly. Our office has a well-equipped lab for testing and we can mobilise one of our freight inspectors to check the condition of the cargo. He can carry out quality checks with our certified biological agency.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for 2,400MT Fresh Fruit from South Africa to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We confirm receipt of your enquiry regarding a new vessel for your cargo loading on 1st December. As you know, we are currently full. However, as the voyage is only 21 days, we are confident that our southbound vessel will return home quickly and be available for an early charter. If you wish to discuss the matter further, please contact Mr. Du Preez or myself.

Yours sincerely,
Nicol Kohn
Schiffahrtkontor

email_chain.subject: Update on Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

We regret that the vessel 'Daanen de Jong' was detained by the USCG in New York. In view of the heavy congestion at Antwerp, we advise you to offer an earlier departure to the market. Unfortunately, our southbound vessel 'Baedeker' has been chartered by our German branch for a new deep sea voyage and is now on its way to the USA.

The vessel 'Winkelhuis' has just been loaded and will depart on 5th December. Our dispatch department is aware of the urgency of the matter and is currently checking availability for a temporary substitute. We attach a chart for your information and please let me know when we can expect your intentions.

Regards,
Nicol Kohn

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Shipping Rates for Adhesives
email_chain.body:

We’re exploring rates for 4,500MT of adhesives from Hamburg to Aarhus. Would it be possible to combine cargo with any existing fixture, and what’s your demurrage rate?

Thanks,
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up: Shipping Rates for Adhesives
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Ferrara,

I’m following up on my previous email. Is there any way you might be able to offer a lower rate? We have multiple shipments of this cargo, and it would be really helpful to negotiate rates with you once.

Thank you!
Ivy

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-Up: Shipping Rates for Adhesives
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

I’m not sure if we’re on the same page, so I’ll clarify. For that fixture, there’s no way to accommodate a lower rate. However, I’m curious whether you’d be open to discussing future fixtures that might have space for your product.

Thanks,
Ms. Ferrara

email_chain.subject: Meeting Request: Shipping Rates Discussion
email_chain.body:
Hi Ivy,

We’re happy to set up a meeting for you to discuss this further with our business manager. When can you fit this into your schedule?

Best regards,
Ms. Ferrara

Mobile: +852-9555-4136

Nippon Yusen Kaisha Hong Kong Limited

email_chain.subject: Vessel Options for 15kt Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pandey,

For the 15kt shipment of methanol from Rotterdam to Montevideo, can you provide some vessel options based on CFR and provide the rate?

Best regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Options for 15kt Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy,

If I take Ethanol (44 kg/cu m and 22 cts per lt) 250 MTs cargo; what would be the total cost of freight if I take the cargo out of Moin-Honduras, and the shipping time will be 5 days?

Can you please give me the figures before today midnight?

I will wait for your email.

Thank you,
Mr. Pandey

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Options for 15kt Methanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pandey,

I assume this is for shipping to Montevideo, Uruguay?

[Short answer] Considering the cost of Ethanol at USD 700.00/t, loading at Moin and routing via Mediterranean and Atlantic Ocean, then the FOB Hamburg is USD 420.00/t with a port rotation in Moin, Santos, and Constanza.

[Long answer] We have to send a complete quotation to understand the entire situation and its respective commercial requirements in order to provide a complete and accurate quotation to our client.

Our company can offer competitive shipping costs and services for transporting Ethanol to Montevideo, Uruguay. We are happy to provide more information and a detailed quote upon request.

Based on your information, I can provide you with an estimate for the shipping cost of 250 MT of Ethanol from Moin, Honduras to Montevideo, Uruguay.

Please note that the shipping cost may vary based on additional factors.

Best regards,
Andy

Monika

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Urea Shipment from Sines to Santos
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Urea Shipment from Sines to Santos

email_chain.subject: Re: Tanker Charter Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Sandy,

We need a tanker to move 250,000 tons of crude oil from Algiers to Marseille. We are considering the following options:

(a) time charter for 60 days or

email_chain.subject: Proposal for High Volume Freight and Storage Package

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for RORO Transport to Germany
email_chain.body: Hello, I'd like to book an RORO truck, 26 meters and 4 axles, to transport goods from Turkey to Germany. Could you provide more information about this service? Thank you, Elio.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for RORO Transport to Germany
email_chain.body: Hello Elio, thank you for your inquiry. We currently have RORO trucks available, but they are 16 meters with 3 axles, suitable for routes from Holland to Morocco and Romania. Could you please provide the size of your cargo so I can advise further? The freight forwarder will calculate the feasibility and we can proceed accordingly. Best regards.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for RORO Transport to Germany
email_chain.body: Thank you for your response. The cargo is a centrifuge system that cannot fit into a 20-foot container. The dimensions are 9.56 meters long, 2.5 meters wide, and 3.8 meters high, with an empty weight of 2800 kg. Please let me know if this can be accommodated. Best, Elio.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for RORO Transport to Germany
email_chain.body: Hello Elio, I apologize for the confusion earlier. Regarding your request for a 26-meter RORO truck, it seems there was a misunderstanding. The total length includes space for transporting cars and the cab, which cannot be used for cargo. Additionally, the weight of your centrifuge system (35,000 kg) exceeds the capacity of our 3-axle vans (up to 28 tons). We do not have a 4-axle van capable of handling 40 tons. Unfortunately, we cannot accommodate this request. Please let us know if you need assistance with other transport options. Best regards.

email_chain.subject: Clarification on RORO Trucks
email_chain.body: Hello Elio, to clarify, RORO trucks are different from standard vans. RORO trucks are open trucks equipped with cranes for loading and unloading cars. Their maximum weight capacity is around 28 tons, which is insufficient for your cargo. I regret to inform you that we cannot fulfill this request. Please feel free to reach out if you need further assistance. Best regards.

email_chain.subject: Alternative Transport Options
email_chain.body: Hello Elio, we do have a 26-meter van with 4 axles available. However, I am unsure if this would meet your needs, as it requires loading the cargo onto the van. Could you confirm if this would work for your centrifuge system? Best regards.

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Jones,

We are in need of a vessel for 7,000MT of refined crude oil from Port Lagos, Nigeria to Mina Al Ahmadi. We are happy to discuss lumpsum deals and would be interested in your availability from 19 October to 2 November.

Regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Anders,

Thanks for your email. We are happy to discuss lumpsum deals. Our vessel, the MV Khaleej, is currently on charter in Galveston, Texas. We could ship 7,000MT of refined crude oil for an FOB price of USD 55 million from Port Lagos. There are only two conditions:
- The charter rate must be USD 120,000/day. The vessel's average speed is 14.6 knots, and it would take about 11 days for the voyage.
- Your agents in Galveston can make all arrangements for the charter. Please find attached our CV.

Regards,
Mr. Jimmie Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Jimmie,

Could you clarify how long you need the charter for? What is the estimated voyage time, taking into account weather conditions? Also, could you provide your company profile?

Regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Crude Oil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Anders,

Thanks for your email. We are happy to discuss lumpsum deals. Our vessel, the MV Khaleej, is currently on charter in Galveston, Texas. We could ship 7,000MT of refined crude oil for an FOB price of USD 55 million from Port Lagos. There are only two conditions:
- The charter rate must be USD 120,000/day. The vessel's average speed is 14.6 knots, and it would take about 11 days for the voyage.
- Your agents in Galveston can make all arrangements for the charter. Please find attached our CV.

Regards,
Mr. Jimmie Jones

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 50 Tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Good day,

We are seeking 50 tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore, and need a loading date of 11th December. Could you provide details on airfreight and insurance costs?

Best regards,
Chuck

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50 Tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Chuck,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please allow me some time to calculate the airfreight and insurance costs. I hope to get back to you within two days.

Best regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50 Tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Good day,

The airfreight costs for Taipei to Singapore are $4,000 per ton, and the insurance costs are $1,000 per ton. The loading date of 11th December is acceptable. Do you have a 50-ton slot available on that date? If so, could you confirm the total price including airfreight and insurance costs?

Best regards,
Chuck

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50 Tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Chuck,

I noticed that the insurance costs are $1,000 per ton, while the airfreight costs are $4,000 per ton. Could you clarify why the insurance costs are relatively high compared to the airfreight costs?

Best regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50 Tons of PET from Taipei to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Chuck,

Please consider this: What kind of answer would you expect if you were asked a similar question in a job interview? Just something to think about.

Best regards,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Loading at Jubail
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

We can load the gasoline at Jubail on April 15th. Could you please provide details on the voyage charter terms?

Regards,
James

NOTE: A typical voyage charter (demurrage) contract has 24 hours as the benchmark for demurrage/laytime (load time to commence). Beyond this point, the charterer becomes liable for demurrage for each day over the 24-hour benchmark.

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Freight Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Ford,

I have noted your early availability and am checking for interest in gasoline from Jubail. Could you please provide your freight rate?

Regards,
Mona

NOTE: Fuel oil is 100% payment by letter of credit, so the freight clause has no significance.

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Freight and Voyage Charter Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

We can deliver the gasoline on a 35-day FOB basis or supply a voyage charter with 35 days' notice. Our freight rate is $3,000 to $3,200 FOB Rotterdam. Please let us know your thoughts.

Regards,
Captain Ford

NOTE: The $3,200 FOB figure indicates that we can load the fuel oil at Jubail on April 15th (35 days' notice from your date) for a freight of $3,200 FOB Rotterdam, provided we are given a voyage charter. The 35-day notice FOB indicates that we cannot secure a voyage charter immediately or that it takes 35 days to arrange one.

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Price and Availability Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Ford,

We would like to confirm the price of 80,000 metric tons of gasoline CIF Rotterdam at $7,000 per metric ton. Could you confirm your availability for the gasoline? Regarding the freight and voyage charter, we can arrange this later if you accept the price. Please advise, as my colleague is eager to confirm your price and expects to hear from you soon.

Regards,
Mona

NOTE: By confirming the price and asking about availability, we are demonstrating serious interest in the gasoline. Mentioning my colleague's involvement adds urgency and plays into the principal's ego.

email_chain.subject: Gasoline Supply Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

We are sorry to hear that you cannot arrange our gasoline supply via FOB Rotterdam. We understand your position and are willing to load the gasoline in 35 days on a voyage charter for what we can supply. However, to meet your request, our principal would like to buy the gasoline on a 25-day FOB basis. Could you confirm that you will accept the price of $7,000 per metric ton? You may offer CIF Rotterdam in place of FOB Rotterdam at no increase in freight. Our principal expects to hear from you soon and prefers payment by letter of credit. We have noted your availability for April 15th.

Regards,
Captain Ford

NOTE: By expressing regret and proposing alternative terms, we are showing flexibility and seriousness about the transaction.

email_chain.subject: Availability for 11,100MT of Corn Oil
email_chain.body:

We have space for 11,100MT of corn oil from Puerto Alegre to Shanghai. Our earliest date of lifting is on the 20th, and your open vessel has an ETA of the 26th. The freight is 22.5%, and we are charging in USD from our Taiwan account.

Marta Maffei

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Grain Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Grain Shipment

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Afternoon Mr. Saeed,

We have a 5,000MT parcel of equipment to move from Montevideo to Isla Margarita. Could you send a freight quote for me?

Regards,
Lacey

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

A good afternoon to you.

We have received the message from Peter regarding this move and are currently working on it. As soon as the details are ready, we will send you the quotation.

Apologies for the delay, as we are in the middle of a short holiday. We will be happy to offer you the best solution for your cargo.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Quotation for Montevideo to Isla Margarita Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

I attach the quotation for your review. You will remember that I sent you a quotation some days ago for the shipment from Montevideo to the Vargas Free Zone (Isla Margarita, Venezuela). I attach it for your review.

As I explained to you, your freight forwarder is using the transportation of a passenger vessel for which they charge you a huge amount of money (of course with a very high margin of profit for them). However, we could suggest an alternative which could be very convenient for you. The following is the technical background:

As you probably know, a number of passenger ships go from South America to the Caribbean; among them is the MS Francy, which normally operates between Brazil and Venezuela. This ship was specially chartered by a tour operator from Dubai who asked us for help.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Follow Up on Quotation
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

As a follow-up to the quotation sent to you yesterday, I attach here the quotation we did for the voyage from Montevideo to Isla Margarita for your consideration. This voyage is scheduled to leave on 22 July with an estimated time of arrival on 25 July in Isla Margarita, and there is a high probability that it will be chartered. This vessel was used by a tour operator from Dubai, who asked us to help them with the organisation of the operation. I will ask them to contact you to give you all the details. This operator was looking for containers, but we have done the calculation and we see that there is no need to use containers, because the cost would be too high in relation to the volume. So the only way would be by 20' pallets, using the forklift.

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Update on Voyage Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hi Lacey,

The voyage scheduled from Montevideo to Isla Margarita (arrival 27 June) is sold out, and another vessel will be used for this operation. We have arranged with a very good cargo vessel which will be leaving from the port of Valparaiso on 24 July and arriving in Isla Margarita on 27 July. This cargo vessel will be chartered by the tour operator for this voyage. We suggest the option by 20' flat racks (pallets) to be loaded on the decks of the vessel and also by trucks to be driven aboard and carried in the hold of the vessel. This will be the cheapest way to move your cargo. Please let me know if you would like us to quote on this proposal. The itinerary of the ship is as follows:

*Dep. Montevideo

Best regards,
Joseline

email_chain.subject: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lo,

We are planning to ship 3,500MT of potassium hydroxide from Yantai to Tianjin before the end of next month. Could you please provide a preliminary quote and confirm if you handle port dues under FOB terms?

Best regards,
Elaine
Elegant Trading Co., Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Elaine,

We can accept Free On Board (FOB), CNF, and CIF terms. Under CNF and CIF, we will cover the port dues and insurance.

When the goods are transferred, we will need the original bill of lading, which we can fax or email to you.

If you agree to FOB terms, please fax or email the original bill of lading to our freight forwarder before the end of next month.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Debatoy Lo
Rich Potash Co.

email_chain.subject: Re: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lo,

Could you please specify the origin and destination ports for the shipment?

Best regards,
Elaine
Elegant Trading Co., Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Elaine,

You can find more information on our websites: www.richpotash.com and www.chinaopticalpotash.com.

Best regards,
Debatoy Lo
Rich Potash Co.

email_chain.subject: Re: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lo,

We can take in the goods from China South ports, such as Xiamen or Nansha. Please provide us with a Statement of Requirements (SOR) and place your order after confirming all details.

Best regards,
Elaine
Elegant Trading Co., Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Preliminary Quote for Potassium Hydroxide Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Elaine,

Thank you for your response. We will send out the goods by the end of September. Could you please confirm which port in South China you will use for receiving the goods?

Best regards,
Debatoy Lo
Rich Potash Co.

email_chain.body: I have already checked the rate & route via ACS, please check for me, the rate for 1 40'HC from Hong Kong to Hai Phong. It has always been my pleasure to assist you. I am hoping that my service and representation will meet with your approval. I am pleased to advise that from your proposed origin in Hong Kong, the vessel can provide coverage on the 12th April with transshipment at Shenzhen or Zhuhai subject to you confirming booking of slot and handing over the goods from Shenzhen or Zhuhai to the ship at our agreed rate and providing on board payment which I am enclosing herewith for your ease of reference. The rate I offer you is exclusive of any cost relating to handling at Shenzhen or Zhuhai port.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about BIBL and Rates
email_chain.body: Are you going to add 250USD as a 'shipping cost' as well? Or is it included in your quote?

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about BIBL and Rates
email_chain.body: This is not related to the quote. I want to ask if you are planning to charge 250USD for the cost of handling the cargo at either Shenzhen or Zhuhai? If so, please quote me including that, please.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about BIBL and Rates
email_chain.body: The cost for handling at both places is 250 USD. You can find the cost in the calculation.

- Port of Destination: Cartagena

John (Eriq) Xu

email_chain.subject: RE: Isopropanol quote for Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your reply. Could you please provide us with a freight quote for loading 4,800MT of isopropanol from Houston to Cartagena? I am waiting for your reply.

Regards,
Markus Leidinger

email_chain.subject: RE: Isopropanol quote for Houston to Cartagena
email_chain.body:
Hi Markus,

I would like to have your assistance on this matter. I have been in communication with an agent in Cartagena, and he informed me that isopropanol is extremely dangerous to transport. He is trying to deter us and has offered an alternative product at the price you provided.

The supplier is directly from the US, and I think there is no reason for any third party to be involved in the transaction. To be honest, the suppliers are not even prepared to sell the product at the prices you quoted. For this reason, I don’t think we will be able to do business with you. I would appreciate it if you could kindly refund the advance payment of 1,200 USD.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter.

Best Regards,
Mahesh Nambiar

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Styrene from Singapore to Surabaya

Shelley

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote for Styrene from Singapore to Surabaya
email_chain.body:
Hi Shelley,

Thank you for your inquiry. Below is our pricing for next month:

- FOB Cargo Discharging Terminal Charge: US$14/MT
- WSF: US$18.5/MT
- Brokerage: US$18.5/MT
- Others: US$0

If the shipper requires a safety certificate (MED cert), it will cost US$50 per piece for an Indonesian flag vessel and US$150 per piece for a foreign flag vessel.

If you need further details about our pricing system, feel free to contact our office directly. We are always happy to assist!

Best regards,
Kudet Prawanto

Matt

email_chain.subject: Re: Cement Transport
email_chain.body:
Hey Matt,

We can handle 100,000 tonnes a year for you, provided you agree to an annual contract. The best rate we can offer is $60 per tonne, plus an additional $5 in extra charges. The extra charges are due to a discount we receive from the port authority in Israel for shipping at least 100,000 tonnes annually.

Additionally, I can offer you a discount if you opt for shipping insurance, which would add $3 per tonne. You will also need to deposit $20,000 into our account before we commence shipping. The freight will be FOB, meaning you will be responsible for all charges related to moving the cement from the terminal to your desired location.

Let me know if you are interested. I am preparing a contract form for you to sign.

Yours truly,
Ha

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment from Busan to Tianshan
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. John,

Can I please confirm if you have space for 2,000MT of bitumen from Busan to Tianshan? Please let me know if any pre-advise will be required for customs clearance.

Many thanks,
Johnny

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment from Busan to Tianshan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johnny,

Thank you for your inquiry.

In order to make an offer, we would need to know the date of shipment, vessel, and cargo type. If the vessel is not chartered, we can suggest the estimated rates.

If the vessel is already on charter and the vessel type is known, then we can suggest the freight rate. In the above two cases, an offer is being provided but it is not a fixed rate.

If the vessel has already been loaded, then a time charter rate must be negotiated. In the case of a time charter, the vessel owner may expect at least 2 voyages to break even.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote and General Terms & Conditions
email_chain.body:

We will be loading 4,000MT of cargo on the MV Jun-Sea and would like a quote for the voyage from Jeddah to Bremen. Can we have a copy of the General Terms & Conditions?

Kind regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote and General Terms & Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Thank you for your inquiry. We are currently reviewing the details and will provide you with a quote shortly. In the meantime, I have attached a copy of our General Terms & Conditions for your reference.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Container Shipment to Shanghai
email_chain.body:

1. All documents including the Bill of Lading will be delivered to the ship owner by e-mail.
2. There is no cargo already in the container. The seller will provide the container at their own cost and liability.
3. The seller has completed all the necessary documents, such as export declaration, insurance.

Please let us know if you can assist with this shipment.

Best regards,
Johnny

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Annabelle,

Thank you for your email. I have several storage tanks and packing equipment available and can accept a 5,000MT shipment of waste plastic film starting July 28. The lead time for tanking the plastic film will be about four days. I can handle the loading, stuffing, and lashing, but you will need to handle the fixing and sealing of the hatch. Could you confirm if the cargo will use a hatch cover or be double-containerized? This will help me make the necessary storage arrangements.

Regarding the last two shipments, we cannot accept the $2,500 condition as terminal handling fees and port storage costs are already included in the quoted price. A rate adjustment would be necessary.

Best regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

Our cargo will use a hatch cover. The cargo for the past three shipments will arrive in Tianjin tomorrow. We expect the same quality as before. Please have the cargo loaded as soon as possible and arrange for delivery to our designated terminal before August 15. If everything goes as expected, we will make arrangements for the second shipment.

Best regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Scarlett,

Thank you for your email. Our storage tanks are now available for your cargo. We will need a 10-ton forklift for loading, and your cargo will need to use the hatch cover. Due to ongoing building works, we have limited free space, and only a bit of room for our trucks to maneuver around the storage tanks. Please advise the last day we will need to load this cargo to our storage tanks. We expect the cargo to be in good condition and hope that the waiting time at the terminal will not affect your schedule.

Regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Scott,

10 tons of cargo were loaded yesterday, but we still have some cargo remaining. Please advise the last day we will need to load this cargo to our storage tanks. We expect the cargo to be in good condition and hope that the waiting time at the terminal will not affect your schedule. Please note that the available forklifts can only lift a maximum of 10 tons at a time.

Regards,
Scarlett

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Scarlett,

The cargo was loaded yesterday, and I will make arrangements for the delivery to the port as soon as possible. We have some pending works in the area that may cause traffic congestion, but we hope this will not delay the delivery. A team will be stationed at the port to ensure smooth delivery. However, due to the ongoing works, there might be some delays.

Regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Waste Plastic Film Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Scarlett,

Please be advised that the cargo was delivered at 10 a.m. this morning. Our team will keep track of the cargo at all times and will update you on its movement in case we need to deliver it before the scheduled date. We look forward to doing business with you.

Regards,
Mrs. Scott

email_chain.subject: Impact of Seablue Grounding on Crude Fixing
email_chain.body:
Hi Kathy,

Has the grounding of the Seablue had any impact on your crude fixing level for the short term?

Thanks,
Blayney

email_chain.subject: Re: Impact of Seablue Grounding on Crude Fixing
email_chain.body:
Hi Blayney,

Not at all. Seablue is a crude vessel, and almost all crude cargoes have been fixed by the other time-chartered tankers coming out of Chinese yards.

As I mentioned previously, if Seablue did not come out in China, other tankers would come out of the dock and China would be fixed. These tankers would operate at a price level set by the most competitive time charter tanker, which is the drydocked Seablue. Therefore, the price level at which China is fixed would not be different even if Seablue was out of the drydock.

LPG cargoes are different since we cannot use LPG in crude tankers, and crude cargoes are not as easy to fix as LPG, since many producers are contracted and certain prices are set.

The next drydocked Seablue is in...

Best regards,
Kathy

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Cobalt Shipment
email_chain.body:

We’re interested in moving 12,000MT of cobalt from Las Palmas to Odessa. Could you please let us know when your vessel is available?

Regards,
Agnes

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Cobalt Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Agnes,

A.Z.B. Atlantic Voyage, 6,000 DWT, gross, was in service on 7/2/2021 for the route Las Palmas to Odessa but is now out of service. Please let us know if you have any available vessels.

Best regards,
Barbara J.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Cobalt Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Barbara J.,

We’re still interested in moving 12,000MT of cobalt from Las Palmas to Odessa. Could you please let us know when your vessel is available?

Regards,
Agnes

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Cobalt Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Agnes,

As previously mentioned, A.Z.B. Atlantic Voyage, 6,000 DWT, gross, is now out of service. Please let us know if you have any available vessels.

Best regards,
Barbara J.

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Cobalt Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Agnes,

Z.A.B. Atlantic, 20,000 DWT, gross, built in 2012, was in service on 10/8/2021 for the route Hong Kong to LA, carrying 11,991 DWT of soybeans, but is now out of service. Please let us know if you have any available vessels.

Best regards,
Barbara J.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ann,

You mentioned that your vessel (Sternship) arrives in Qingdao around May 10th, and that you're open to discuss 4,800MT of crude oil from Tianjin to Qingdao. What is your estimated laytime? Also, could you quote CIF?

Thanks,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Mike,

Glad to hear from you. The vessel has arrived in Qingdao on May 16th. For the same product, I have the quotation CIF for your reference. Could you let me know your thoughts?

Best regards,
Ann

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ann,

Thanks for the information. We are interested in your pricing. Thanks for the email.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

With regard to the pricing for the crude oil CIF Qingdao, we shall charge US$22.00/MT on FOB plus CFR charges of US$4.00/MT. I will forward the detailed bill of lading with insurance in the next email.

Best regards,
Ann

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ann,

Thanks for the quote. We will reply back to you as soon as we receive the price.

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

I've forwarded the price list. If you could please provide your desired product price range, we could inform you as soon as possible. Thanks for your patience.

Best regards,
Ann

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation - Naphtha
email_chain.body:
Dear Ann,

We request your quotation for 5000 MT FOB for the following:

PRODUCT: Naphtha
Delivery: FOB Tianjin at anchorage
Tank bottom temperature below 55°C
Tank: bottom no cracks or scratches
Close tank opening angle between 10°

Best regards,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Wang,

We have a 11,200MT bulk booking of iron ore fines originating from Lianyungang and bound for Qingdao. Could you check your earliest slot availability and share a ballpark freight, based on NCB’s guidance?

Looking forward to your advice.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thanks Lawrence,

I checked on availability but both legs are still tight. Sorry, I could not help on this occasion.

Thank you and sorry for not helping.

Best regards,
Sammy

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the update Sammy,

I will advise our Chartering Manager (Mr. Doug, chartering.mgr@nbigroup.com).

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Lawrence,

I am the Chartering Manager, also from ABG. I checked on this booking but will you please explain why this is only for 11,200MT? This is not usually the size of shipment.

And I have checked all the schedules but couldn't find any open slots at all. Our maximum charterers' credit limit is $4M and vessel's $1M. Could you please check again and give us some price guidance?

Best regards,
Doug

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Doug,

I do not know why the shipment is only for 11,200MT. As to the vessel's credit limit, we have a blank vessel from Sinil lines which will sail from Qingdao to Haiphong. The charterer has issued a full credit, and the full trip rate is $41,000.

I am waiting for an update from my colleague, who is on leave now.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Lawrence,

I can suggest you the best, the way to charter is to rely on a good credit insurance to cover all risks. Otherwise, how do you want to go ahead and do the charterer in Hong Kong to sign the credit limit?

A reputable credit insurance should insure the credit. In a credit insurance, an ABG can find a solution for a charterer in Hong Kong. Otherwise, your chartering manager from ABG is free.

Best regards,
Doug

email_chain.subject: Re: Iron Ore Fines Booking Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Lawrence,

We have received the schedule from your team but we still have no slots available. I have checked with your office but they are not aware of the vessel availability. Please send us the availability of the vessel if you have any.

Best regards,
Sammy

email_chain.subject: Request for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Dr. Al-Bashir,

Could you ship 2,000 barrels of gasoline from Genoa to Bridgetown this week? We have recently received a market quotation but have no way of verifying its accuracy and wish to discuss it.

Best regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Financing Details for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dr. Al-Bashir,

We are extremely interested in moving forward with our transaction. We can finance 50% of the $800,000, and we need to know how you will finance the other $400,000. I am prepared to wire you $100,000 towards the transaction on the condition that you forward the other $300,000 (and the ship documents) within 10 days of receiving this deposit. I understand that this is a small amount relative to the transaction, but I am sending you this deposit on the condition that it will be returned within 14 days if you are not able to complete the transaction. Since this is not a substantial amount, I expect that you will not have any difficulty in wiring me back the $100,000. I am sending you this cash transfer request by express courier today. Please send me a confirmation of the receipt of my transfer.

Best regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing Details for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Raymond,

I am really sorry for the delay on our side. I was out of the office due to personal reasons for a few days. We have paid all our bills and we have enough funds. I just need your Bank’s Swift Code and your Account Number, then we can proceed to making the payment today.

Regards,
Mohammed al-Bashir
Managing Director
World Holdings

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing Details for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. al-Bashir,

My bank in the Bahamas will be expecting $300,000 today for your company. I understand that you will be wiring me $100,000 as soon as you receive the funds. I will inform my bank that they should expect your wire transfer. Thank you, again.

Sincerely,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing Details for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. al-Bashir,

This email is attached. I hope this is acceptable to you. We understand that you wish to start the transaction, but you must not expect any additional funds from us. We can only provide the funds for the oil and the delivery of the oil. Your company, at this point, must make payment for the delivery of the oil.

Regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Re: Financing Details for Gasoline Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. al-Bashir,

Please find the attached document. I hope this is acceptable to you. We understand that you wish to start the transaction, but you must not expect any additional funds from us. We can only provide the funds for the oil and the delivery of the oil. Your company, at this point, must make payment for the delivery of the oil.

Regards,
Raymond

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 95 RON Unleaded Gasoline
email_chain.body:
I am from the Steel Industry. I would like to buy your 95 RON unleaded gasoline today. I prefer unloading in Luanda. If you are close to Angola, please respond with your offer including price, quantity, and ETA.

Yours sincerely,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Response to 95 RON Unleaded Gasoline Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good day,
We have received your email regarding the supply of 95 RON unleaded gasoline. We would prefer to load at Dunga and to give you a sample, we will pay for it via our Mastercard. However, we need to have the letter of guarantee from the banks with which you will sign the contract.
Furthermore, we will need you to tell us the final price including transport, taxes, and duties. We will do all that is necessary to have the deal finalized. Once we load the goods, we will pay in full with a bank transfer.
We are expecting your prompt reply.

Yours faithfully,
Stalber
Please reply back to info@coalzora.com

labels.discharge_port: Singapore, Amman, Kuwait Port, Bahrain Port, Luanda

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Palm Kernel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

I have a shipment of palm kernel oil coming from Port Klang to Male. I’d like to move 5,000MT of oil. I’ve received an email from a freight forwarder in Port Klang, and I was wondering if you could help me with an indicative freight quote.

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request for Palm Kernel Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Mona,

Thank you for your enquiry. So, you’re looking for a freight quote to move 5,000MT of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male?

I’ll need more details about the cargo before I can provide a quote. Could you please let me know:
- The quality and cleanliness of the cargo,
- The minimum temperature the cargo must be kept at on board,
- If you require a refrigerated vessel, and
- What type of stowage is required.

Additionally, I’ll need to know who will arrange for the stowage, loading, discharge, and clearance, as this will affect the charges.

Please email all these details to me as soon as possible. Once I have the information, I’ll be able to provide you with an indicative freight quote.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about G20 Meeting Results
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are doing well. Can you tell me where I can find the results of the G20 meeting? I am particularly interested in the outcomes of the finance ministers’ meeting and what they have to say about future financial regulation.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Question on G20's Impact on Economic Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I am writing to you because I have a question about the impact of the G20 on economic regulation. Are you familiar with any economic models that have been developed to analyze the impact of the G20 on regulation?

I would appreciate your insight on this topic, as I am currently writing a paper on it for a course.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on G20 Meeting Outcomes
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are doing well. I am interested in learning more about the outcomes of the recent G20 meeting on financial regulation. Can you tell me if there were any particular highlights or agreements that stood out to you during the meeting?

I am also curious about the future of financial regulation in light of the G20's recommendations. Will these recommendations be enough to address the issues that were discussed at the meeting?

I would appreciate your insights on these questions, as I am currently researching this topic for a paper.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: G20's Role in Financial Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are well. I am writing to you because I have a question about the G20's role in financial regulation. As I understand it, the G20 is a group of the world's leading economies that comes together to discuss and set guidelines for the global financial system.

My question is, what role does the G20 play in promoting financial stability? Are there any specific regulations or guidelines that the G20 has put in place to prevent financial crises from occurring in the future?

I am particularly interested in understanding the role of the G20 in promoting transparency and accountability in the global financial system.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on G20's Role in Financial Regulation
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Moloney,

I hope you are well. I am writing to you because I have a question about the G20's role in financial regulation. As I understand it, the G20 is a group of the world's leading economies that comes together to discuss and set guidelines for the global financial system.

My question is, what role does the G20 play in promoting financial stability? Are there any specific regulations or guidelines that the G20 has put in place to prevent financial crises from occurring in the future?

I am particularly interested in understanding the role of the G20 in promoting transparency and accountability in the global financial system.

Thank you for your time and consideration. I look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Lawrence

email_chain.subject: Client Satisfaction Survey Results
email_chain.body:
Good day Amanda,

In the recent survey, how many clients are not completely happy with our services? Could you please provide a detailed explanation for the reasons why they are not satisfied with our service?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Yuma

email_chain.subject: Re: Client Satisfaction Survey Results
email_chain.body:
Thank you so much, Yuma. I will explain in detail what our customers are saying about our service. As you can see, the report provided to us by our clients highlights a few issues with delivery in some areas of Australia.

I will list down the areas that need urgent attention in our package to avoid further issues. If you need more information on this, I will provide that to you as requested.

Thanks,
Amanda

email_chain.subject: Re: Client Satisfaction Survey Results
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Amanda. That sounds good. We need to get to the bottom of these service concerns. Who in your team will be able to give me more detail on this? I'd like to speak to someone soon.

Kind regards,
Yuma

email_chain.subject: Request for Margin Fee Assistance
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Our Singapore client would like to transport 2,800MT of naphtha from Baltimore to Dahej, but we don’t have enough funds on hand for the margin fee. Could you spot us?

Hope you can help.

Best regards,
Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Margin Fee Assistance
email_chain.body:
Hi Kim,

Not a chance! Hope you can spot my answer.

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Margin Fee Assistance
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your reply.

Our Singapore client is Singapore Energy, one of the leading trading and logistics companies in Asia Pacific. They represent a major Japanese refiner, Osaka Gas.

It’s true that this is a complicated trading project and we have to pay a relatively high margin fee of USD 1,000,000.

If you don’t mind, I can arrange to send you the contract and payment procedure, so that you can fully understand the situation.

Have a good day.

Best regards,
Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Margin Fee Assistance
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your reply.

I am really sorry to trouble you. My name is Alihac, Assistant to the CEO of Singapore Energy.

I’d like to discuss with you about the details of the project.

Please let me know when you are free.

Best regards,
Kim

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for Gasoil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hey X,

I need a vessel for 8,000MT of gasoil from Durban to Walvis Bay. Could you confirm if a mid-June laycan works for you, and are port dues included in your quote?

Many thanks,
Precious

email_chain.subject: Draft Agreement for Gasoil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Katty,

Please check below.

Regards,
Tamir

[Draft Agreement]:
Voyage Charter Party
Cargo: 8,000MT Gasoil
Loading: Witfield, Durban
Discharging: Walvis Bay, Namibia
Laycan: Jun/18
Seaworthiness: Presentable condition
Estimated Delivery Date (ETA): Jul/20
Freight: 100% CIF, including all freight and all related charges
Owners' Charterer's Commission: 2% on all freight paid by the Charterer to the Owner
Average Adjustment: If the difference between the CIF port of discharge and CIF MRC varies more than 50ct / pmt, Owners and Charterer agree to share the adjustment 50:50
Freight Payment: Owners shall submit a request for payment to Charterer. Payment shall be made upon receipt

email_chain.subject: Chartering Costs for Gasoil Transport
email_chain.body:
Hi Tamir,

As discussed on the phone, here are our chartering costs for you:

- Estimated freight (S/D: CIF-MRC 91.00 USD / pmt)
- Estimated bunkers consumption @ 160 pmt/day
- Estimated port dues: 1400 USD (Durban) & 500 USD (Walvis Bay)
- Estimated freight commission: 2% on freight

Total:
- 70000 USD
- 16000 USD
- 1900 USD
- 1400 USD

Total: 90500 USD

With the exception of port dues, these are all estimates. Bunker consumption will be updated in our contract based on your data.

We will also submit a draft chartering contract for your reference in the next few days. If you have any questions, please let us know.

Thanks,
X

email_chain.subject: Re: Draft Agreement for Gasoil Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Tamir,

Thank you for your reply, the chartering costs sound reasonable. We will check with our Principals and come back to you if we have any questions.

Regards,
Katty
FAL

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Shipping Inquiry for 27 Containers of Women's Clothing
email_chain.body:

We have 27 containers of women's clothing that need to be shipped from Australia to Shanghai as quickly as possible. We are willing to pay extra charges for expedited shipping.

Could you please confirm when the shipment can be arranged?

Thank you,
Tanya

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Shipping Inquiry for 27 Containers of Women's Clothing
email_chain.body:
Dear Tanya,

Thank you for your inquiry. I will check the exact transit time with our office in Shanghai and get back to you shortly. Once confirmed, you can proceed with the payment of any extra charges, and we will finalize the shipment details.

You will receive a shipping quote from Ms. Yang shortly.

Best regards,
Yang

Please note that the shipment is still pending departure from our warehouse. It will soon be loaded onto the vessel and transported to Shanghai.

Yours sincerely,
Yang

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Urea Shipment

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Booking Request
