email_chain.subject: Grain Transshipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Cooper,

We are considering two options for transshipments of grain from New York to Vladivostok. Please advise your ETA for your next sailing from each port and the expected transit time for each option.

Regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Marina,

Thank you for your inquiry. Below is our schedule for the upcoming sailings from New York:

ETA          Port          Days at Port
Nov 23       New York      1
Nov 26       New York      1
Nov 27       New York      1
Nov 28       New York      1
Nov 30       New York      1
Dec 2        New York      1
Dec 3        New York      1
Dec 4        New York      1
Dec 5        New York      1
Dec 7        New York      1
Dec 8        New York      1
Dec 9        New York      1
Dec 11       New York      1
Dec 12       New York      1

Please let me know if you need further details.

Kind regards,
Mr. Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cooper,

Thank you for the schedule. I have a few additional questions regarding your operations:

1. What does the above schedule imply for transit times?
2. How many times per year can you load at New York?
3. Can you accept transshipments of grain from other European ports (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany)?
4. How many times per year can you transship to Vladivostok from Europe?
5. What do your services entail?
6. Can you store bulk products in your vessels?
7. Do you have terminals in New York or Vladivostok?
8. What is your exact transshipment capability?

I appreciate your assistance!

Best regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Marina,

Apologies for the delay in responding. Here are the answers to your questions:

1. The transit time would be approximately 4 weeks. We normally handle bulk containers (20 feet and 40 feet), but we can accommodate other vessels if needed. We do not usually carry these products, but we can manage up to 15,000 tons per trip.
2. We can accept transshipment of grain from other European ports (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany). Transshipments from Europe occur every two weeks, with transshipment to Vladivostok once per month. You can also order grain from these ports for transshipment in the United States.
3. Our services include transshipment of grain from the United States and from Europe to Vladivostok.

I will address the remaining questions in my next email.

Kind regards,
Mr. Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Marina,

Continuing from my previous email:

4. We do not have terminals in New York or Vladivostok.
5. We have been providing these services for over 5 years.
6. Yes, we can store grains in our vessels.
7. Our transshipment capability is 70,000 tons.
8. We currently have 6,000 tons of grain in our inventory in the United States.

Please let me know if you need further clarification.

Kind regards,
Mr. Cooper

email_chain.subject: Re: Grain to Vladivostok
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cooper,

Thank you for your detailed responses. Your service is excellent and unique, which is very interesting to us. If possible, could you provide the following additional information:

1. Your average transshipment capacity in the United States.
2. Your average transshipment capacity in Europe (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany).

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Marina

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Woo,

Could you please provide a 7-day freight estimate for 25,000MT of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

25,000 tons of oil from Copenhagen to Lagos in a seven-day freight? That's quite a bit of oil. I assume you need to ship it by sea.

The oil trade operates on a just-in-time inventory management model, whereby oil is shipped to tankers as needed. This provides a stable supply and demand, eliminates inventory storage costs, and prevents oil from degrading over time.

Since your request involves shipping 25,000 tons of oil in seven days, my freight quote estimate would exceed what is available. Please confirm that your request is for 25,000 tons of oil in a seven-day freight, and I can provide a quote to the maximum that is available to my company.

Thanks,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

Yes, my request is for 25,000 tons of oil for shipping in seven days to Lagos, Nigeria. Could you please provide a quote?

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Again, shipping 25,000 tons in seven days is an unusual request. If you are shipping this amount of oil in an outbound tanker, then the only companies capable of doing so are Shell, Chevron, and Exxon. I don't have contacts with these companies.

If you're shipping by sea, then you'll need a port in Copenhagen to load onto a tanker. I've emailed my contacts in the seaport of Copenhagen. They'll be in touch with me in the morning.

If you're shipping by road, then the quantity would need to be in 45-liter plastic oil drums. The storage space and legal limitations of this option would be impossible to organize in such a short time frame.

I'm going to have to say 'no' to your request for shipping 25,000 tons of oil in seven days. I'm also saying 'no' to your request to contact the seaport in Copenhagen. If you insist, I'll let my seaport contacts know to contact you, but don't expect a reply.

I'm sorry, but I simply don't have the resources to fill your request. I'm going to have to recommend you submit your request to one of the three large oil companies I mentioned before.

I'd like to thank you for your business.

Regards,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

I am absolutely okay with you contacting the seaport in Copenhagen. I understand that you don't have the resources to fulfill my request. I will be submitting my request to an oil company.

Thanks,
Felipe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Felipe,

Yes, I've contacted the Copenhagen seaport. They say you're 'absolutely okay' with me contacting them? You see, the contact I've made at the seaport of Copenhagen is the Director. He's a very important person who receives hundreds of emails from oil dealers like yourself, so he just needs to be advised that the shipping in question is okay. He's very busy, but if he doesn't reply within two weeks, please email him directly to remind him. You can just copy me on the email.

This is your second response that implies you're okay with me contacting the seaport, so I'm sending you a copy of this email for your reference.

Thank you,
Perry

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Perry,

Yes, please contact the seaport in Copenhagen. I will be submitting my request to an oil company.

Thanks,
Felipe

If there are any issues with shipment or delivery, we will need a copy of a report with box numbers clearly visible.

With warm regards,
Steven

email_chain.subject: Request for Marine Gasoil Delivery in Onne
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelsey,

We require 8,000 metric tons of marine gasoil (MGO) to be delivered in Onne, Nigeria, starting from February 1st. Could you please confirm the pricing basis and provide an estimated delivery window?

Many thanks,
Alexander

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Marine Gasoil Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelsey,

Could you clarify the details of the marine gasoil you are requesting? Specifically, I need to know the MT grade, whether it’s bulk or drums, and any other relevant specifications. I’m having a bit of trouble following the initial request.

Thanks,
Doug

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Marine Gasoil Request

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Rates for 7,500MT of Oil Seed Cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Lewis,

Could you please confirm the rates for 7,500MT of oil seed cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul? Additionally, I would appreciate details on the length of the laycan and any additional costs associated with accelerated discharge.

Regards,
Katherine

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Rates for 7,500MT of Oil Seed Cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Hi Katherine,

The following rates apply:
- Spot: $50 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/5/20 (laycan 7-10 days),
- Extended: $40 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/10/20 (laycan 10-14 days),
- Longer: $30 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/15/20 (laycan 14-21 days).

The above includes a fixed delay rate (FDR) of $5 per day for the first 7 days, then $10 per day thereafter (e.g., if the vessel is delayed 8 days, FDR is $70 - ($5x7) + ($10x1)).

Please note that the above rates do not include accelerated discharge charges.

Best regards,
Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Rates for 7,500MT of Oil Seed Cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Hello Katherine,

Thank you for your inquiry and interest in working with us. I’d like to highlight a few additional points for your consideration:

* **Additional Charges**: The rates provided do not include accelerated discharge charges for cargo exceeding 35 days, which will be borne by the seller. Please factor this into your calculations.
* **Vessel Availability**: Vessel availability may be limited during April-May 2023 due to the busy season. We have a few vessels available at the quoted rates, but they are currently engaged in previous trades and will require 20-30 days' notice to arrange a ballast leg. I recommend booking a vessel now to secure the rates.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards,
Lewis

labels.demurrage: $5 per day (first 7 days), $10 per day thereafter

email_chain.subject: Flexibility on Nailing and Lashing at Montevideo
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

How flexible are you on the nailing and lashing at Montevideo?

Thanks,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Flexibility on Nailing and Lashing at Montevideo
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

Montevideo is flexible on this issue, provided the requirements of the Church History Museum are met. The museum is constructing a rock wall with hand-hewn timbers as the base to support the rocks. This entire wall will be built inside the museum to display the room. Two of our timbers will be hung from the inside of this rock wall using chains. The nailing requirements for these timbers will be strictly adhered to during the construction of the display.

The museum has requested that the side of the timbers facing the rock wall be prepared for display with some protective material. However, the museum will decide on the type of protective coating to be used. The only nailing required at the museum will be for the display setup.

Best regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Shipping Timbers to Denmark
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

We are planning to take the timber to Denmark. I was wondering about shipping options. Should we ship them, or would it be better to transport them across Europe in a pickup truck?

If you could advise me on this, I would really appreciate it.

Thanks,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Timbers to Denmark
email_chain.body:
Dear Bob,

We recommend that you transport the timbers yourself. We have included some additional information below to address your questions.

We need to know if you are interested in the display materials we have available for your timber, as well as the additional display material recommended by our representative in Denmark.

You can find our current brochure, including prices and descriptions, at the following website: [website link]. Additionally, in the attachments, you will find a form to fill out and return to us with payment.

One of the timbers can be sent via FedEx, which will cost approximately 1,000 Danish Kroner.

Best regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Anthony,

We’d be happy to assist with this shipment. Could you clarify a few details?

1. Are you looking for a newbuild or secondhand vessel?
2. Is a firm charter preferred, or are you open to other options?
3. Could you confirm if your clients require FOB or CIF terms?
4. Are they specifically requesting a Chinese-registered vessel, or are other registries acceptable?

I’ll also check with our local manager in Singapore to see what we can offer.

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

Thank you for your reply. Our client has provided the following details:

1. The vessel must have a certificate of compliance.
2. They prefer a newbuild vessel.
3. A firm charter is required, not a time charter.
4. For the charter party, they would like to use the Norwegian Shipbrokers’ standard form.

Let me know if you need further details.

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Pre-print Submission for Review
email_chain.body:
Dear Michael and Raphael,

I have submitted the latest version of our joint paper, 'Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness and Voiculescu's Transferral Principle,' to Ann. Pol. Math. for review. The updated version includes significant revisions to address the gaps in the proofs of Theorem 4.1 and Theorem 5.1 by Voiculescu, particularly in the context of non-self-adjoint operator algebras and relative freeness.

You can access the pre-print here (after a short registration). The previous version is also available for reference.

Best regards,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-print Submission for Review
email_chain.body:
Hi Denis,

Thank you for the update. I’ve reviewed the latest version, and the revisions look solid. I particularly appreciate the clarity in addressing the gaps in Voiculescu’s theorems. Let’s hope the reviewers find it as thorough as we do.

Best,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-print Submission for Review
email_chain.body:
Dear Denis and Michael,

I agree with Michael—the revisions are well-executed. The additional context on non-self-adjoint operator algebras is particularly insightful. I’ve also shared the pre-print with a few colleagues for informal feedback, and the response has been positive so far.

Looking forward to the next steps.

Best,
Raphael

email_chain.subject: Re: Pre-print Submission for Review
email_chain.body:
Thank you both for your feedback. I’m glad the revisions are well-received. I’ll keep you updated on any developments from the journal. Fingers crossed for a smooth review process!

Best,
Denis

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Refrigeration for Palm Kernel Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

I am looking to move 5,800 metric tons of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Could you advise on how the refrigeration is managed in the holds?

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Refrigeration for Palm Kernel Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The refrigeration is achieved through a ventilation system that draws air through ice-cold seawater. This air is then used to maintain the appropriate temperature for the goods. Please note that our ships do not have refrigeration in the holds. However, we have rooms designed for bulk goods that could accommodate the palm kernel oil. It should fit in one or two such rooms, with a loading rate of 7-8 tons per hour.

The maximum weight per carcase is 1,500 kg, as the container cannot handle heavier loads. To prevent damage during loading, we have made special arrangements. The shell of the palm kernel oil must be sealed after loading, and we recommend using a special sealing material for this purpose. I can send you a sample of this material if you wish.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director, Kleine Business Consultancy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Refrigeration for Palm Kernel Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

Thank you for the detailed information. I can arrange for the product to arrive in 20 ft containers. The dimensions of the largest container are 140cm x 75cm x 37cm, and the heaviest weighs 1,270 kg. We will need five containers.

I can arrange for the sealing material. Could you provide the dimensions of the rooms you mentioned?

Thanks again,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Refrigeration for Palm Kernel Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The rooms are approximately 8.5m by 2.9m, with a height of 2.8m. This should be sufficient for your needs. Using containers is indeed the best way to transport the palm kernel oil. We have also made arrangements for transporting the product in ISO containers.

If you encounter any difficulties, we can also load the goods at our port in Port Klang and transport them using our own trucks from there.

Should you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to let me know.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director, Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton
2196
Johannesburg
+27 (11) 684-3387
+27 (83) 322-5294 (mobile)
kleine@net

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Pyrophyllite Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

We'd like to ship 8,000MT of pyrophyllite ore from Aqaba to Mombasa next month. Could you let us know your best freight rate and vessel name for this shipment?

Best regards,
Ralph

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Pyrophyllite Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ralph,

Thanks for your inquiry. We are pleased to quote for this shipment as follows:

Vessel: XING LING
Sailing from: Qingdao on or about March 28, 2009
ETA: Mombasa on or about April 11, 2009

US$ 200/MT for a container load on FOB basis
US$ 180/MT for a container load on CIF basis

Above rate includes:
a) the freighting by vessel
b) cost of berthing of vessel at Mombasa
c) payment of standard port charges (for clearance and handling of goods)
d) payment of cost of container
e) our usual agency fee

Please note that the rate above does not include following charges:
a) cost of shipment of goods from Suez to Qingdao
b) cost of shipment of goods from Qingdao

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Pyrophyllite Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Matthieu,

Thanks for your reply. This is what the customer wants:

- We prefer to ship to Mombasa in containers. We can buy these in Qingdao.
- We require door-to-door service. Our agent will take care of all port handling in China, the inland transportation of the containers to the door in Mombasa, and collection of goods at the door after discharge.
- We prefer to arrange shipment and freight payment ourselves.
- Can you arrange the above service on a CIF basis, i.e., we would pay at Qingdao?

Could you please quote the total price for the above?

Thanks,
Ralph

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Pyrophyllite Ore Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ralph,

I'm pleased to submit the following quote:

The total cost to Mombasa will be provided shortly. Please bear with us as we finalize the details.

Best regards,
Matthieu

However, he requires your assistance in obtaining a full text copy of a specific chapter in the handbook of advanced methods in financial econometrics.

If possible, please provide a copy of this book chapter and advise whether a PDF format would be satisfactory.

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Janet Dowdwell

Regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Plass,

We plan to ship 8,000MT of steel products from Bremerhaven to Xiamen. Could you please confirm your bunker strategy, and do you anticipate any additional bunker surcharge?

Best regards,
Ana

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. I think we have corresponded regarding this shipment on two prior occasions and I am wondering what new information you have which needs to be verified. It is important to advise us as soon as possible of any changes, but we do not need this information repeated for every single email. Please do not take this as anything more than a reminder to help us to keep our emails as efficient as possible.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. I have checked the files you shared and I think it is important for you to realize that it is vital that your email be addressed to me personally. In this way I can verify what was said to who and how we agreed to proceed. Our supply chain works extremely hard to ensure that we do not make mistakes when communicating with our suppliers. It is important that you communicate with me and we have plenty of time to revise and respond. Please do not send incomplete information with vague suggestions as to who it is meant for and ask us to complete it in the future.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your email. Please reply to me personally with the same courtesy and professionalism. This information is incorrect. I hope that it does not reflect on the company for which you work. You do not answer our emails in a professional way. Your email is too vague. You need to include additional information and there are many things that you have omitted. Please do not think that we will make assumptions for you. You have included only one forwarder. We would be happy to discuss all details of your inquiry in a more personal way with you. We are excited about working with you, but you need to make the first step.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

I deeply apologize for any misunderstanding and have attached the revised version of my message. Please feel free to contact me for further clarification.

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Zhang,

Thank you for your email. I received your files. I hope you understand that we require more information from you. Your files do not contain important information for our operation. We want to provide you with our best service. We will respond once we have more information.

Regards,
Angie

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

We are very grateful for your email and want to apologize for any misunderstandings. We have corrected our email and we look forward to working with you.

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.subject: Re: Bunker Strategy Confirmation for Steel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Angie,

We are very grateful for your email. Unfortunately, we do not know what you mean. We are a young company. We are

Yours sincerely,
Zhang

email_chain.body:

Regards,
Dan

email_chain.body:

Thank you for your enquiry. A reply will be sent to you this evening.

Best regards,
Annette

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Dan,

We understand that you require shipping a 4,500MT shipment of cereals from New Orleans to Istanbul by 30 May. Please accept our quotation for this service at $115 per mt FOB New Orleans.

This includes our $35 per mt fuel surcharge and a $10 per mt surcharge for loading at New Orleans. Also, please note that your shipment will require the following insurance cover:
- General Average
- Warranties
- Freight Risk
- War Risks

You should confirm with your insurers that the vessels you will use have the appropriate cover.

We will happily provide you with the relevant documentation for your shipment and look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Mr. Jenks

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in Cargo Volume
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramón,

I am confused about the sea cargo volume of my vessel. According to the agreement, it should be 3,000 tons of Liquefied Petroleum Gas, with a total of 5,000 tons of oil. However, I'm looking at the cargo space of the GDDT-101 vessel, which is rated for 7,800 tons. How come you've shipped so much cargo? The remaining space should have been filled with some rice, but I see none in the photos you sent.

Please weigh the hull and contact me right away. Do you have any idea what your vessel will be rated? Do you want to remove some of the oil? Your vessel is large; the last time I was in an all-oil ship was in 2003.

Best regards,
Camille

Peter

Thank you for your inquiry. I am pleased to inform you that we do have a vessel available for the requested timeframe to transport 5,000MT of fertiliser. Our standard demurrage rate is $200 per day, applicable for no more than 7 days, or $5,000 per month. Please let me know if this is acceptable.

Kind regards,
Jessica

Dear Mr. Jones,

The reason for this email is to clarify a credit note that I have raised for you for invoice number 1234567 (STG 456.78).

The credit note pertains to one of your jobs with Red Star Logistics in January 2013. As you will see from the attached email, you did not pay the correct amount at the time, although you have now completed payment.

The reason I have raised the credit note is that I was unable to obtain full payment of the correct amount from your company at the time. The customer service representatives for your company at the time have not been able to offer a full explanation as to why this was so.

In my personal view, a credit note would have been acceptable at the time, but our records indicate otherwise.

Best regards,
Chris

We are currently considering the possibility of introducing new technology into our business systems.

In particular, we are considering upgrading our current telephone systems to new VoIP services.

I would like to hear your opinion on VoIP services and the potential benefits and costs of introducing such systems.

I would be most grateful for your response.

Many thanks,
Mark

email_chain.body:

Rami

Tanisha

Rami

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Official Offer

If you would be sending me a signed copy of the agreement then I will give you all the details. The rest can be filled at the time of delivery. Payment will be made at the time of the agreement and the balance upon delivery. The vessel which will be available for your cargo is MV Eleftheria.

Best Regards,
Rami

email_chain.body:
I didn't change this, or delete anything, and I'm sure you didn't either. This stuff is interesting for people researching email about 1 month before Halloween in 2013. Read more at: https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2013/11/post-9-11-censorship-post-9-11-censorship-and-right-know

The main site for this document is the National COPP.COM Defense Fund: http://copp.com

If you have an interest in law enforcement or the technical side of investigations, this resource may be valuable.

email_chain.subject: Request for Updated Cargo Manifest
email_chain.body:
Good Morning,

Please send an updated cargo manifest for our container No. 07123. It has a cargo description for 'Coal', but we need to know exactly what kind.

Yours Sincerely,
Yve Morgan

email_chain.subject: Updated Cargo Manifest and Proposal
email_chain.body: Your reply was received and I have updated the cargo manifest as you requested. I am forwarding a copy of it, along with our proposal for the 100 car shipment of coal, to both our export contacts in Quesling, and to your destination contacts in Pyongyang. Please check it over and let me know if you have any questions or concerns. The original e-mail to follow as an attachment.

email_chain.subject: Error in Cargo Manifest
email_chain.body:
It appears that there is an error in your cargo manifest. Please take a moment to re-check it before we deliver the cargo. The cargo manifest indicates that you are to receive an unknown quantity of coal, but the container number has been deleted from the manifest. I will need that number before we can begin to move this cargo. Please let me know the container number as soon as possible.

Yours Sincerely,
Marc Churchill

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: Thank you for your concern. The item in question is a drug, not coal. The description was a mistake, I apologize. It will take some time to rectify, as the program is not flexible. We are working on it. I have noticed that the cargo manifest lists a number of containers and cargoes. Would it be too much trouble to have your engineering team create a list of the contents of these containers?

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: The container number is not a mistake. It has been deleted from the manifest. Do you understand this?

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: No, I do not understand. Why has it been deleted?

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: I thought I said that I would not use a loaded container to transport coal, because it would not be able to fit everything that was needed to be transported. So I asked for a container with nothing in it, to be used for coal. The cargo manifest is a copy of the order. I do not need a container number, just the description of what is in the cargo.

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: The cargo manifest lists cargoes that are not in the containers you have sent. You must supply the correct containers.

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: How can you ask for cargoes if they have already been sent? I will check the numbers, but the cargo manifest has not been updated since you received it.

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Cargo Description
email_chain.body: The cargo manifest has been updated. Please check it again.

John

Andre

Best regards,
John

Thank you for your inquiry. I am interested in the cargo you’re offering, especially if it arrives in Piraeus in about 20 days. Could you provide more details on the conditions and terms of the shipment?

Kind regards,
Thomas Spears

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry and Guarantee Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Thomas,

The offer from Greece is as follows:

- Delivery: 20 days after loading (sea delivery).
- Payment: $220 per tonne.

Please note that this price is final, and there is no room for negotiation. I would appreciate it if you could let me know your thoughts on this offer.

With best regards,
Bob Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry and Guarantee Request
email_chain.body:
Dear Bob,

Thank you for the offer. Unfortunately, the terms are not acceptable to us at this time. We will consider other options and get back to you if we find a suitable arrangement.

Best regards,
Thomas Spears

Mr. Yi

Valerie

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Dry Bulk Ship Quote

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Dry Bulk Ship Quote

Valerie

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Timecharter Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Kadir,

- 5,000MT open hatch, up to 7,000MT capacity
- 1-month spot charter
- 15 days delivery between 23rd and 30th of October, latest
- Cargo: bulk or container
- Charter party: BIMCO
- Redelivery: 1-month period, 28th November – 28th December

Please find our latest availabilities below:

October: 23, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 30
November: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 11, 13, 14

Best regards,
John Lopez

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Demurrage Rate for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

We’re looking at sugar from Durban to Jakarta. Could you confirm your demurrage rate?

Warm regards,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Bag Size Consideration for Jakarta Shipment
email_chain.body:
For another seller we're considering for Jakarta, they have a bigger bag size (see attached). The quality looks the same though. Is this all right for the end customer?

All the best,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Follow-up Questions on Delivery and Costs
email_chain.body:
Thanks for confirming the demurrage rate.

Some further questions for you:

Are you planning to deliver to ports in South Sumatra as well? What would the cost be for trucks into Palembang?

And do you know who is currently running the factory on the Kertosono Estate? If it's restarted, would it have a competitive price?

Thanks,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Rates for Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
We have a few large transactions on the agenda for Indonesia and need to find out the demurrage rates for the ports we are considering for delivery. They are:

* Pelabuhan Umum Tanjung Priok
* Pelabuhan International
* Batamindo Batu Besi Port (near Batam Airport)
* Pelabuhan Internasional Tanjung Priok, Teluk Gadung, Bekasi

For these ports, please could you confirm the following information for each:

* Current monthly demurrage rate per twenty foot container
* Average waiting time at each port (how long is the waiting queue? If there are waiting lists, do we need to be on it to secure our port slot?)
* Trucks into Palembang or Jambi - distance / cost

Thank you,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rates for Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
Thanks so much for your fast response. That's very helpful.

Holly

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Hi Alya,

I just received a bitumen enquiry from a buyer in Durban. They are looking to buy 12,000 MT for delivery in Q4. Could you please provide me with the best freight quote and advise the ETA?

Thanks,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Giselle,

Hope all is well. Could you please clarify the product requirements? We will be able to provide a quotation once we have this information.

Thank you,
Alya

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Hi Alya,

The buyer is interested in 12,000 MT of bitumen, CIF Durban, for delivery in Q4 2022. We are currently unable to make a firm commitment as we do not have the product on hand. Once we know which product the buyer will take, we can provide a firm offer. I will email our product manager and have him provide you with the quotation. I will follow up once I have this.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
That would be most helpful. Thank you, Giselle.

Best regards,
Alya

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Alya,

Please find attached our quote for 12,000 MT of bitumen. Kindly review and revert to me.

Best regards,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Alya,

Thank you for the quote and contract. I would like to kindly request that you review and confirm whether this meets the customer's requirements. I have passed this onto our client for feedback. If we receive confirmation, we will aim to provide a firm offer within 2 working days and will inform you by the end of the day.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body: Please review and revert to me on the terms of payment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Alya,

We have the above in both CIF and CFR terms. Please review and revert to me. We will not be able to process your offer until we receive feedback from the customer. We look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body: The client wants the terms in the quote as well as the bank details. We will revert on the product and confirmation once we get feedback. We look forward to your response.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry for Durban
email_chain.body:
Could you please confirm that your product manager will provide the quotation with the below details:

- 20,000 MT bitumen for CIF delivery to Durban
- Transportation by clean tanker
- Insurance on board
- Seller has marine cargo insurance that covers up to and including Durban
- Letter of credit that has been negotiated in the amount of USD (FOB amount) in addition to the CIF amount plus 5% for the buyer's commission, and is valued at USD, valid from 1 January.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.body:

Sung Trading Co., Ltd. wishes your company well on the blessed occasion of the Lunar New Year. Sung Trading Co., Ltd.

email_chain.body:

This letter is to confirm that I have received your purchase order dated March 12, 2013, for the goods listed in your purchase order. I am writing this letter to confirm receipt of your purchase order and in compliance with the Nairobi City County Supply Chain Policy 2013. The terms of the purchase order are agreed upon by all parties, and any subsequent request for changes will have to be confirmed in writing by all parties in accordance with the Nairobi City County Supply Chain Policy 2013.

The delivery address and contact details of the purchaser can be found in the purchase order.

The Purchaser is to make all payments in accordance with the Nairobi City County Finance Policy 2013.

Mr. Semeta

email_chain.subject: Request for Assistance with Orthopedic Shoe Durability
email_chain.body:
I’m looking for some help, and I was hoping you could point me in the right direction. I work for a company that produces orthopedic shoes, and we’ve been getting a lot of complaints about our shoes falling apart. It seems to happen whenever a patient uses our shoes to do a heavy activity, like basketball or soccer. Our shoes are made with the same materials as the other brands that are out there, so I don’t understand why our shoes would be falling apart faster. I’m wondering if there’s something wrong with our manufacturing process, or if there’s some other reason that our shoes would be breaking more easily. Can you help me out?

Many thanks,
Jim

email_chain.subject: Vessel ORIFLAMM Survey Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

I have arranged for the vessel in question, ORIFLAMM, to make a call at Bimini next week so that you may arrange a survey of the vessel.

Her current schedule is as follows:
- Week 1: Load cargo in Houston, load fuel in New Orleans, voyage to Cuxhaven.
- Week 2: Load cargo in Cuxhaven, voyage to Halifax, load more cargo in Halifax, voyage to Boston, offload cargo in Boston.

She will then proceed to Bimini where the survey may be arranged.

I'll be in contact with you soon to finalize the survey details.

Sincerely,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel ORIFLAMM Survey Arrangement
email_chain.body:
Dear Enzo,

Just a quick note to say thanks for the logistics of arranging the survey in Bimini. My colleague and I will have a flight to Bimini on Thursday and will be staying at the Grand Isle Bimini Bay Resort. We'll be ready to meet the vessel at the survey dock on Friday.

Sincerely,
Stella

email_chain.subject: ORIFLAMM Survey Analysis
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

As promised, I have prepared a comprehensive analysis of the ORIFLAMM survey data, along with a list of repairs, ratings, and observations. You may review this document and advise us whether we should proceed to purchase the vessel or not.

There are a few issues with the vessel that are a cause for concern, however, it should be possible to address these issues without significantly compromising vessel integrity.

The main concerns are a cracked main engine bearing housing and the state of some of the steering equipment. I will recommend that the buyer have these issues looked at by a professional marine surveyor at the earliest opportunity.

Sincerely,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: Commission Business Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hey Paul,

I received an offer from a contact who wants us to run a commission business between Pakistan and Jeddah. According to him, this person in Pakistan can source any commodities directly from factories and ship them to Middle Eastern countries. My concern is how safe it is for us to engage in this commission business since we don't know this person personally. I assume that signing an agreement with the seller would provide some protection, but I would appreciate your advice on this matter.

Additionally, could you connect me with this person so I can get to know them better? They mentioned they can ship fresh fruits, vegetables, meat, and dairy products.

Thank you,
Fardos

email_chain.subject: Re: Commission Business Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Fardos,

The person working with Mohammed is very professional. They can connect you with the contact in Pakistan so you can negotiate terms and assess whether the opportunity is worth pursuing. Essentially, they are looking to import fresh produce from Pakistan to Jeddah and will cover the shipping charges. The peak season for these shipments is typically from April to September.

Since you are in the meat business, you might be able to secure favorable deals for them. The market in Jeddah is quite large. I will reach out to you on Facebook to facilitate the introduction, as you can find them in my friends list.

Also, do you have a suitable vessel for 5,000MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week?

Best regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Update on Mr. Abraham's Case
email_chain.body:
Dear Friends,

First of all, I would like to thank everyone who has expressed their concern regarding the recent news that appeared in the press on 6th July about Mr. Abraham. The news does not correspond to reality, and we have informed Mr. Abraham's lawyer about the necessary steps to correct it.

The court in New York has issued an interim order prohibiting the publisher from writing any further articles about Mr. Abraham in newspapers, magazines, or any other form of publication.

Finally, I wish to thank you all again and wish you all the best for your holiday.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Edmund Taylor

email_chain.subject: Misrepresentation in Recent Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

A recent article in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice misrepresents the facts about the case of Mr. Maurice Abraham, who has been serving time in a U.S. federal prison for the last 5 years.

On the 6th of July, an article titled 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release' appeared in the Irish Examiner. The article claims that a person going by the names 'H' and 'O'Toole' wrote to 'The Irish Independent' two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, which were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The writer of this article further stated that 'It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing...'

email_chain.subject: Incorrect Information in Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I would like to point out that some of the information published in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding the case of Mr. Abraham has not been fully investigated and is incorrect and misleading.

On the 6th of July, an article titled 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release' appeared in the Irish Examiner. The article claims that a person going by the names 'H' and 'O'Toole' wrote to 'The Irish Independent' two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, which were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The writer of this article further stated that 'It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax...'

email_chain.subject: Further Clarification on Misleading Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I would like to reiterate that some of the information published in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding the case of Mr. Abraham has not been fully investigated and is incorrect and misleading.

On the 6th of July, an article titled 'Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release' appeared in the Irish Examiner. The article claims that a person going by the names 'H' and 'O'Toole' wrote to 'The Irish Independent' two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, which were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The writer of this article further stated that 'It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax...'

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body: Greetings, Sir. We have a cargo requirement of ____________ MT of ________________ from _________________ to ________________. Could you please provide your best freight estimate for this shipment? Will you charge any additional fees if we miss the narrow laycan? Kind regards, ____________________________

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request
email_chain.body: Hello _____________, Unfortunately, we cannot honor your request as we were not provided with the necessary documents when the cargo arrived. With this information, we would like to inform you that: We are releasing the container (will provide you with the B/L number and copy of the B/L) in 5 business days. After this period, the cargo will be re-shipment and it will be handled as a new cargo. The new ETA will be on October ____, 2017. We will send a re-booking agent to inspect and release the cargo. Since there is no ETA for your carrier to pick up the cargo, we request your carrier to wait in station until the latest expected date for cargo arrival. If your carrier does not want to wait for the cargo arrival, we can arrange for storage for the cargo until the cargo arrival. However, we will need to discuss the storage fees separately.

email_chain.body:

I hope you are well.

Could you please tell me if you have available D6 Propylene Glycol? The list of substances is on page 13 of the annex, and the data sheets are on pages 14 and 15. We would need to have the electronic version.

Is there any substitution for this product? Could you please provide the CAS number of the product?

If you can send me an official quote, that would be perfect. If not, can you give me a timeframe on when I can have an official quote?

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on D6 Propylene Glycol
email_chain.body:
Dear Lina,

Regarding your questions:
- Do you have the D6 Propylene Glycol in stock, or can you send us a delivery date from the producer?
- Is there any substitute available? If yes, which product can we use instead?
- We would need an official quote. Could you please confirm when you can provide it?

Here is the electronic version of the GSO: https://business.gov.il/Regulations/Documents/%D7%93%D7%AA%20%D7%9B%D7%95%D7%AA%D7%97%20%D7%9C%D7%99%D7%A4%D7%9D%20%D7%91%D7%AA%D7%A1%D7%A8%D7%99%D7

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for Rice Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

Our customer is interested in chartering a medium-sized vessel to ship 6,000MT of rice from Manila to Lagos. Could you provide a sample contract with your typical terms and conditions?

Thank you,
Hector

email_chain.subject: Urgent Assistance Needed for Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

First of all, congratulations on your success and new position at Voyaca.com. I came across your profile on LinkedIn and found you very qualified to assist me in a very urgent matter.

A few years ago, I employed a ship broker by the name of Brian Hopkin from Thomas Hopkin & Co to help charter a vessel to ship my company's produce from Panama to the West Coast of the USA. Unfortunately, a few days into the voyage, the vessel ran aground and was a total loss. Not only did Brian misrepresent his ship owner to be a reputable one, he went ahead and used me to sign up an insurance contract for his own personal benefit, under the influence of alcohol. He connived with the insurance company to release his profit after the ship sank, but my company is still waiting for its share of the payout.

At the time, I wasn't aware that he had so much experience in ship brokerage. I learned his dishonesty at the expense of my company. He had forged documents showing a photograph of the vessel to the owners before shipping and didn't tell me about his limited experience as an underwriter. Now I am having trouble recovering the costs of the cargo.

Can you help me find a reliable ship broker to ship a product from Greece to Rotterdam? Can you advise on the best route, avoid legal and insurance mishaps, and ensure my company is protected against mishaps and liabilities?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Cieran

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry and Assistance Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Hector and Cieran,

Thank you for your inquiries.

Hector, please find attached a draft of our Charter Party Terms & Conditions for your review.

Cieran, I would suggest that you contact a reputable ship insurance broker to ensure that your company is adequately protected. I can recommend a few trusted brokers if you need assistance.

Best regards,
Mr. García

Tracy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Details

email_chain.subject: Invoice and Shipping Details

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Green,

Could you find a vessel to carry 1,600MT of toasters from Plymouth to Rotterdam? Can you find a vessel that will be ready to pick up the cargo on the 12th? Can you also help us with weekly demurrage rates?

Sincerely,
Renée

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Hello Renée,

Here you go! The transit time from Plymouth to Rotterdam is roughly 10 days with a cost of 600USD. However, if you'd like to load in Plymouth earlier, you can, but you will have to contact your buyer and let them know that they may have to pay demurrage on a portion of the cargo to make up for lost time. The weekly demurrage rate for waiting is 100USD per week, and the charge for storage is 25USD per day.

If this information is helpful to you, I will be happy to assist you further. If not, please feel free to contact me again.

Thanks!
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Hello Sam,

Thanks for the info. We will need the vessel to be loaded by the 6th, so I would like to have the invoice sent to my boss by the 3rd. This is just so that we can book space on another vessel in case your rates don't work with ours.

Let me know if there are any questions.

Best regards,
Renée

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Hello Renée,

I apologize for not replying to you in a timely manner. I've been quite busy recently, as I had 4 interviews last week. I will ensure the invoice is sent to your boss by the 3rd.

Let me know if there are any further questions.

Thanks!
Sam

email_chain.subject: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Everest,

You are working on a cargo from Mina Al Ahmadi to Ho Chi Minh City. I can offer your client an attractive contract if you ship from Gothenburg and Daesan. Could you please let me know if these are viable options?

Regards,
Tabitha

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Tabitha,

Your offer is interesting, but it must be designed individually for each shipment to the customer. Please let me know more about the route, the terms and conditions, and the port of loading. Could you please tell me more about the products that you offer?

Best regards,
Oscar Everest

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Everest,

We would be happy to provide you with more details. Our products can be of several types, but we do not specify the brands. If you specify the port of destination, we can define the most interesting directions.

Yours truly,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Vladimir,

Thank you for your kind reply. Unfortunately, I cannot provide you with the port of destination as we are still in the proposal stage. We plan to conduct a survey of our potential customers. I can reveal that they are primarily interested in cost-effective and reliable shipping options.

Best regards,
Oscar Everest

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Everest,

We always take into account our partners' needs and preferences. Regarding the list of potential customers you are interested in, we can choose the most suitable direction. Please send me the list, and we will be happy to assist you.

Yours sincerely,
Vladimir

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Proposal
email_chain.body:
Dear Vladimir,

Thank you for your letter. Our company is interested in the contract. The company was founded in the Russian Federation and has production sites in Germany and China. The cost of the cargo will be set individually for each shipment to our partner. In general, the cost of transportation is calculated based on the specific requirements of each shipment.

Best regards,
Oscar Everest

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Business Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Rob,

We would like to negotiate a deal for your company. Please send me your account information at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Business Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Jorge,

Thank you for your proposal. Before we proceed, I have a few questions to better understand your interests and preferences. Could you please answer the following questions?

1. What are your favorite movies?
2. What are your favorite websites?
3. Do you live alone?
4. Have you ever dated someone older than you?
5. Are you a cat or a dog person?
6. Do you prefer chicken or beef?
7. Have you ever used an online dating service?
8. What is your favorite color?
9. What kind of music do you like?

Disregard the actual questions, focus on what it says (Look for a pattern.).

So, can you tell me what they have in common?

Best regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Business Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Rob,

Answer: they have the word LOVE in common.

Best regards,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposal for Business Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Rob,

*To the LOVE of my life,,
*may our life be filled with LOVE,,
*We shall find each other soon enough,,
*remember how it felt to be young,,
*and listen to love songs with me on the radio,,
*I don't know why we keep walking the same road,,
*our little room is very spacious,,
*our family will be,,
*sending their regards,,
*I hope you'll be happy with me,,
*It's getting more & more difficult,,
*our physical distance,,
*How can I still not hold you,,
*my beloved that's how we say,,
*I have an appointment with you,,
*I hope to keep my appointment with you,,
*But if that is not possible,,
*I still love you,,
*hope you are doing fine.

Best regards,
Jorge

email_chain.subject: Request for Rate Estimate and Charter Party Advice
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

My buyer here in Oslo needs 600MT of MEG from Houston. Could you please provide a rate estimate for a spot voyage and advise on the signing of a charter party?

Cheers,
Kristina

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Rate Estimate and Charter Party Advice
email_chain.body:
Hi Kristina,

The current rate is in the $90s per ton (FOB Nola). Rates are firm at this level due to limited tonnage availability. Given the port congestion in Houston, we would only sign a charter party once the deal is confirmed. If the charter party includes a destination clause, it can be signed upon final confirmation.

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Estimate and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Here in Norway, we use the Krone as our currency. The rate would be 3,300,000 NOK per MT (FOB Nola). We can draft a charter party to cover our terms. If the MEG arrives early, we can store the cargo until needed.

Best,
Kristina

email_chain.subject: Comparison of FOB Quotation
email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

I received an FOB quotation from a Singaporean trader today and wanted to compare it with your quote. The details are as follows:

- 12,000MT of MEG FOB Nola (delivery within 2 weeks)
- 3,300,000 NOK per MT
- FOB USD 3,300,000
- Estimated delivery cost: 20,000 USD
- Charter party fee: 200,000 USD
- Insurance: 350,000 USD
- Total: USD 3,890,000

The above price includes a destination clause: 'Bill of Lading to be issued for Norwegian ports only.' How does your rate compare?

Best,
Kristina

P.S. According to a friend in the shipping department at a major Norwegian oil company, the port congestion in Houston is due to Hurricane Gustav.

email_chain.subject: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Jacobsen,

We have an inquiry for a suitable vessel to load 3,000MT of Urea at Arzew to discharge at Barcelona. Could you please send me a suitable freight rate for this cargo?

Thank you.

Best regards,
Stephan

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Stepan,

This is a reply to your email of today. I need your assistance to explain to me how your vessel is chartered. Is your vessel time charter or voyage charter? When you say time charter, I need to know the duration of the charter. When you say voyage charter, I need to know the vessel charter conditions, as in either BIMCO Vessel-Partner, Vessel-Space Charter party, a specific named Charter Party, or other clauses.

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Stepan,

This is a follow-up to my earlier email. I need your assistance to clarify how your vessel is chartered. Is your vessel time charter or voyage charter? If it is a time charter, please specify the duration. If it is a voyage charter, please provide details on the charter conditions, such as BIMCO Vessel-Partner, Vessel-Space Charter party, a specific named Charter Party, or other clauses.

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: RE: MV Virginia Express Freight rate inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Stepan,

I am following up on my previous emails regarding the chartering of your vessel. Could you please clarify whether your vessel is on a time charter or voyage charter? If it is a time charter, I need to know the duration. If it is a voyage charter, I require details on the charter conditions, such as BIMCO Vessel-Partner, Vessel-Space Charter party, a specific named Charter Party, or other clauses.

Best regards,
Christian Jacobsen

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Rook,

Thank you for the offer of space, the size is fine. Could you confirm the time of arrival and laycan slot of your next vessel out of Grangemouth?

Thanks,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Barlow,

Could you confirm the slot booking for the next voyage? Also, I would like to discuss the appointment time and duration for the visit.

Best regards,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Marco,

We are delighted to be able to offer the following slot for <SHIP NAME>’s voyage into Grangemouth on 19 August:

Ship: <SHIP NAME>
IMDG No.: 2287
ETA Grangemouth: 21:00 (19/08/2020)

Best regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Marco,

Thank you for this message. Apologies for not replying earlier. I have just returned from 3 months leave.

This vessel would be loaded with Polymers and Visco polymer. Generally, the cargo would take up the whole of the space; however, as I mentioned earlier, we will accommodate smaller-sized cargo if this is possible.

Best regards,
Tony

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Hello Tony,

Are you able to advise your normal laycan for this vessel? And your normal berth use. Is this vessel restricted to cranes that can handle 50 metric tonnes?

Many thanks,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

Laycan-wise, this vessel is always flexible and will try to accommodate as much as possible. Berths are not usually allocated until 24 hrs prior to arrival (24-30hrs before, more so during peak season).

50 MT cranes are usually ok with any cargo carried on board.

Best regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Hi Tony,

I have just received a request from other parties for a laycan between 19th and 25th August, within the same slot. I do not know who they are, as they are represented by their broker only. Could I have a better laycan so we can satisfy them as well?

Best regards,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

This vessel will stay within laycan 14-19 August and will not change berth at Grangemouth.

Best regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Rook,

Thank you for the kind offer.

Some clarification required on your kind offer:
1. If you confirm the number of cubic meters that can be loaded. Maximum POL volume is 4900 cbm.
2. If we load the full volume, how much POL can be loaded.
3. How many cubic meters of POL can be loaded in the forward (viscopol) hold.
4. If POL can be loaded, how much can be loaded.

Please confirm the following information:
1. MCT: 40 tons
2. Lead time to build a POL hatch: 24 hours from confirmation
3. Access to MOORFIX for our inspection: pending on availability of the terminal.

Best regards,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Request for Bunker Tankers for MSC Cristiana
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Bridget,

Could we use your bunker tankers for the upcoming voyages of MSC Cristiana? We are looking for two times 5,000MT in August and September, but we are also open to 8,000MT voyages. Can you provide us with details on terms and conditions?

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Tanker for Sale in Weipa, Australia
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I'm the bunkering specialist at the shipping company Frachtintra GmbH. We currently have a tanker for sale in Weipa, Australia. The specifications of the tanker are:
- 5,000 m3
- LNG + LPG
- Complies with IMO NOx Tier III/EU IV emissions standards
- Can carry various liquid chemicals, such as crude oil, petrochemicals, chemicals for industrial uses and more

The price is 15.5 million USD.

Can you please let us know if you would be interested?

Regards,
Srdjan

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Bunkering Services
email_chain.body:
Hi Srdjan,

This week you and I spoke on the phone. You had asked about available destinations for bunkering services. Can you please confirm that you're interested in Bunker Fuel, Offshore, and Marine fuels? We also offer Low Sulphur Content fuels. What is your availability?

Best regards,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: Bunkering Options for MSC Cristiana
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

We have two possible destinations for you to choose from. We can offer the following:

1. 5,000MT of High-Sulphur Fuel Oil (HSFO) at 3.5% - Can be available in 3-4 days in your destination.
2. 3,000MT of Marine Gas Oil (MGO) at 0.5% - Can be available in 4-5 days in your destination.

Could you please let us know your preference? We look forward to working with you!

Kind regards,
Bridget

labels.commodity: Bunker Fuel, Offshore, Marine fuels, Low Sulphur Content fuels

email_chain.subject: Request for Glycerin Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

We need 300MT of glycerin from Santos to Los Angeles, although we would prefer a vessel from somewhere else. Where will your current vessel be on 16/7?

As always,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Glycerin Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

300 MT of glycerin is now arranged from Santos to Los Angeles on board `TAIT`, expected to depart on 13/7. The vessel is laden from Santos and is ready for cargo.

You have allocated Los Angeles as the discharge port in your website. Please make sure that the necessary documents are ready on hand before the vessel's arrival. You may e-mail us at ship@abc.com for related enquiries.

As always,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Documents for Glycerin Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Sam,

Here are the documents you requested. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.

Thanks!
Jim

email_chain.subject: Vessel Arrival Date Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Please advise the arrival date of your vessel at Los Angeles. When can we expect to discharge your cargo?

Thanks,
Tony

email_chain.subject: Vessel Arrival Date
email_chain.body:
Dear Tony,

Our vessel `TAIT` is expected to arrive at Los Angeles on 14/8. You may advise the stevedore at once.

We shall also take the appropriate measures for discharging of your cargo.

As always,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 5,000MT Base Chemicals from Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Orlov,

I need 5,000MT of base chemicals shipped from Antwerp to Liverpool. Could you please confirm a mid-April laycan and provide a quote?

Thank you,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Base Chemicals from Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hello Lorena,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can load the chemicals in Antwerp on April 16 and deliver them to Liverpool by April 23. The total cost for this shipment is $950,000. Please confirm your acceptance, and I will send over the contract.

Thank you,
Juan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 5,000MT Base Chemicals from Antwerp to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Juan.

I'll forward this to our internal team for approval and get back to you within 24 hours.

Thanks,
Lorena

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 3,500MT Vanillin Shipment from Kobe to Suva
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Stone,

I am seeking a 3,500MT capacity for vanillin shipment from Kobe to Suva. Could you please provide your best freight estimate and confirm if you have any available warehouse slots?

Kind regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: 3,500MT Vanillin Shipment from Kobe to Suva
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Stone,

Regarding the 3,500MT vanillin shipment from Kobe to Suva, your FOB Japan rate of USD 220/t seems reasonable based on the forward freight agreement rates. Could you advise the latest loading date to ensure the cargo reaches Suva by May 15, 2014?

Kind regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: 3,500MT Vanillin Shipment from Kobe to Suva - Urgent
email_chain.body:
Good evening Mr. Stone,

I regret to inform you that our tender deadline is tonight at midnight. Could you confirm if you can meet this deadline and whether warehouse slots are still available?

Kind regards,
Jason

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Rate - Soybean Meal from Charleston to Lianyungang

$79/mt.

Team Binamics

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Freight Rate - Soybean Meal from Charleston to Lianyungang

Team Binamics

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Charter Party Accepted
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Request for Cargo Shipping from Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Elsner,

Could you provide a 1,500 MT cargo of freight from Hamburg to Tehran before June 14th? Please share your typical demurrage and dispatch rates.

Thanks,
Serafina

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Shipping from Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

We have available 1,500 MT freight capacity on the Hamburg to Tehran route. We have some cargo from Manila to Hamburg which is now arriving. We can ship to Istanbul with one stop on arrival and then go via Ahvaz to Tehran with one stop on arrival for Iran. It depends on which cargo we will have after landing in Istanbul on May 31st.

The rate is $750 per 20' container demurrage, $500 per 20' container dispatch. Please let me know if you can provide such cargo to us.

Thank you,
Johann

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Shipping from Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Johann,

Thank you for your offer, but this is not the route we are seeking. We'd like to ship directly from Hamburg to Tehran. Please let me know if you can do so.

Thank you!
Serafina

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Shipping from Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

We can take the cargo to Istanbul with one stop on arrival. We have space from Manila to Hamburg. We have one space from Hamburg to Istanbul on May 31st on our vessel ETERNAL DREAM. We can take your cargo from Istanbul to Ahvaz on our vessel METAPHYSICS and go via Ahvaz to Tehran with one stop on arrival.

Thank you,
Johann

email_chain.subject: Vessel Loading for Zinc Shipment
email_chain.body:
John,

I have a vessel loading 11,000MT of zinc from China to Egypt, and we are looking at either the 22nd August or the 29th for loading. Any idea if that will work for your charter?

Many thanks,
Min-Jeong

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Loading for Zinc Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Min-Jeong,

If 11,000MT is okay, I think you have time from the 20th to the 24th of August to load and then move to the next port to load corn by September 1st to 3rd. Before or after will depend on other works.

Hope this helps,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Loading for Zinc Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Thanks for the information. Much appreciated. I'll check with the owner if he accepts it.

Regards,
Min-Jeong

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Arrangements for Zinc Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Hope you had a good holiday. Please confirm charter arrangements for the vessel for loading zinc from China to Egypt for September 3rd loading.

Regards,
Min-Jeong

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Arrangements for Zinc Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Min-Jeong,

Yes, the charter details are as below:

1. Vessel type: A1
2. Age: 7 years old
3. Built: 2009
4. Registered: Bahamas
5. Class: +100A1
6. Flag: Marshall Islands
7. DWT: 26,804
8. Draft: 11.20 M
9. Grain capacity: 44,163.00 CBM
10. LOA: 180.0 M
11. BEAM: 28.0 M
12. Hatches: 2 (6.00M X 12.00M, 6.00M X 12.00M)
13. Holds: Hold 1 (5.00M X 12.00M, 5.00M X 12.00M), Hold 2 (5.00M X 12.00M, 5.00M X 12.00M)

Regards,
John
