email_chain.subject: Availability for Trip from Port Darien to Port Dauphin
email_chain.body:
Hi Kim,

Could you tell me if you are available for a trip from Port Darien to Port Dauphin, with roughly 2,600MT of feed barley? Also, is your vessel strictly on the job, or are there any other business agreements?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

Thanks for your response. Unfortunately, our requirement is not just Darien to Dauphin; the cargo will be delivered to an island off Guadeloupe. Do you know anyone who might be able to help us in this region? Or perhaps you know another shipowner who might be able to do this run for us?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

I noticed that your ship was in Dauphin a couple of weeks ago. I wonder if you know anything about cargo? It seems to us that most of the big ships do not have their cargo listed on your online service. I was just wondering if you might have information on shipping agencies that might be able to provide that information?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Project Cancellation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

I just received word that our project has been canceled. Thanks anyway, however. The shipbuilding project is no longer an option for us.

Have a nice day.

Jessica

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipowner Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Richards,

We have a requirement for a shipowner with a large ship available for work in the Caribbean. It seems that most of the vessels under 20,000 tons are not available to carry cargo, even when they are tied up at the docks. Do you know anyone who might be able to help us? The ships listed in the Maritime Database are not for sale, although some shipyards are listed. Are there any shipowners who have vessels for sale? Are they listed in the Maritime Database?

Yours,
Jessica

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Capt. Hu,

We’re looking to move 5,000MT of wheat from Chornomorsk, Ukraine to Thailand in early January. We need a vessel that can fit this cargo, and with a rate close to current terms. We’re happy to share details on our position if you’re interested in bidding.

Cheers,
Maxwell

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Capt. Hu,

I have a 20,000DWT vessel available from 7th January 2022 for a discharge in Thailand.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Vessel Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Capt. Hu,

Your email was seen by Tuan. I've been in business for 10 years and have experience in the field. This is Jenny, and I think you are looking for a 20,000DWT vessel. You can start a new business with me.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for January 2022
email_chain.body:
Hi Tuan,

We are looking for a 20,000DWT vessel for January 2022. Please kindly get back to us if your vessel is available.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for January 2022
email_chain.body:
Hi Jenny,

I saw your comment. I think I can cooperate with you. Let's discuss further details.

Regards,
Tuan

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation - Yellow Tungsten Carbide Buttons
email_chain.body:
Dear Vaishnav,

Could you provide us with your best rate for supplying one thousand units of yellow tungsten carbide buttons to Bahrain on a CFR basis? Please note that we have a budget of 200,000 USD, which should be within the range for the above quantities.

We would appreciate it if you could reply at your earliest convenience.

Kind regards,
Jacob

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - Yellow Tungsten Carbide Buttons
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

Please see below, which I hope will be helpful for your needs.

Name: Your company
Tel.: +962-6-56........
Mobile: +962-7-9........
Fax: +962-6-56........

We have production facilities in Bahrain, but our exports are entirely managed from Jordan. We export monthly in the range of 50 to 150 kg. If this is of interest to you, I can make an offer according to your budget, and we can agree on shipment from Bahrain.

Best regards,
Nevens

email_chain.subject: Introduction to Spectra - Mining Chemicals Supplier
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

Spectra is an Amman-based importer and distributor of mining chemicals. Some of the product names we supply include CŁpim™ 41 (75% Sodium Cyanide), Satyam M3, Kengal ® M, TMAA (Tris (Methylamine) Ammonium Amines), DCTA (Diethylene Triamine Pentaacetic Acid), and Hexamine.

Most of our products are imported from Europe and supplied in bulk drums (50kg or 125kg), as well as in drums, jerry cans, and pouches, for various end-user industries. We also supply chemicals in bulk or tanker loads to other businesses and institutions that require specialized packaging and blending.

Our warehouse and offices are located in the Abdali area in Amman, within a 20-minute drive of both Queen Alia International Airport and King Hussein.

Best regards,
Spectra Team

email_chain.subject: Request for Firm Offer - Base Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

As mentioned over the phone, we are interested in 12,500MT of Base Oil from Falmouth to Port Kembla. Could you send a firm offer for a full laycan?

Many thanks,
Hector

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Offer Type - Base Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

Just to let you know we have two offers for Base Oil from Falmouth to Port Kembla, both with freight inclusive (inclusive of base grade as well). Could you please advise whether you prefer a FOB or an inclusive offer?

Many thanks,
Hector

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Laycan Dates - Base Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

After speaking with our customer, they are now in need of a confirmation of laycan. They require laycan as follows:

01 July, 15 August, 15 October, 15 December, 15 February, 15 April, 15 June, 15 August, 15 October.

Laycan is quite strict in that no dates prior to those listed above or subsequent to the 15th of the month in question will be accepted. Can you advise if these dates will be acceptable?

Regards,
Hector

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation Details - Base Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Regarding your previous enquiry for the shipment of 12,500MT of base oil from Falmouth to Port Kembla, we would be grateful if you could advise your quotation in the following manner:

1. Name of the base grade:
2. Quantity of the base grade:
3. Basis of the quotation:
4. Delivery period:
5. Freight exclusive or inclusive:
6. MOA, HBA, BAF, BAF included in freight or separately?
7. Special terms and conditions (such as minimum annual contract volume, terms of payment, conditions of delay, etc.)

Looking forward to your reply.

Regards,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Freight and Incoterms - Base Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

Thank you for your offer. Please confirm whether the freight includes the BAF and if BAF is invoiced to the buyer monthly. It would also be helpful if you could advise:

1. Whether the load will be ready for lifting on 15th August?
2. Your Incoterms?

Looking forward to your reply.

Regards,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Terms and Conditions - Base Oil Transaction
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Thank you for your enquiry for base oil. Please find attached our terms and conditions in respect to the base oil transaction. We await your comments.

Yours sincerely,
Brian

email_chain.subject: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Mr. Li, We plan to load 2,000MT of iron ore from Tianjin to Port Hedland next month. Could you please confirm your vessel position and berth availability? Thanks, Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Charlie, According to your email, your vessel will load iron ore from China and discharge at Port Hedland. Our yard is usually full of steel sheet during this time of year. Could you let us know your deadline? Best regards, Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Charlie, There are vessels waiting for their berthing at the dock. If the berth is available for your vessel, our shipowners plan to offer us at USD1.00/MMT and also wish to extend the payment terms to 60 days. Your advice would be very much appreciated. Best regards, Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Tom, Our cargo is on schedule and the load port is planning to allocate the vessel berth to us. Could you let us know the USD1.00/MMT if the steel sheet is in the iron ore range? We want to confirm with the load port. Best regards, Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Charlie, As a result, our shipowners only agree to raise the contract price by USD0.10/MMT. Could you please pass it on to your shipowner? Also, could you let us know if the steel sheet is in the iron ore range? We want to confirm with the load port. Best regards, Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Tom, We accept the offer. Could you please sign the letter of indemnity for our shipowner? Also, our commercial team in the load port confirms that the steel sheet is in the iron ore range. Best regards, Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Charlie, As you know, our shipowners agreed to offer the price of USD1.00/MMT and also wish to extend the payment terms to 60 days. Could you please sign the letter of indemnity and the indemnity agreement for our shipowners? Best regards, Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Tom, Please let us know if we have reached an agreement? Best regards, Charlie

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Position and Berth Availability Inquiry
email_chain.body: Dear Tom, We have prepared the documents and are going to send them to you by courier. Could you please confirm that you are expecting the documents? Best regards, Charlie

email_chain.subject: Vessel Charter Inquiry for Lubricants
email_chain.body:
Hi Justine,

Any chance you can fix a vessel this Friday for 3,300MT of lubricants from Genoa to Haifa? And how soon would you need the charter party signed?

Kind regards,
Charlene
John Robb Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Charter Inquiry for Lubricants
email_chain.body:
Hi Justine,

Thank you so much for taking the time to reply. What I’m looking for is a fixed rate from Genoa to Haifa for 3,300MT of lubricants for delivery on 22 June. I had hoped to receive an offer before the end of the day yesterday, but the best offer I’ve received so far is a rate of US$80 per MT from WFS Energy, and this was only received this morning. I’ve heard a lot about your brokerage, and it would be great to work with your company, so I look forward to hearing your best offer.

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on 200,000mt MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Hello Capt. Hu,

We are organizing a 200,000mt cargo of MGO from Gijon, Spain, to Japan. As you know, it’s a big shipment. In your opinion, are all the suppliers out there able to supply such a big order?

Also, how long will the loading time take?

Many thanks,
Timothy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on 200,000mt MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Thank you for your inquiry. We’ve never sold that quantity of MGO before, but our company, as a division of a larger corporation, has supplied over 100,000mt to major trading companies in recent years. We are capable of handling this order.

The time frame for loading can be negotiated between the supplier and buyer. Typically, we provide shipping documents within 10-12 days of the shipment and request payment in cash 4 weeks later. The buyer is responsible for paying the bank documentary charges within 2 weeks of the shipment.

Finding a supplier who can deliver 200,000mt in one go is challenging. I recommend splitting the order into two parts, each around 100,000mt.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on 200,000mt MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

I’ve just learned that the delivery vessel has a limit of 130,000mt, so two ships might be needed. One ship could carry 100,000mt, and the other would carry the remaining 100,000mt.

There are many shipping vessels available that can handle this amount of cargo. The average delivery time is around 45 days, though it can be shortened depending on the vessel’s route.

The costs for this shipment range from USD 10 to USD 20 per mt, depending on the vessel size, route, and distance.

In conclusion, I recommend shipping the order in two parts, each around 100,000mt.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on 200,000mt MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

I will continue to provide information on finding a supplier and transport companies for this shipment.

The best way to find a supplier is to contact local trade associations or trade missions. They can help you locate a local supplier or refer you to associations in the destination country.

Several types of vessels can handle this cargo, including bulk carriers, tankers, container ships, and Ro-Ro vessels. Each has its advantages and disadvantages.

The most common route from Europe to Japan is around 7,000 nautical miles and takes approximately 30 days, depending on the vessel’s speed and weather conditions.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Let’s assume our 4,500MT fixture from Hamburg to Aarhus has settled for a free-out rate of $300/MT. Is that an all-in rate?

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

I understand your point. While the quotation has settled for $300/MT, the vessel owner is willing to accept $250/MT. If you don’t agree, he’s willing to pay $300/MT. So it’s all good.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

I hope the direction of this conversation is clear. As I mentioned, I have no interest in the vessel owner. My position is clear – to hire the vessel owner at an all-in rate of $300/MT, and it is all-in. If we agree to hire the vessel owner at a lower rate, the vessel owner has no interest in paying an all-in rate of $300/MT and will not agree to that.

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Please read what you’ve written and what I’ve written. You have chosen a way to present your issue, but that doesn’t mean it’s your only option. You’re trying to give the impression that I’m proposing something. I’m not proposing anything. I’m simply saying that you have only taken one approach. You are aware that the vessel owner has flexibility.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Again, I’m not proposing anything. I’m not assuming anything. I’m merely stating that you have limited yourself to a certain approach. This is good for lawyers but very limiting for business people. If you’re interested, I’d be happy to take a call with you to talk through the issue.

Cheers,
David

Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Crude Oil Shipping and Bunkers
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Mr. Fennell

email_chain.subject: A special $10 million stash Fenn allegedly buried in the Rocky Mountains
email_chain.body:
Hello Felicia,

I just watched the Hidden Cash series on Netflix and had to reach out to you. I believe there is a $10 million stash in the Rocky Mountains, and I just found the clue to it in the Netflix series. To find the treasure, you must go to Wyoming and take a hike to the summit of the mountain on March 14, and find a rock with a spider web and a spider on it. There is a chunk of stone with the date 2014, then there is a map that was drawn by the Aboriginals in a nearby valley that shows where to go next. It is approximately 2 miles from the rock.

Best,
Malloys

email_chain.subject: Re: A special $10 million stash
email_chain.body:
Dear Felicia,

I will not confirm or deny that the above is related to any TATF clues. I will simply say that your well-constructed TATF clues are, and always have been, your own. If, in fact, you choose to accept any $10,000,000,000+ treasure, and a check made out to you by the Bounty Board for $10,000,000,000+, be advised that the paperwork includes a clause that neither you nor your heirs can claim any part of that amount again. Upon confirmation by the Bounty Board of your claim, all of it is gone.

Thank you for your interest in my little game.

Mr. Fenn

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Crude Oil Shipping and Bunkers
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fennell,

I want to hear all about the $10,000,000,000 treasure. Where is the Bitcoin miner that has the clues? I also want to know if there is still a $10,000,000,000 ransom payment for finding the $10,000,000,000 Bitcoin that has the clues.

Kind Regards,
Felicia

email_chain.subject: Fenn redbull spray paint run n'bizzy
email_chain.body:
Hey Felicia,

I have some information that you should know about.

First, there are currently 22,794,152 coins that are being hidden by Satoshi Nakamoto in the Rocky Mountains. This means that if you find one of them, you could be looking at a significant treasure.

Best,
Malloys

email_chain.subject: Questions about June Shipment
email_chain.body: Hey Bruce, I hope you're doing well. I have a few quick questions about our June shipment. We have a 300MT slot from Dhaka to Tejing on the 13th of June. Could you let me know when we should arrive at Tejing port? Also, what’s the daily demurrage rate there? Thanks a lot! You rock! Best, Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Questions about June Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Alex, thanks for reaching out. I’m happy to help. Your container should arrive on the 29th of June. The demurrage rate at Tejing port is $500 per day. As for the arrival time, it depends on when your truck arrives at the port and the port’s efficiency. Given the summer heat in China, the best time to arrive is around 10-11am. Let me know if you need anything else! Best, Bruce

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Additional Shipments
email_chain.body: Hi Bruce, we are looking to send more containers from Dhaka to China but are unsure of the best way to proceed. Could you provide guidance on the process? Additionally, is it possible to send the shipment by air instead of by sea? What are the differences? I can provide further details if needed. Looking forward to your response. Best, BAE Ibraham, MT Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Additional Shipments
email_chain.body: Hi BAE, thanks for reaching out! Please let me know the size and location of the shipment, and I’ll get back to you with a quote. Best, Bruce

email_chain.subject: Update on June Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Bruce, I wanted to give you a quick update on the shipment. We need it as soon as possible, so I’ll be at Tejing port to ensure everything goes smoothly. Let me know if there’s anything else I should prepare for. Best, Alex

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Cargo Shipment from Pakistan to China

We’re looking for a cost-effective solution with a fast transit time. Also, could you provide an estimate of the demurrage rate at the destination port? Thanks! Best, Mark Huang, Huawei

email_chain.subject: Cargo Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear [NAME],

Could you handle a cargo of [Cargo] from [Load Port] to [Discharge Port] in [Period]? Additionally, what would be your demurrage rate after 72 hours of laytime?

Regards,
[NAME]

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Shipping Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear [NAME],

We are interested in purchasing [Cargo] originating from [Load Port] and discharging at [Discharge Port], to be shipped within 3 to 4 weeks. We would like you to act as the shipper and holder of the bills of lading, as well as the disponent owners of the cargo onboard. Please provide a signed Letter of Indemnity (LOI) with the following details:

1. Validity of LOI: A validity period of three weeks.
2. Basic Rate: The cost should align with the original liner tariff, including amendment clauses for short sea voyages.
3. Premium (2nd or 3rd): If there are any premiums, please quote accordingly. If not, please confirm.
4. Washtrade: If your company wishes to use our charterer's name and flag in the charterparty, please state that as well.
5. Voyage Details: Please provide any additional voyage details that may be relevant.

Looking forward to your response.

email_chain.body:

We are interested in the details of your current shipment. Could you please provide the following information:

Andrea

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Mr. Taylor,

Can your vessel load 3,000MT of crude oil from Houston to Tianjin by mid-May? Also, what kind of off-hire provisions do you typically include in the CP?

Best,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy,

Regarding your query, our standard off-hire provisions include:

(i) Cargo and/or bunker barge with bunker tanks be moored at the cargo vessel's hull side and connected to cargo vessel's tanks and hoses with through-water manifolds or other pipe fittings,
(ii) Discharging of cargo be from full cargo vessel's cargo tanks to cargo or bunker barge's empty tanks, and
(iii) As long as cargo vessel's tanks are constantly filled, full loaded vessel shall remain alongside bunkering and/or cargo barge throughout the bunkering/discharging operation.

Best regards,
Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi All,

We have different criteria for arriving time and set the time before the actual arrival time we get. How about the time? How many days does the vessel take?

Hope for your kindly reply.

Best Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

As I am not familiar with the latest RINA/PLA form B, I guess you may refer to clause 3 of said form B?

My question is:
1. We shall discharge from a cargo vessel discharging alongside a cargo and/or bunker barge, subject to the cargo barge having open access to the New Territories Container Terminals to allow transfer of cargo to shore and the cargo barge being able to call at Tianjin to unload and subsequently discharge the cargo from the cargo barge.
2. (from clause 3)

Please confirm if you are able to discharge the cargo with cargo.

Best,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Hi Andy and James,

Regarding point 2 of your letter, we hereby confirm our offer for an around the world voyage from loading at Houston, USA, to discharge at Tianjin, China with the following details:

* Within the standard terms of RINA/PLA Form B, and;
* As per point 2, we will provide that discharging of cargo be from full cargo vessel's cargo tanks to cargo or bunker barge's empty tanks, and that as long as cargo vessel's tanks are constantly filled, full loaded vessel shall remain alongside bunkering and/or cargo barge throughout the bunkering/discharging operation.

* The cargo vessel to be of chemical tanker type or similar design, capable of maintaining a barge alongside its own side for discharge in a full laden condition for up to a total of 24 hours. This requirement is subject to confirmation of arrangements with the cargo barge, bunker barge and terminals concerned to ensure the cargo can be discharged without the cargo vessel moving to an alternative mooring. The foregoing is without prejudice to the cargo vessel's primary duties during the bunkering/discharging operation.

Best regards,
Taylor

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Charter Party Terms
email_chain.body:
Dear Andy and Taylor,

Many thanks for your email. You mentioned that the cargo vessel will provide to ensure that our barge can carry out the task. However, I do think that we can provide for it, so as to the vessel to offer that we shall ensure our barge.

Also, if we confirm on your offer, will you provide a set of documents?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Urgent Requirement for LNG Tanker
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Cheng,

We have an urgent requirement for a tanker to carry 25,000MT of LNG from Lagos to Hong Kong. Would you be able to provide your best freight rate and do you allow re-instatement of laytime beyond 96 hours?

Thank you,
Damian

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Requirement for LNG Tanker
email_chain.body:
Hi Damian,

The price is FOB USD540.00/MT, not including the lightering fee (max 5,000MT at $300/MT). Freight time of the vessel in and out of the ports is 4 days, and the transit time is 27 days.

Reinstatement for both arrival and departure must be approved. After the vessel has left our port, it cannot get a reinstatement of 48 hours, even after 96 hours. Arrival time must be within 24 hours; if the vessel will not arrive on time, it can get reinstatement for up to 24 hours.

If you want to sign the Charter Party with us, please send us the following documents as soon as possible:
1. Company profile, scope of operation, address, fax number, phone number.
2. Certification of insurance.

Best regards,
Ms. Cheng

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Ryan,

Can you handle a methanol shipment from Mumbai to Osaka and then a reshipment from Osaka to Canada?

Regards,
Ulysses

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Ulysses,

I will handle the methanol shipment. When the shipment arrives in Osaka, you must submit an SF-478 (Item 16) and send it to the PBO Warehouse. Then, I will make the arrangements to have it shipped from Osaka to Canada.

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Ryan,

As far as I know, methanol is a hazardous material. Are there any special requirements or precautions we need to take for this shipment?

Regards,
Ulysses

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Ulysses,

You are correct; methanol is a hazardous material and cannot be shipped commercially. Instead, I will arrange for the shipment to be carried by the Military Sealift Command, which transports military personnel and cargo.

Regards,
Ryan

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Truck Management at Ports of LA and Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Langley,

I hope you are well! We are currently evaluating both the Port of Los Angeles and Long Beach and would like to ask how many trucks the system can manage per week. Additionally, do you have any remarks about efficiency and congestion at your terminals?

I look forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Truck Management at Ports of LA and Long Beach
email_chain.body:
Hi Paul,

Thank you for your email. The US market has been challenging recently for various reasons. To answer your question, we manage approximately 5,000 trucks per week across both gates. If you have any specific concerns or need further suggestions for your group, please let me know.

Best regards,
Mr. Langley

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Truck Management and Investment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Langley,

I hope this message finds you well. We are interested in investing in both the Port of Los Angeles and Long Beach. Could you provide us with details on how many trucks your terminal handles per week and per month, as well as the expected results for this year?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,
Daniel

P.S. You are doing a great job with information sharing!

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Truck Management and Investment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thank you for your interest. As mentioned earlier, we handle around 5,000 trucks per week, which translates to approximately 20,000 trucks per month. We expect a 10% increase in efficiency this year due to recent upgrades in our systems.

Let me know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Mr. Langley

Hey Mr. Poitras,

An old contact of mine at Total informed me that Total is sourcing 500MT of LNG from Ras Laffan to Fujairah. Any chance you have space for it?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Joe,

Did you work with a Frank Serwinski? I just got an email from him about the same cargo...

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Yves,

Yes, we are in touch! How are you?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

This is Joe. I got your email about the TOTAL's loading at Ras Laffan. Do you want me to send you the loadout schedule from Ras Laffan?

Best regards,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hello Joe,

If you can get the complete loadout schedule, it will be great.

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

As promised, I'm attaching the Ras Laffan loadout schedule.

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Yves,

Don't we still have time to take on more cargo at Ras Laffan?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Joe,

I haven't seen an offer from you about the Ras Laffan cargo.

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

Is it still available?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

You still don't know if there is still cargo available?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Cargo from Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hello Joe,

The loading schedule is flexible. We still have cargos available, but I'd rather not disclose the full amount to you. I don't want the whole market to know that we are still short of cargo...

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Task: Responding to Email Enquiries
email_chain.body:
In this task, you will respond to two emailed enquiries. You will need to complete the following tasks in this lesson:

- Write two responses to email enquiries (one to each of the email scenarios in the lesson).
- Use more than one email scenario to practice using English email language.
- Ensure that your emails have all the basic elements of an effective business email.
- Understand what makes an email more effective than another.
- Use email correctly for different situations.
- Ensure that your emails are grammatically accurate.
- Use the emails as a springboard to practice more English.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Available Space from Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body: Do you have available space from Piraeus to Panama City for my plastic pellets, or can you combine with any other cargo? Where should we send our documents? Regards, Laurence

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Available Space from Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body: Thank you for your inquiry. Could you please provide more details about the shipment, such as the quantity of plastic pellets and the type of containers required? Additionally, please confirm if you need 1+ open container slots. Regards, Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Available Space from Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body: What information should I submit for my documents? Are they required to have 1+ open container slots? How many containers can fit on a typical ship? How many open container slots are required to arrange a shipment? How many spots can you provide? Regards, Laurence

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Available Space from Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body: Typically, a ship can accommodate around 5000 TEUs, but this can vary. For your shipment, we would need to know the exact quantity and type of containers you require. Please send the necessary documents to our local agent at agent@example.com. Do you need signatures on the documents? Regards, Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Available Space from Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body: I'd like to arrange a shipment of used plastic pellets with you. Is there any available space from Piraeus to Panama City? Please let me know ASAP. Do you need any documents? Where should we send them? Regards, Laurence

email_chain.subject: What's the meaning of 'flexible you are with laytime extensions?'
email_chain.body:
Dear Yahu,

Could you please clarify what you mean by 'flexible with laytime extensions'? I need this information to proceed with our arrangements.

Best regards,
Mara

email_chain.subject: Re: What's the meaning of 'flexible you are with laytime extensions?'
email_chain.body:
Dear Mara,

Thank you for your email. By 'flexible with laytime extensions,' we mean that we can adjust the laytime period based on your needs, provided it is within reasonable limits.

Looking forward to your response.

Kind regards,
Yahu

email_chain.subject: Purchase Orders
email_chain.body:
Dear Yahu,

Thank you for sending over the Purchase Orders that were listed on the emails. However, could you please send me the standard Purchase Order document? The documents I have received so far do not seem to be standard Purchase Orders.

Best regards,
Mara

email_chain.subject: Re: Purchase Orders
email_chain.body:
Dear Mara,

I apologize for the confusion. I will send you the standard Purchase Order document shortly.

Kind regards,
Yahu

email_chain.subject: Product Catalogue
email_chain.body:
Hello Mara,

How are you? Unfortunately, you were not the only one to reply to my email. If you are interested in our range of products, please let me know so that I can send you our catalogue.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Kind regards,
Yahu

YAHU Pharmaceuticals
We are a professional producer specializing in pharmaceutical capsules, pharmaceutical pellets, and dietary supplements.

email_chain.body:

Thank you for your email. I am interested in your product range. Please send me the catalogue at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Mara

Kind regards,
Yahu

- Cap Cyproheptadine hydrochloride 4mg
- Capsule Paroxetine Hydrochloride

For the quotation and lead time, please refer to the PDF attached below.

Best regards,
Mara

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment Capacity and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Hello Claire,

The ship below is loaded with petroleum products and it is arriving in Saudi Arabia on 2nd March. Do you have capacity for 35,000MT of refined sugar and what would be your demurrage rates per day after 72 hours of laytime?

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment Capacity and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Jenny,

We do have capacity for sugar shipments. Our sugar rates are 2.00 USD/MTON demurrage in ARA and rates after 72 hours is 3.00 USD/MTON.

Are you able to offer us a sample contract?

Warm Regards,
Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment Capacity and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Claire,

Thank you for your rates. Kindly clarify the details of your coverage and please advise as to what documents you would require for the below shipment.

Please advise whether this is a CIF deal or an FOB deal. We are not brokers as mentioned in the message below and this is our main question.

Kindly advise whether you have time in ARA and please specify how long we have to fill up the barge. We can load the sugar onto a barge for shipment but we need to know how much time we have.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment Capacity and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Jenny,

Thank you for your question. I will confirm with the agent and let you know.

Please can you provide me with a sample contract for this movement.

With regards,
Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Sugar Shipment Capacity and Demurrage Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Claire,

Thank you for getting back to us. We are looking forward to receiving your answers to the following questions:

1. What is the duration of the time charter (for how long does your vessel remain available for us)?
2. Which of the two below are your required documents for sugar export (please check ALL that are applicable):
   * Certificate of Origin (CO)
   * Certificate of Export or License (CE or CE-L)
   * License from the exporter country
   * Exchange Control Permit (ECP)
   * Letter of Denial
   * Broker’s certificate
3. Is the price for the port D...

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Laytime Policy
email_chain.body:
Dear Ship Manager,

We have 11,400MT of feed flour to be shipped from Haiphong to Singapore. Could you let us know if your vessel is available in the next 3 days? Additionally, what is your policy on laytime extensions?

Sincerely,
Mandy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Laytime Policy
email_chain.body:
Dear Mandy,

Thank you for your inquiry. Could you confirm if your cargo details are as follows?

- Load at: Haiphong
- Unload at: Port Bellingham
- Destination: FOB
- Cargo: Wheat Flour
- Price: US$240/MT
- Temperature: 15%
- Quantity: 11,400MT

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Ship Manager

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Availability and Laytime Policy
email_chain.body:
Dear Ship Manager,

Yes, we will load 11,400MT of Wheat Flour at Haiphong port and discharge at Port Bellingham FOB. The approximate draft for arrival at Haiphong is 14.5 m (max draft 15.5 m). Given that the capacity of your vessel at Haiphong is 11,900MT, there will be a 500MT difference in the contract quantity. We can adjust the contract to 11,900MT, and the invoice for 11,900MT will be the net payable amount.

Please confirm if this works for you.

Sincerely,
Mandy

Amit

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Cargo Enquiry: Ro-Ro Iron Ore from Santos to Lomé
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Would you mind helping us with the following enquiry?

Type of cargo: 22,000MT of Ro-Ro Iron Ore
Port of Loading: Santos, Brazil
Discharge Port: Lomé, Togo
Loading date: 16 September 2016
Discharge date: 30 September 2016
Laycan: Oct/Nov 2016
Vessel: Handysize bulk carrier for single vessel transportation
Special equipment or requirement: Deck load of 20MT/m2 with 4.5m on centre line and 2m side shift
Owners will be responsible for all charter party and commercial documents
Minimum charter period: 18 days

Please confirm your interest and provide your earliest best offer.

Regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Enquiry: Ro-Ro Iron Ore from Santos to Lomé
email_chain.body:
Dear Fred,

Thank you for your enquiry. We are a professional team based in Singapore, specializing in cargo brokerage and chartering for several years. Our services include cargo surveying, insurance claim handling, cargo delivery, charter party preparation, and verification.

Could you kindly provide us with the following additional details?

- Exact location of the loading port?
- Exact location of the discharge port?
- What type of vessel is required for the cargo delivery?
- Estimated loading and discharging dates?
- Could you provide a copy of the Bill of Lading and load port documentation?
- Is there any insurance, risk, or danger of marine pollution involved with the cargo during transportation?
- What is the minimum hire period?
- Are there any special requirements or instructions for cargo handling and delivery?

We look forward to your response.

Best regards,
Broker Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Enquiry: Ro-Ro Iron Ore from Santos to Lomé
email_chain.body:
Dear Fred,

My best regards to you!

Thank you for your email dated 8th September. This is Jun Wu from the CARGOTRANS team in Shenzhen, China. We are pleased to discuss the details of your shipment.

Here is the detailed information about your cargo:

- Loading port: Santos, Brazil
- Discharge port: Lomé, Togo
- Loading date: 16 September 2016
- Discharge date: 30 September 2016
- Vessel type: Handysize bulk carrier for single vessel transportation
- Vessel size: No less than 15,000 MT
- Cargo type: Ro-Ro Iron Ore
- Owners will bear all charter party and commercial documents
- Deck load: 20MT/m2, 4.5m on center line, and 2m side shift

Please let us know if you need further clarification.

Best regards,
Jun Wu

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up: Cargo Enquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Fred,

Please note that I have already forwarded your message to our Shanghai team, and they will follow up with you directly. I am also attaching Cargotrans's business card for your future reference.

Thank you.

Best regards,
Jun Wu

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

We’re looking to ship 700MT of pharmaceuticals from Riga to Dubai. How much time do you need to find a suitable vessel?

Regards,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

I can give you an idea. My colleague has shared the shipping route from Riga to Dubai. But before I start my search, I would like to hear more about the shipment:

- How will the goods be loaded? (LCL or FCL)
- What is the nature of the cargo?
- What will be the mode of shipment?
- When do you expect to move the cargo?
- Is it an urgent shipment? (Please provide the documents)

Regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Dear Max,

We want to ship it by sea with FCL and LCL. Please give me a quote.

Regards,
Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Availability
email_chain.body:
Hi Grace,

Thanks for the response. The goods will be packed as FCL or LCL at the destination warehouse in Riga.

Regards,
Max

email_chain.subject: Status of the Vessel
email_chain.body:
What's the current status of the vessel? Any news you can share?

Best,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Re: Status of the Vessel
email_chain.body:
Hi Nada,

Here are the latest developments on Almarakib:

1. The vessel is currently outward bound.
2. The Pakistani captain of Almarakib is low on funds and is willing to transport items from our port to Pakistan to earn some quick cash. He operates as a freelancer and is open to taking on jobs as long as he is paid upfront.
3. He is requesting $30,000 upfront. To cover this, we will need to take out a loan, which we cannot afford. As a result, I have decided to sell my share of the ship to pay off the loan.

I am currently at the bank finalizing the details and have agreed to let the bank take your share of the ship to settle the loan.

Best regards,
Sada

email_chain.subject: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Good day Kris,

We have 8kMT of bulk sugar ready in Santos for Wanganui. Could you share your best offer, and will there be any discount if laytime is under 12 hours?

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Re: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Gday Kris,

I would like to check if we can sell you a total of 8kMT of sugar for Wanganui with Jan/Feb arrival at FOB USD 345/MT. Please let me know what you think, and if we can discuss further or try to sign some POs.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Re: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Thanks for that, Kris. I have a great deal for Wanganui if you can accept it. May I know if the buyer will accept all shipments? If not, we can try to split the sugar for different buyers so that all shipments are loaded.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Re: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Hi Kris,

As per our discussion, please find below details for your analysis:

- My unit rate is USD 345/MT C&F Wanganui.

Case I:
- 10kMT Sugar Qty: 3500MT, 2500MT, 500MT
- Quantity: 5500MT
- Containerized Sugar Qty: 3550MT, 2950MT, 200MT
- Quantity: 4700MT
- Overall Average Unit Rate: USD 330 (converted from USD 345/MT)

Are you okay with the rate? If so, I can try to sign the first contract and get things done faster.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Re: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Hi Kris,

I need to take up your offer as soon as possible and sign the contract. I will pay you the first USD 50K once you get the contract. Hope to hear from you soon.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Re: Bulk Sugar Offer for Wanganui
email_chain.body:
Can you please provide the contract details so I can share them with my director for approval? Also, if possible, could you send the terms and conditions so I can ensure all parties involved are satisfied? Thanks for your help.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

Would you please provide a quote for our shipment of 10,000MT of M.G. wheat from Dalian to Durban? Can you include any extra charges for overweight or additional services?

Thank you,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your quote. Your quote of $7,350 is a great value for a premium wheat like our M.G. We were hoping you would have enough stock to allow us to charter your vessel to Dalian to load. When is your next voyage to Dalian?

If we could charter your vessel directly from your current port, perhaps London, that would greatly reduce our shipping costs, and we would definitely prefer to charter with you. We will arrange for our vessel to load with your wheat and deliver it to Dalian, where we will book a voyage to Durban.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. Although we understand that your vessel is heading to Australia, you may be aware that we will have the opportunity to charter a vessel that is in Durban. We would appreciate it if you could provide further details on this option.

Best regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Anderson,

We believe your quote for $6,500 is very attractive. We are holding the quote open until the end of the week to allow time for our enquiry to be approved.

Thank you,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

Thank you for your reply. We look forward to hearing back from you by Thursday when we will be able to consider your revised quote.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote - 10,000MT M.G. Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Martin,

We note your revised quote is less competitive than your original quote of $7,350. As we stated in our first enquiry, we are trying to obtain the best value for our shipment of wheat, and it would be unwise to have a new agent. We still hold your initial quote of $7,350 open for the time being.

Regards,
Olivia

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Your new C-Flex 1100 vessels have arrived at Ningbo Port. Would you like to charter this for our next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong? It’s a 4,000 tons shipment of polystyrene.

When do you plan to start delivery?

Regards,
Violet

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Violet,

Our C-Flex 1100 vessels have indeed arrived. They can be chartered for your next shipment of cargo from Ningbo to Hai Phong. What is the shipment’s ETA?

I’ll need you to provide more information about the shipment, such as:
- The cargo’s name, weight, and volume (in cubic meters)
- Any hazardous materials on board
- Cargo description
- Cargo price
- Lashing for securing the cargo
- Additional requirements (e.g., reefer containers for temperature-sensitive cargo)

We can prepare a quotation once we have all the required details.

I look forward to your reply.

Regards,
Alwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

Thank you for your prompt response. The shipment’s ETA is approximately 10 days from now. Below are the details you requested:
- Cargo Name: Polystyrene
- Weight: 4,000 tons
- Volume: 5,000 cubic meters
- No hazardous materials
- Cargo Description: Packaged polystyrene for industrial use
- Cargo Price: $500,000
- Lashing: Standard lashing required
- Additional Requirements: None

Please let me know if you need any further information to proceed with the quotation.

Regards,
Violet

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Violet,

Thank you for providing the shipment details. Based on the information, we can offer a charter rate of $50,000 for the shipment from Ningbo to Hai Phong. This includes standard lashing and handling.

Please confirm if this rate is acceptable, and we can proceed with the necessary arrangements.

Regards,
Alwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for C-Flex 1100 Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

The charter rate of $50,000 is acceptable. Please proceed with the arrangements, and let me know the laytime start and end dates once confirmed.

Regards,
Violet

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Dates and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Could you let us know what the earliest possible dates are for shipping 3000MT of turpentine from Durban to Alexandria? We don’t need FOB, but we’d like to fix rates asap.

Best,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Dates and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Andre,

Just to clarify, I did not write Email 2 - I did not exist at the time Email 2 was written. Do you want me to believe that? Or do you want to apologize and accept that you made a mistake?

Best,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Dates and Rates
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Let me know. You could say, for instance, you wrote email 3 in a hurry, when you were not at your best. I didn't exist at the time. In terms of your earlier comment, 'No, Daniel. I did not exist then. I could not have written it then.' Just to say that we know that you were the one who wrote the email. There is no dispute about that. It's your name on the email. There is a difference between what you wrote and what you did.

That's fair enough. My other reason for contacting you was to discuss the statement on our website, where it says: 'We don't have access to the rest of the page of letters.'

Best,
Andre

email_chain.subject: Quotation for Polyester Shipment

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Jane, I hope this email finds you well. We have a client looking to ship 50,000 MT of coal from Newcastle, Australia, to Qingdao, China. Could you provide a freight quote for this shipment? Please include details on vessel availability and any additional charges. Looking forward to your response. Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer a freight rate of $25/MT for this shipment. The vessel 'MV Oceanic' is available, with a DWT of 80,000 and LOA of 220 meters. Laytime is estimated to start on 2023-10-25, with a discharge completion date of 2023-11-05. Let me know if this works for your client. Best, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Coal Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Jane, Thanks for the quick response. My client has agreed to the terms. Please proceed with the booking for 'MV Oceanic'. Could you confirm the laytime details and provide the contract for review? Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Coal Shipment - Confirmation
email_chain.body: Hi John, Great to hear! I’ve attached the contract for your review. Laytime will commence on 2023-10-25 at 12:00 PM and end on 2023-11-05 at 12:00 PM. Demurrage charges, if applicable, will be $15,000 per day. Please confirm receipt and let me know if any changes are needed. Best, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Mr. Cuenca,

Last call to book space on a free 50-foot container moving from Ningbo to Savannah. I'd like to hear from you by the end of the day!

Regards,
Neeta

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

We did book the container, and it will go in around 2 weeks. We also have one 20ft container going from Shanghai to Laem Chabang around the same time.

Regards,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643 x225
Fax: 604-557-3644
Email: pcuenca@jdptransportation.com
Website: http://www.jdptransportation.com

email_chain.subject: RE: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Paul,

Great - you booked a 50-foot container, which is not in our scope! Are you sure we have a 50-foot container deal with you? If we had a 50-foot container deal with you, I would've thought you would've offered us the container first because we are an origin-based company. Also, I'm not sure what 'book' means in this context. There are not many 50-foot container companies in Canada, and if we had a deal with you, I would be sure about that.

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

Yes, we will book it as you wish. We will also book the 20ft container for you; however, we need to move it as an OOG from the main line to the OOCL main line. We need to move it to Keelung for OOCL to pick it up from there. We have booked a 20ft container for your company to move from Shanghai to Kaohsiung. We will need the original BL or amendment for the move from Shanghai to Laem Chabang.

Thank you,
Regards,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643
Email: pcuenca@jdptransportation.com

email_chain.subject: FW: Free 50ft Container
email_chain.body:
Paul,

I am looking for the agreement first. We don't trust your company. We don't need you to book a 20-footer for us. We were never notified that you offered us a 20-foot deal. We don't need anything else from you unless we have the agreement.

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.subject: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Hello Vincente,

Based on last year's grain harvest, there will be a low supply of wheat this year. I can arrange a wheat shipment in early August from Odessa to Barcelona, and my usual demurrage clause is 300,000 USD.

Look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Wheat Shipment from Odessa to Barcelona
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Good to hear from you. Right now, I'm expecting the demurrage fee to be higher than usual, and the insurance premium will increase by 5%. I believe we can complete the transaction in early August.

Waiting for your reply.

Best regards,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Vincente,

This is a reminder that we are expecting your reply about the grain shipment. Will there be a high demand for this in early August?

Look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I apologize for the delayed reply. There are some concerns from the banks about the fluctuation of the market and the guarantee. We can sign the contract if we have a win-win result after the completion of the grain transaction.

Best regards,
Vincente

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body:
Vincente,

Thanks for your prompt reply. We have a contingency plan for the banks in case of any problems.

Look forward to working with you soon.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Contract Signing
email_chain.body:
Eddie,

Is the contract still going to be signed?

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract Signing
email_chain.body:

Yes, we will sign the contract. We have the complete transaction in 1 week.

Best regards,
Eddie

email_chain.subject: Re: Contract Signing
email_chain.body:
Eddie,

Excellent news! I'm looking forward to the transaction!

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Contract Confirmation
email_chain.body:

Eddie

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Student Visa
email_chain.body:
Hi Martin,

How are you? I hope everything is going well! How was your trip? Did you have a good time in London? I'm doing well now and I miss you.

I wanted to ask about the student visa. Could you provide some information?

Thanks!

Sincerely,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Student Visa
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

I'm doing well, thank you! My trip to London was great, and I just returned to Canada. I'm glad to hear you're doing well too.

Regarding your student visa, please remember to bring it when you visit the office. The office is located next to a bookstore called Barnes and Noble in the downtown area. I hope you can stop by and say hi sometime. The office has a beautiful view of the city, and I think you'll like it.

Looking forward to seeing you!

Sincerely,
Martin Stewart

email_chain.subject: Vessel Readiness for 3,300MT of Lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Fred,

Please advise vessel readiness for 3,300MT of lubricants from Genoa to Haifa this Friday, if at all possible. Could you let me know as soon as you receive this email?

Kind regards,
Giulia

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Readiness for 3,300MT of Lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Giulia,

Which type of ship? DWT? When ETA? If container ship, do you have details for all Vessel Instructions? If so, please provide in PDF format and attach to your reply.

If you have not arranged any space with shipping line yet, then when you do arrange, please send me details so I can confirm our rate. To clarify, does your company have existing VLCC business with any of the major oil majors? If so, please advise rates and fix as necessary, in US Dollars.

In any case, please send me a copy of the B/L or OBL as soon as we have completed shipment. The original B/L or OBL to go to our agent at Haifa for delivery to buyer.

I look forward to your reply, thanks.

Best regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Readiness for 3,300MT of Lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Fred,

Thank you for your email. We don’t know yet which shipping line they will choose. We will tell you as soon as we get the confirmation. Yes, we can offer you best rates for VLCC fixing or spot. Could you please confirm what kind of ships do you normally fix? DWT range, age, agency, and that kind of information.

Best regards,
Giulia

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of our rates and service for shipment of 3300MT lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Giulia,

In response to your email of 11/28/08, we would like to advise you that we have sufficient, fixed VLCC cargo space for 3,300 MT of lubricants. The loading port is in Genoa and the discharge port is Haifa. We can arrange delivery from the loading port by truck, rail, or barge.

The rate for carriage by sea is EUR 14,000 per MT. We have estimated our charges at EUR 20,000 and USD 400. (attached as Exhibit A)

Our commission rate is USD 1,000.

The term for this shipment is CIF as shown in the attached general terms (Exhibit B).

The bill of lading is our own form of bill of lading.

Best regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Re: Confirmation of our rates and service for shipment of 3300MT lubricants from Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Giulia,

I’m waiting confirmation from ship owner about your enquiry. If you have any update, please let me know. I have other space for you next Friday. They want to confirm with you this week. If you would like to book the space in advance, I can fix it for you with other charterer. Let me know if you would like to book in advance, before getting confirmation from ship owner.

Thank you.

Best regards,
Fred

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Sven,

We’re looking to ship 5,500MT of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. Please send your rate ideas along with a preliminary quote and any specific questions.

Sincerely,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thanks for your email about our transport of wood panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao. What is the weight of the panels? If they are 1.6 cubic meters (a typical wood pallet size) with a panel thickness of about 2.5cm, that’s approximately 1,000kg/m3 with a density of 1.7. Do you have any other measurements?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hi Susan,

Yes, all panels are 1.6 cubic meters and 2.5cm thick, so I can use your equation to find the weight (1,000kg/m3 * 1.6 cubic meters = 1,600kg).

How about this deal? How many cubic meters can your truck transport from Bordeaux to Bilbao? How many total trips will the vehicle make? What is the total cost for transport?

Thanks!
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hi Jeremy,

Thanks for your email. Our truck can transport 24 cubic meters at a time from Bordeaux to Bilbao. The total cost would be 10,000 euros. We will also cover all of your customs costs and administrative fees in the EU and at the destination. Will you need any special equipment or additional services?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hello Susan,

I am excited to get a deal on our wood panels! I have a few more questions to ask about the transport. Can we discuss these details in person? Maybe over the phone or via video chat? I'm free now if you are.

Thanks,
Jeremy

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote - Wood Panels from Bordeaux to Bilbao
email_chain.body:
Hello Jeremy,

Yes, we can discuss the details in person. If it's more convenient for you, I can meet you at the cargo port in Bordeaux. The coordinates are 44.8370° N, 0.5980° W.

Is that okay with you?

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Dear Betsy,

We’re expecting 6,600MT of household chemicals to leave Antwerp on Friday. If you could advise your final freight rate, we can accept it.

Thank you,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Confirmation for Household Chemicals
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

I can confirm that the rate I quoted you earlier still stands: US$2.00 per ton FOB Antwerp, plus US$10 per package in case the packages are of different dimensions.

Should you require additional details, please let me know.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Handling David's Freight Rate Request
email_chain.body:
Here we go again! This is the third request for a quote in one day, and David seems to have given a full quote in his original email. Why do I have to explain this to him every time?

What are some reasons for replying to an email twice? Paragraph 2 (this one) gives specific reasons in the writer’s first email. Her husband’s email serves to remind her that David is not as familiar with the company’s rates as she is.

Explain how this form of explanation might serve to establish greater rapport.

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling David's Freight Rate Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Dave,

Why don’t you just offer the rate per ton and let David accept it or suggest alternatives?

Do you remember in our training course, we learnt that the purpose of most email communications is not just to reply with ‘yes’ or ‘no’, but to help others make a decision?

David’s just a little reluctant, but he will accept it and agree to it if you can help him to make a decision by making your rate specific enough.

Best wishes,
Betsy

email_chain.subject: Re: Handling David's Freight Rate Request
email_chain.body: Dave, I wrote you an email in the last section. Please tell me how you replied.

labels.final_freight_quote: 2.00 per ton plus US$10 per package

email_chain.subject: Urgent Need for Petroleum Coke
email_chain.body:
Hello my old friend,

A little birdie tells me you have an urgent need to get 3,000MT of petroleum coke into Cape Town. You don’t have space on the F/A ABLYN which is at Latakia? Are you going to wait for her next stop, after a quick turn around in Sudan? Or are you desperate?

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Offer for Petroleum Coke
email_chain.body:
Hi again,

Here is the story. I can make you an offer you can’t refuse. Remember when I mentioned a quick turn-around in Sudan? Well, the job is not for me. It’s for my cousin. He has taken over my business. He is not as nice as me. Don’t worry, I can get your oil to South Africa.

Yours,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Good Deal on Petroleum Coke
email_chain.body:
Salam Aliki,

Remember me? I was one of those sailors you knew in Dubai. I am in Cape Town now. I have a good deal for you.

Three thousand metric tons of petroleum coke, saphire black, stored in an oil tanker on the Black Sea.

First offer: $500,000 second offer: $150,000 per metric ton for the whole load.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Petroleum Coke Deal
email_chain.body:
Salam,

Let me know if you want the deal. The seller is asking for 150,000 dollars per metric ton. The deal will be closed when you sign the contracts. An independent bank will transfer the funds after the transaction.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Final Reminder: Petroleum Coke Offer
email_chain.body:
Salam,

The seller is still waiting. I told you not to wait too long to reply to this offer. If you don’t, someone else will. Who knows where this oil will end up?

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Confidential: Petroleum Coke Deal
email_chain.body:
Salam,

There is something I haven’t told you. This deal is too good to be true. But, I’m desperate. I need to make a lot of money to start a new business. It’s something I can’t refuse.

I am not a sailor like you. I will deliver the oil to you. I will arrange all the details. You will only have to make the money. You will have to deposit a sum of money in my bank account. My lawyer will prepare the contracts. He will deliver them to you. I will show you my proof that the oil is real.

Salam,
Sid

email_chain.subject: Cargo Loading Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Mendoza,

We have a cargo of 2,200MT which we are hoping to load onto a feeder vessel on the 15th, departing Barcelona on the 17th. The discharge is at Puerto Madryn in Argentina.

Please confirm your earliest loading date and advise on transit times.

Kind regards,
Anne Marie

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Loading Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne Marie,

The cargo you have quoted will fit comfortably on the MV ACATENANGO. This ship will load in Aviles, Spain on the 13th March and sail the following day to Puerto Madryn, Argentina.

On arrival in Puerto Madryn, the cargo will discharge in two weeks' time, which should be the 26th March. This will give you approximately two weeks transit time from Spain to Puerto Madryn.

I will send you the following details by email:
- Laycan: 13th March
- Preliminary D/D
- Report of Findings: 12th March
- First Week: 15th-22nd March
- Second Week: 22nd-29th March
- D/D (SPB form)
- Expected discharge: 26th March
- Invoice: 19th March

Please confirm the delivery to Puerto Madryn, Argentina.

Best regards,
Ms. Mendoza

email_chain.subject: Milestones for Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Milestones to be completed between [14.03] and [20.03]:
- 14.03: MM automatically notifies the principals of the completion of the 'Report of Findings'.
- 18.03: MM automatically notifies the vessel owner of the completion of the preliminary D/D.
- 18.03: Vessel owner should approve the D/D within 24 hours.
- 18.03: Vessel owner is required to download the preliminary D/D and secure the vessel.
- 20.03: The first week of the pre-laycan D/D expires.

Best regards,
Maritime Management System

email_chain.subject: Contract Confirmation for Cargo Shipment to Argentina
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Chartering Multipurpose Vessel

email_chain.subject: Port Dues and Fees for Bulk Carrier in Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ferris,

My name is Samuel, and I am the vessel broker for a Chinese bulk carrier currently docked in Chittagong, Bangladesh. We have 3,800 metric tons of heavy plates to load, with the destination being Port Louis, Mauritius.

We have been provided with the following port dues and fees, which are to be deducted from the cargo:

- General Cargo Port Dues: USD 3,256.00
- Coast Guard Charges: USD 164.00
- MFAF (Mauritius Free Airport Fee): USD 112.80
- Port Corporation: USD 159.84
- Generator Rental: USD 0.16/hour * 12 hours = USD 1.92
- Empty Tank Cleaning: USD 10.00 * 2 tanks = USD 20.00

Could you kindly take these charges into account when submitting the final quote?

Best regards,
Samuel

email_chain.subject: Re: Port Dues and Fees for Bulk Carrier in Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Dear Samuel,

Thank you for your email. Unfortunately, it is not appropriate for you to pass charges like these on to the cargo owners without their explicit consent. If you can provide evidence that these charges are the owners’ responsibility—for example, a bill of lading with a clause allowing the carrier to deduct port dues from the cargo—we might be able to discuss a rate increase to cover these expenses. However, if you are simply adding charges to cover your agency’s costs, this is unethical, and we will not proceed with payment.

Additionally, we require more details about the cargo, such as its origin, grade, and product code. This information will enable us to provide a more accurate freight quote.

Please provide as much detail as possible in your emails to expedite the process and avoid unnecessary delays.

Best regards,
Alain Ferris

email_chain.body:

- Blt Chongqing:
  - Spot period: 10,000 USD
  - September delivery: 9,750 USD

  - Spot period: 60 USD

Captain X, Horeb Shipping

email_chain.subject: Change in Destination to Shantou
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain X,

Thank you for your prompt reply. We would like to book the cargo as mentioned in your email. However, the destination has changed to Shantou. The details are as follows:

- Quantity: 30,000MT (weight)
- Type: Soybean meal
- Packed in 50kg jumbo bags
- Packed in 1,200 bags per 40'HC container
- Destination: Shantou
- Port of loading: Chongqing

In June, my company agreed with a dealer to sell the soybean meal at 1,300 USD per MT. I'm wondering if we can still proceed with this price for the September shipment.

Thanks in advance.
Sulek

email_chain.subject: Updated Freight Rates
email_chain.body:
Dear Sulek,

I've checked with our freight representative, and unfortunately, the rate you mentioned is no longer available. Since your July inquiry, freight costs have been rising continuously. For September, the rate is approximately 12,000 USD for 30,000MT, which is significantly higher than your original contract of 1,300 USD per MT.

Given the current market conditions, it may be challenging to sell the soybean meal at the previously agreed price. Please let me know how you would like to proceed.

Regards,
Captain X

email_chain.subject: Decision to Cancel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain X,

This is terrible news! It seems we cannot proceed with the shipment under these conditions. The original contract price was 1,300 USD per MT, and reducing the price further would result in a loss. I don't know how to explain this to the client.

I think it's best to cancel this deal and inform the seller. Thank you for your assistance.

Sulek

email_chain.subject: Acknowledgment of Cancellation
email_chain.body:
Dear Sulek,

It's unfortunate that we couldn't proceed with the shipment. If you reconsider and decide to minimize the loss by fixing the rate, please let me know. Otherwise, I understand your decision to cancel the deal.

Regards,
Captain X

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Suez Canal Delays
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I have heard that some vessels are taking longer than usual to pass through the locks at the Suez Canal. Could you confirm if this is true? Additionally, do you think this might delay my shipment from China to Long Beach?

Sincerely,
Donald

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Suez Canal Delays
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I also heard about vessels experiencing delays at the Suez Canal. Could you explain how this might affect my shipments?

Sincerely,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Suez Canal Delays
email_chain.body:
Dear Donald,

I hope this message finds you well. I understand that you have some questions regarding the Ever Given ship and the backlog of vessels at the Suez Canal. Let me try to address your concerns.

Firstly, the Ever Given ship was successfully dislodged from the Suez Canal on March 29th, after being stuck for almost a week. However, it remains in the canal until it can be re-fueled and towed to another location for repairs. The process of refueling and repairing the ship is expected to take several weeks.

As for the backlog of vessels in the canal, the congestion has indeed caused delays. As of May 2nd, there are 67 vessels waiting to enter the Suez Canal, while an additional 55 are waiting to exit. This situation is likely to affect shipping schedules, including your shipment from China to Long Beach.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Logistics Team

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Sulphuric Acid Shipment from Aqaba to Khor Fakkan
email_chain.body:
Good day Ms. Kelly,

I’m inquiring about 3,400MT of sulphuric acid from Aqaba to Khor Fakkan. Could you handle a late-July laycan, and are you open to a short load window?

Best,
Aqaba

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sulphuric Acid Shipment from Aqaba to Khor Fakkan
email_chain.body:
Hi J. Pye,

I’m writing you about your question. However, due to some problems with confidentiality, I will have to address this email as being from someone other than me.

I can handle a late July load date, but you must understand that it may take us a few weeks to secure the necessary permits. You can help speed things along by hiring a third party to find out who the permits are issued to, and to pay them for their services. Your cargo is a noxious substance that has been denied to others in the past, so this must be done delicately. The load window can be as short as 3-4 days, but we’ll have to include that in the permits, too.

Yours,
Aqaba

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Sulphuric Acid Shipment from Aqaba to Khor Fakkan

email_chain.subject: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:

Regards,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:
Ashley,

We can accommodate a shipment of 3000MT of garbage, but I'm concerned by your use of a boxship. It will transport the garbage, but it will be costly. My advice is to consider a less expensive route, such as land transport. Let me know if you'd like to explore other options.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:
Ashley,

We’d be happy to take on your job! Before we proceed, we need to clarify a few details:
1. What is your trade?
2. What is the final destination for the garbage?
3. Are there any specific handling requirements (e.g., toxic waste)?

Our vessel is one of the largest in the world, but we can optimize the shipment to reduce costs. Let us know how you’d like to proceed.

Best regards,
Xee Xee

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:
James,

Don’t worry, we’re not disposing of the garbage into the sea! We’ll ship it to Lome. We’ll handle all the paperwork. The ship can have the laycan from 19 May to 23 May. What is the total cost to ship 3000MT to Lome?

Thanks,
Ashley

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:
Ashley,

We are a humanitarian charity and are only authorized to operate in certain ports, such as Belgium, Austria, and Switzerland. Lome is not within our permitted destinations. Could you clarify your intentions and confirm the final destination?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Rye Miley (a garbage company) email
email_chain.body:
Ashley,

I’m getting confused. Are you in the garbage business, or are you seeking assistance with disposal? We are not equipped to handle ocean dumping, and your interest in this raises concerns. Please clarify your requirements.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Interesting Projects and News
email_chain.body:
Hey All,

Since I’m out of the office this week, I wanted to share some interesting projects and news for you to check out while I’m away. Here are a few highlights:

* Click here to learn about the Fertilizer Institute’s new Code of Conduct, which includes nine guiding principles for good behavior, including the encouragement of a culture of safety and compliance with the law. 'Anyone who works with anhydrous ammonia or other fertilizers must read this, and they must share it with their teams,' says Director of Regulatory Affairs Brian Jennings.
* When a group of California manufacturers and distributors went before the California Air Resources Board (CARB) to discuss the 2013 Renewable Fuel Standard (RFS) proposed by the U.S. EPA, they did not leave empty-handed. A bill was introduced in the state legislature that would provide a tax incentive to encourage renewable fuel blending.

Best,
Steve

We are also reevaluating our shipping schedules. Unfortunately, we are shipping later than we did last year due to unfavorable weather conditions. We will keep you informed as conditions improve.

Additionally, some 20-inch rocks have not made it to the Southeastern states due to the weather, and we are unsure when they will arrive.
