email_chain.subject: Cargo Detainment in Liberia
email_chain.body: Greetings! My name is Mary Wells. As a financial advisor to the Wilson family, I am pleased to introduce this matter to you, especially since you have proven your ability to carry out your operations without much delay. I wish to inform you that the personal effects of my clients, Mrs. Glenda Wilson and Mr. Michael Wilson, were loaded onto your vessel named MT 'Unknown' and shipped from Southampton to Monrovia, Liberia, dated 10th May 2008. The goods, which comprise one Rolls Royce and four pieces of household goods, have been detained by the Liberian authorities for the past three years as they claim that the customs documents were not properly filled. This has forced Mrs. Glenda and Mr. Michael Wilson to incur huge demurrage and storage fees which they cannot afford to pay now.

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Detainment in Liberia
email_chain.body: Thanks for your email and apologies for my delay in replying. I don’t think that there is an issue with the cargo in Liberia; it is no longer onboard the vessel. However, I have sent you a scan of a document from the shipping line saying that they can assist with releasing the cargo. It’s my feeling that there is a bureaucratic delay in Liberia, and you might have to employ a solicitor to assist. Do you have any ideas about that? Best regards, Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability and Demurrage Rates Inquiry
email_chain.body: Ah yes, that explains a lot. We’ve not got any vessels at present. Sorry. Regards, Steve

email_chain.subject: Assistance with Cargo Release in Liberia
email_chain.body: I have some information for you regarding what I’m sure will be your next job. You need to visit Liberia. I’ve made an arrangement with the Liberia International Trade and Transportation Secretariat to assist you with the release of the cargo. I’ll send you a document of authority signed by the director of the importation department at the customs department of Liberia. Do you have a representative there who will be able to pick it up on your behalf? If not, let me know, and I’ll contact the Liberian secretary. Don’t worry about the rest, I’ll handle it. Regards, Steve

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bluth,

We have 100 tons of LPG to ship from Bahrain to Cairo, Egypt. We are interested in your available 25,000DWT vessel and would like to discuss laycan and ETA.

We would also like to know whether the goods are dirty or clean.

Thank you,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Sophie,

Thank you for your inquiry. Can you please share the material specification? This will help us provide a more accurate offer, including details on laycan, ETA, and IFO price.

Best regards,
Mr. Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bluth,

Thank you for your reply. Here are the material specifications: C3+ Headings 2711, 2712, 2903, 2905, 290.

Could you please provide an estimated FOB price and any additional information about laycan, ETA, and IFO price? We might not need the shipment as soon as initially discussed, but we are also considering an earlier date.

Thank you,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Sophie,

Thank you for providing the material specifications. Based on the details, we can offer a price of $100,000 as a 5% deposit and $95,000 as 95% L/C at sight, plus $3,000 for insurance. Please note that freight charges are not included in this offer.

Let us know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Mr. Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for LPG Shipment from Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bluth,

Thank you for your offer. Could you please include the insurance amount, insurance rates, and freight charges in your final quotation?

Best regards,
Sophie

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry for Caprolactum from Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We’d like to cargo 300MT of caprolactum from Cotonou to Dover. Could you suggest if after-hours berthing is available and if we could load on a vessel berthed at a berth located in the South Container Terminal?

Regards,
Pauline

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry for Caprolactum from Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Thanks Pauline,

I checked the schedules and I think you mean the Commodore. This is our weekly spot cargo service, loading containers for France.

The Commodore berths at the South Container Terminal but we can't berth there this week. There are no slots available and the berths have to be occupied in a particular order.

South Container Terminal berths are occupied in this order:
5, 1, 2, 4, 7, 3, 6

This week we have the Commodore coming in from Kingston on Wednesday. This is the first available berth for that vessel so we are expecting her to be berthed at 6 South. The ship is due to sail to Cherbourg on Friday night.

I hope this helps.

Regards,
Geraldine

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry for Caprolactum from Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

Do you know which berth and slot the next Commodore is going to berth? We've had cargo arriving and other cargo waiting for loading so we could try and get an early booking.

Regards,
Nigel

email_chain.subject: Bulk Cargo Loading Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We will need some bulk cargo loading in the next few days. Could we get some advice as to which berths will be free next week?

Thanks,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Discussion on Current Business Situation
email_chain.body:
Deidra,

I thought it would be useful to start a dialogue about the current flat situation. Do you agree that January levels are unsustainable and, if so, what will it take to increase business?

With best regards,
Teo

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Current Business Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I cannot say more at this point. However, I know that we could start a conversation by considering reducing prices to the point where we could generate a large volume of business again. What do you think about it?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Current Business Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I am not against the idea, but I need to be convinced that it is good for the business in the long term. Anyway, I know that January levels are unsustainable, and it is better to consider reducing prices and increasing the volume of business rather than going down the road of layoffs.

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Discussion on Current Business Situation
email_chain.body:
Teo,

Let us continue our conversation to define together what our level of business in the short and long term would be in a scenario of sustained price reduction. What is your current opinion on that point?

With best regards,
Deidra

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Could you provide us with the best rates for a 150MT shipment of steam coal to Tocopilla, Chile? Please include a complete quotation covering all freight, brokerage, storage, and other relevant charges.

Regards,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

My name is Douglas Brown, Director of Romco Mining Ltd. We specialize in the mining and export of various types of coal globally. Our specifications for steam coal are as follows:
- Sulphur: 1.5% max
- Calorific Value: 6,000 kcal/kg min
- Ash Content: 15% max
- Moisture Content: 5% max
- Volatile Matter: 23% max
- Other Minerals: 18% max
- Fines: 5% max

Given these quality standards, we are confident in the marketability of our coal. Please provide your price per ton CIF to the port of Antofagasta. We will review and respond promptly.

Best regards,
Douglas Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

We look forward to receiving your offer. In the meantime, we invite you to visit our website for more details about our company, subsidiaries, and team. You can also take a virtual tour of our facilities, including our mining and processing plants. Our website is optimized for mobile viewing and has been recently updated.

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

I have reviewed your website and found it very impressive. The navigation is intuitive, and the layout is well-organized. I particularly appreciated the Product section, which details coal quality, and the Quality, Health and Safety, and Environment sections. Your commitment to worker safety and operational excellence aligns with our values. The visual tour was also a great addition.

Could you please provide the prices and complete specifications of your product?

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Dear Jon,

Unfortunately, we cannot meet your request for coal with a maximum of 18% other minerals. Please consider other offers.

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation - 150MT Steam Coal to Tocopilla, Chile
email_chain.body:
Dear Ron,

Thank you for your response. Could you provide more details about why your product does not meet the 18% other minerals requirement?

Best regards,
Jon

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Singapore to Colombo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Batra,

We expect to ship 3,000MT of motors from Singapore to Colombo by April 1st. Would your vessel be available for a short-term voyage, and are you flexible on ballast condition?

Best regards,
Ernest

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Singapore to Colombo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ernest,

The 'Coastline' is currently berthed at Kakinada on the Indian coast, and I expect to receive her draft survey report on or about the 25th. Her charterers are currently assessing the bunkers required by the vessel for Singapore, however, we may be able to depart the previous fixture for Singapore as early as the 26th of March.

As far as ballast conditions are concerned, your charterers could also try 'Coastline's' current charterers (i.e., 'Sambalino' of the same owners) as they will be arriving from a short-haul fixture at the moment and may be in a position to proceed immediately to the loading port in ballast. Alternatively, you may wish to proceed ballast and obtain fuel in advance of loading.

Any more information you require, please feel free to contact me on the below.

Best regards,
Mr. Batra

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Singapore to Colombo Shipment
Re: Vessel Availability Inquiry for Singapore to Colombo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Batra,

Thank you for sending the Sambalino draft survey. I am pleased to inform you that Sambalino would arrive in 6 days. Please revert for further details. We are expecting to send the draft survey of the Coastline shortly.

Best regards,
Ernest

email_chain.subject: Charter of Vessel for Animal Feed
email_chain.body:
Hi Vidyasagar,

I was wondering if you could help us charter a vessel to carry 24,000 MT of animal feed from Mukah to Iloilo next month? We’re in a bit of a rush, so please let us know if you have anything available. Also, what are your rates and what’s your usual demurrage rate?

Many thanks,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Transportation of Refuse Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Vidyasagar,

I have 2 containers of refuse oil on board HUJ 101N. I need your advice on the transportation. I want it split into 2 or 3 tanks and moved by tanker barge. Can you kindly advise me on how to best move them to the next port?

Regards,
Chaitanya

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter of Vessel for Animal Feed
email_chain.body:
Hi Laura,

I have an empty, full cargo hold available on my AHTS vessel, which is currently booked out of Mukah by a refinery to transport 20,000 MT of crude oil. The vessel is ready for redelivery and has been in light maintenance mode since being discharged from the refinery 10 days ago.

Here are the vessel details:

Vessel Name: AHTS Legend – POA
Vessel Year: 2009
Type of Vessel: AHTS, DP2, Ice Class 1C
Class: KR
Hull: JZ2 1702
Machinery: HTG-Diesel
Gross Tonnage: 3205t
Net Tonnage: 959t
Dwt: 4142t
LOA: 90.40m
LBP: 85.40m
Beam: 18.20m
Depth: 7.50m
Draft: 5.4m
TEU: 50
HFO: 1300 tons
Fuel consumption: 6 mt/hr
Speed: 13 Knots
Cargo: Deck area 1200 square meters, 3 tanks

Let me know if this works for you.

Regards,
Vidyasagar

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter of Vessel for Animal Feed
email_chain.body:
Hi Laura,

Very sorry for the delay, but your vessel has just been chartered, and I’m finalizing the charter details now. If you’re still interested, you’ll be good to go in a couple of days. I’ve sent a copy of the email below to you. Kindly confirm if you’d like to proceed.

Regards,
Vidyasagar

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter of Vessel for Animal Feed
email_chain.body:
Hi Vidyasagar,

We’d like to charter your vessel for 24,000 MT of animal feed from Mukah to Iloilo, with delivery scheduled for 24 March 2014. If you have any questions about the cargo or timeline, please let me know.

Regards,
Laura

email_chain.subject: Offer for Oil Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ahmed,

I'm writing on behalf of Mr. Kane to offer our tender and services to ship your oil from St. Petersburg to Ankara. In our experience, we have successfully handled similar loadings within the specified time frame. Please see below for our best offer:

- Date of Shipment: 15.06.2021
- Product: M-1000
- Origin: St. Petersburg, Russia
- Destination: Ankara, Turkey
- Quantity: 55,000 MT
- Payment Terms: CIF + HLD
- Payment Mode: 20% IFT / 80% TT

Our offer is valid until 05.06.2021. If you would like to discuss this further, please don't hesitate to call or reply to this email.

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Oil Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Felix,

Thank you for your email dated June 15, 2021. We have a long-standing relationship with your company and greatly appreciate your work with us. We can confirm that you are among our preferred shippers. Please feel free to submit a quote.

Kindest regards,
Mr. Ahmed

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Oil Shipping Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ahmed,

We are happy to submit a quote for you. We have been transporting gasoline to St. Petersburg for over 6 years and have extensive experience with the Russian bureaucracy. Please see below for our best offer:

- Date of Shipment: 15.06.2021
- Product: M-1000
- Origin: St. Petersburg, Russia
- Destination: Ankara, Turkey
- Quantity: 55,000 MT
- Payment Terms: CIF + HLD
- Payment Mode: 20% IFT / 80% TT

We can also ship your cargo to Dammam or Bandar Abbas, if that is preferable. Please confirm the validity of this offer, and we will draw up the contract.

Best regards,
Felix

email_chain.subject: Request for Aluminum Billets Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Susan,

Could you arrange for the loading of 8,000MT of aluminum billets from Port Klang to Karachi? Also, are your ship chandlers reliable?

Sincerely,
Gert

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Aluminum Billets Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Gert,

We were informed that the ship that went to Karachi in mid-April was the 5000mt Midas Glory, owned by ICB. After a short delay, they loaded 6 x 50MT billets.

If you wish, we can assist you in loading this cargo on a ship scheduled to sail from Port Klang in May. We can also supply bunker, provisions, and ship's stores if needed. Please visit our website at http://www.singarama.com.sg or send me an email with the details of the cargo and ship, and we will get back to you.

Regards,
Susan

For your convenience, we have also included a scanned copy of the email for your records. The document was received via e-mail and is an exact copy of the original.

email_chain.subject: Ship Agency Services in Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Hi Susan,

I am a ship agent in India. We operate a regular service from Chittagong to India. Can you provide ship agency services for us in Chittagong? We are currently servicing Bangladesh.

Thanking You,
<Name>

email_chain.subject: Re: Ship Agency Services in Chittagong
email_chain.body:
Dear <Name>,

I will contact our branch office in Chittagong, Bangladesh, and have them get in touch with you. Please provide them with the necessary details.

Regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Oil Cargo Inquiry for Nigeria
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We require an oil cargo for Nigeria by April 15, 2010, for 120,000 metric tons. Kindly confirm if you can supply and please revert.

Sincerely,
<Name>

email_chain.subject: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: James, I’m working with three broking teams on a refinery contract. Wondering if you are getting any inquiries from US Gulf, but are not interested in Med/Rotterdam. Kind Regards, Felix

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Alfred, We can see if we have any other broking teams who are working with them. But what do you mean with 'not interested in Med'? Regrets, Myles

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Hi Felix, I have just passed your email on to our commercial team to see if we can assist. Best regards, Nicole

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: We do have some teams working on this and will chase them up. Myles

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Hi Nicole, I was referring to teams not interested in Med. I have put my enquiry to my superior and will revert. Kind regards, Felix

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Hello Felix, I have replied to you via the work email and I hope you can see the answer there. Best regards, Tatiana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Hello Myles, I have spoken with the team about this and they say they’re working on it. They do not have details about the refinery at the moment. All the best, Tatiana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiries on Refinery Contract
email_chain.body: Hello Felix, I have spoken to the commercial team and I have to go. I am not able to find any information at the moment, so I don’t know who to forward your email to. Best regards, Nicole

email_chain.subject: Status Update on Cargo Laycan Extension
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Xander,

Could you advise the status of our previous conversation? Our buyer wants to go for a laycan extension on the above cargo. Please advise.

Sincerely,
Liz

email_chain.subject: Re: Status Update on Cargo Laycan Extension
email_chain.body:
Hi Liz,

Can you please check with the buyer to see if they need us to declare CIF or FOB? We can give a trade price on an FOB basis. If they need CIF, then that needs to be added to the price.

Thanks,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Re: Status Update on Cargo Laycan Extension
email_chain.body:
Hi Liz,

Can you please check with the buyer to see if they need us to declare CIF or FOB? We can give a trade price on an FOB basis. If they need CIF, then that needs to be added to the price.

Thanks,
Xander

email_chain.subject: Re: Status Update on Cargo Laycan Extension
email_chain.body:

Sometimes we are not getting good sailings for our vessels due to tonnage/delivery date issues. What should we do in such circumstances? email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Our ship is berthed at SOHAR for discharging cargo of urea, and in a few hours, the cargo will be discharged. We are approaching for the next cargo. If there is any inquiry regarding any cargo from your side, please let me know your proposal.

We are ready to carry any type of cargo as per vessel strength, with 40 days in ballast. You are requested to send any cargo inquiries directly to the owner's email, as it will be taken care of by the owner. Please advise if there is any inquiry from any company about any cargo; there is no need to send details through an agent.

Kindly note that under the above circumstances, it will save a lot of money spent on agency fees for discharging cargo in the port.

Regards,
Captain

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Solution on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I am sorry that we didn’t find a solution for the cargoes on the DFRA vessels. I understand that if my offer of $5.25 is not satisfactory, then a freight should be negotiated at the price of an alternative vessel. I look forward to hearing your proposal.

Many thanks,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Solution on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ed,

We regret that DFRA was not able to fulfill the commitment given to you by the master of the sea-going DFRA and express our sympathy at the difficulties this must have caused for your company. If you would like to enter into discussions for a future contract, we will gladly take this up with you. If you need some payment for the cargoes already on board, this may be possible. However, we regret this will not be possible at a higher rate than the rate quoted for the passage itself, i.e. $5.25.

We await your instructions.

With best wishes,
Cullen

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Solution on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I know this will not be possible at a higher rate than the rate quoted for the passage itself, i.e. $5.25. But I thought I would ask anyways. We just found out that we are in serious financial trouble. We will be lucky to make payroll next week. I am hoping that you will be able to find it in your heart to show some mercy. We know you have so much money. You see, you need to trust us. We can do this. We will find a way. Please let us use your ship. We’ll pay back the money once we have time to figure it out. But you need to help us out. Thank you for your time. We know you will be able to make the best decision possible.

Best regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Solution on DFRA Vessels
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ed,

I’m sorry to hear that you’re in trouble. However, I’m not able to help you. The rules are strict and this is what is written in the contract. I hope you will be able to make payroll somehow.

Best regards,
Cullen

Peter

email_chain.body:

Thanks for the offer. Alas, we're no longer in a position to offer our services.

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Payment and Cargo
email_chain.body:
A short while ago, you offered to carry goods on my behalf to Durban, and I was to pay you US$2800. I did pay, but I have never heard back from you or your company. Could you please confirm if you have received the payment? Is it in my favor? I would really appreciate your swift response.

Thanks,
Rudi

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Payment and Cargo
email_chain.body:
Rudi,

Thanks for your patience. A certain cargo of ours failed to get through customs in South Africa, and as a result, I could not send you the money. We tried again the next day, but the problem persisted. I have only just spoken to the customs people, and they've agreed to do me a favor. The cargo in question is ours, but the papers are in the name of a different company. They've agreed to let the goods out so I can get hold of my money. If I can get my money in a few days, I'll send you the payment and make arrangements for it to reach you.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Payment and Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Thanks for your email, and I'm sorry about the delay. What exactly do you mean when you say your money has failed to get through? I'm keen to find out as much as I can. Also, what's the current status of the cargo?

Regards,
Rudi

email_chain.body:

Good day!

Our website currently shows a 6% discount on the service you are inquiring about. Based on your email, here is an estimate for your shipment:

- Carriers: Sea Land
- Ocean Freight: 1,862 USD
- Cost Savings: 3%
- Consignee/Port Load: Shippers/Port Origin
- Port: 1,858 USD
- Amount: 362 USD
- Port of Discharge: Long Beach
- Total in US $: [Calculated Total]
- Payments: 6% OFF

Fine Print:
- Westport: We do not have local agents at this port. We only ship out from LA, Long Beach, or Hueneme.
- This means we cannot arrange local delivery pickups or heavy handling activities at the port. These must be arranged by the owner of the shipment or by a third-party company.

Best regards,
Ms. Helberg

email_chain.subject: Transport Inquiry for Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Hey Jane,

I am interested in taking on a cargo of used milkers. If we could move the milkers from Lydenburg, RSA to Gaborone, Botswana, can you send us the details for loading and unloading on each side, along with a complete logistics and transport plan?

Sincerely,
Karen

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Our milkers will arrive on 28 July 2016 from Cape Town to Lydenburg by ship. If you can receive these milkers by road and transport them from Lydenburg to Gaborone, Botswana, please let us know your plans and the cost of the transport.

Sincerely,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Yes, we can take the milkers off the ship at Lydenburg and transport them from there to Gaborone. We will use our tippers and 40ft containers for transporting these milkers. We will receive them and bring them to Gaborone where you will be able to pick them up.

Cost of transport will be:
- Lydenburg to Gaborone: R7000 per tipper
- Load, transport, and discharge at Gaborone: R12,000 per container

Please let us know when you will receive the milkers on the ship in Lydenburg so that we can plan our collection.

Sincerely,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport Inquiry for Used Milkers
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the logistics plan. The milkers will arrive on 27 July 2016 at 09h00. The ship will berth in Lydenburg at 09h00 and will be at anchor waiting for customs clearance and other paperwork.

Please pick the milkers off the ship at 09h00 as the captain of the ship will sail at 13h00 to Cape Town.

Also, please let us know if you want to transport these milkers from Lydenburg to Gaborone by tippers or trucks, and we will prepare an order for the milkers.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Rubber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Joseph,

Thank you for your email. Could you please confirm the following details:
- Origin: Guangzhou, China
- Destination: Manila, Philippines
- Quantity: 2,000MT
- Payment Terms
- Export License
- Delivery Time

Thanks,
Ting

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Rubber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ting,

Please find below the shipment terms and conditions:
- Origin: Guangzhou, China
- Destination: Manila, Philippines
- Quantity: 2,000MT (approximately 28,000 boxes, Gross 1000@1.2 Tons)
- Payment Terms: The exporter shall arrange a Bank Letter of Credit to the order of Kimono Inc. (Korean Export Company). Cash / Bank Cashier Check in US Dollar at 60% of value in the Letter of Credit. The balance shall be paid in cash upon confirmation of inspection results at origin.
- Export License: Appropriate customs and commercial licenses
- Delivery Time: By sea, with 21 days ex-work, 15-30 days by air, as per agreement.

Sincerely yours,
Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for Rubber Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Drew,

Please note the following conditions:
1. Your company shall provide a Letter of Credit in favor of Hapag-Lloyd (Shipping line).
2. You will be responsible for all taxes, duties, and associated costs including local, state, and federal.
3. Your company will bear the cost of the shipment, including packing and insurance.
4. The cost of the shipment shall be paid on the 10th day of the last month of every quarter.
5. The shipping schedule shall be agreed upon between your company and Hapag-Lloyd (Shipping line).
6. The shipment shall be delivered 30 days after the shipment date.

Best regards,
Ting

P.S. 1000 Boxes is $2,500.00 per tonne. 28,000 Boxes = $70,000.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Import Restrictions for Pine Lumber
email_chain.body:
Hi Lyle,

We’re considering shipping 35,000 metric tons of lumber from Vancouver to Inverness. Can you advise us about the import restrictions for pine?

Warmly,
Logan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Import Restrictions for Pine Lumber
email_chain.body:
Hi Logan,

Thanks for your email.

Unfortunately, the shipping of pine from Vancouver to Inverness is banned by law. I’m afraid we’re going to have to pass on your shipment.

Best regards,
Lyle

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Import Restrictions for Pine Lumber
email_chain.body:
Hi Logan,

Actually, there’s an alternative – the business needn’t try to find out whether the lumber is in compliance with U.S. law, but simply can certify to that effect. A problem arises in distinguishing between logs and lumber, and lumber that has been cut and sawn and lumber that is not sawn. And even a commitment to pay for a formal inspection would not be sufficient to get past U.S. Customs’ questions. So, when the importing country wishes to assure itself that U.S. law is being complied with, the issuing country may provide an assurance in the form of an import certificate, an export certificate.

Best regards,
Lyle

email_chain.subject: VLGC Cargo Booking Request
email_chain.body:
Hi Jack,

I would be happy to book a 7,000MT VLGC cargo for August from Fujairah to Rotterdam. We would like to arrange 3-5 vessels as soon as possible. Could you send the broking team details and further information?

Thanks,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Charter Requirements and Terms
email_chain.body:
Jack,

As mentioned earlier, please see attached our company's terms and conditions which we would like you to sign in return. We will also send you the same request as we sent to LME.

Regarding our booking requirements, as discussed earlier, we are willing to book 5-7 vessels on a voyage charter basis for 1,000-10,000MT with the following cargo requirements:

Commodity - JP54
Origin - Asia
Destination - West Africa
1 or 2 vessels with DAP or CIF for each cargo.

We would also like to charter other vessels on a shorter route for 1-2 weeks each, and the same freight terms should apply as above. If you can please arrange these chartered vessels on a regular basis. We would like to make these bookings in June and July.

Look forward to receiving your response.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Charter Requirements
email_chain.body:
Jack,

I just wanted to check that you had received and signed the attached. We have now received the signed copies from all your brokers, which will be sent to you soon.

Regarding the other chartered vessels, as you can see from the attached schedules, there is a lot of uncertainty in both Asia and West Africa, and it may be difficult to charter vessels. We will try to provide you with options if we can.

We have also prepared a list of the cargoes that we would like to book for each vessel in the 1st week of August. Please see the attached.

We look forward to receiving your comments.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Follow-Up on Cargo Options
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It has been over 4 weeks since we sent our last email. We need you to provide us with options on some of the cargo in Asia. We have requested this of your broker LME, however, there has been no response.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Final Request for Charter Options
email_chain.body:
Jack,

I am writing to you in your capacity as the owner of General Products. We sent you some chartered vessels that you have not responded to. We are writing to you to provide you with the information so that you can provide us with the options for these cargo.

We have attached the charter vessels and the different cargoes that we are considering. We have requested these cargoes from you in the past, however, you have failed to reply to our emails. Please see the attached and provide us with options so we can arrange the vessels.

As you are aware, time is of the essence.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Termination of Collaboration
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It is with disappointment that I have to inform you that we have had to choose to work with another company to secure our vessels. We are finding it very difficult to make bookings due to the time it is taking you to respond to us.

Best,
Vanessa

* Destination: Shallow seaport in Oman

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Import Restrictions for Electronics and Medical Products into Canada
email_chain.body: Can you advise on the import restrictions for electronics and medical products into Canada? Thanks, Janet

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Import Restrictions for Electronics and Medical Products into Canada
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your prompt response to my request. When I called your office yesterday, the staff were very helpful but unfortunately they did not know your company's status in Mexico. Also, I am aware of air freight costs and times, but unfortunately the customer has no access to air freight for this specific shipment. Therefore I will have to rely on the quoted charges of your company to compare.

The proposal for your company includes the following information. Could you please confirm if this information is accurate?

a. Your company will pick up the container from our premises, pack it according to our requirement and consolidate other shipments as necessary for us. All this will be done at no extra cost, plus the freight charges, as quoted in your proposal.

b. There will be an additional charge of $350.00 on reaching the Port of Entry to pick up the container and obtain the 'Bill of Lading'.

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Status Update
email_chain.body:
Mike,

In response to your email below, I must apologize for my delay in replying. I was out of town on business for a few days. Your shipment has been sitting in the receiving bay for the past week and, except for a few calls from me, the loading has yet to begin. Your shipment arrived at our port of origin (Toronto) on Monday the 5th of November.

The supervisor in charge of the loading area tells me that some of the pallets were not properly packed and a few were even too heavy. I am currently working to resolve these issues and will keep you updated on the progress.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Shipment Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Peterson,

Thank you for your assistance. I am following up on the shipment details and would appreciate any updates you can provide.

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Material and Transit Times
email_chain.body:
Good morning Brian,

Thank you for sending the material for us to review. I've attached a copy of the letter to Mr. Blanchard with a few questions at the end of the letter. Since I was not working with your company before, please advise if these questions are satisfactory. Also, I am aware that the transit times you have provided are the averages. However, in your proposal you said that transit times would be from day of receipt to day of dispatch. Please clarify if there are certain dates on which the container should be at the destination port so we can plan accordingly.

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Arrangement

I will send you a tentative booking for the Paul Kruger with all of the details to review.

email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

I have now had to refer your company to our solicitors in regards to the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp that you purchased from us back in March. This has now been ongoing for almost 12 months, and you have continuously promised payment yet failed to do so.

You have now wasted a considerable amount of our time with your constant lies, and I am extremely upset by this. This is the final time I will be contacting you, and I advise that you take this matter very seriously as our solicitors will be taking action against your company.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

Tom Murphy

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Methanol Shipment from South Korea to New Zealand
email_chain.body:

It’s been almost a month since we last communicated. I was hoping you might be able to help me secure a tanker for a methanol shipment from South Korea to New Zealand. The tonnage required is 8,000 dwt, and the vessel can be loaded from mid to late May.

Let me know if you need further details, and I can provide additional information.

Brad Thompson

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Methanol Shipment from South Korea to New Zealand
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Thompson,

Thank you for your email. We are an organization with a network of trading companies and are willing to supply fuel to New Zealand at this time. If there are no conflicting interests, would you consider us a partner in this endeavor?

Please let me know if I can provide you with any additional details or information.

Best regards,
Khadija Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Khadija,

We are interested in offering you our services, but we have some questions first. Have you sent this email to anyone else? If yes, could you please share the number of recipients?

Additionally, please note that it has come to our attention that you might be engaged in activities that conflict with our policies. We have zero tolerance for such dealings and are currently verifying this information. If it turns out to be true, we will take necessary actions, including blocking your email account.

Best regards,
Alice
Support Department

email_chain.subject: BECS Quote for Trip from Sines to Houston via Rotterdam
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on BECS Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Sorry for the delay. We've completed our interview with a seafarer working in the industry, and I wanted to follow up with you for any new information you might have.

What was the final BECS quote you received?

Isaac

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in BECS and Fuel Charges
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

I just got the bill from my employer for fuel and BECS. It looks like I am paying 2600 euros, and my employer is charging 6500 euros. That's $7000. Do you think there is any way to reconcile this?

Isaac

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request for LNG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Parkin,

Could you please provide a freight estimate for 6,000MT of LNG from Mopan in the US Gulf to Antwerp in July? Additionally, is port rotation compulsory for this service?

Kind Regards,
Cassie Manwell

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for LNG Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Manwell,

Thank you for your enquiry. We have prepared a proposal for the movement of 6,000MT of LNG from the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. The price for the cargo is based on a fixed FOB rate as outlined in the proposal. Alternatively, we can offer this cargo with a FCN, calculated at a rate of $1.20 per CBM based on the declared CBM of the cargo. In both scenarios, the CIF rate is fixed, and the cargo would be delivered to the discharge port on the same day.

Regarding port rotation, this would be at the shipper's request, subject to prior agreement between all parties.

Please review the proposal and send back a copy of the commercial terms (either C/P or C&F) at your earliest convenience.

Best Regards,
Mr. Parkin

email_chain.subject: Enquiry on GCM/Voyage Charterparty Provisions
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Parkin,

With reference to our recent email communication, I am writing to inform you that our chartering division has raised an enquiry with London regarding our agreement with their provisions in terms of the GCM/Voyage charterparty (as drafted by BIMCO).

This charterparty refers to a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM as the basis of calculation for a FCN charter. This rate was introduced to reflect the charterer's ability to make a simple and accurate calculation based on the CBM stated on their cargo. However, our customer, Shell, has indicated that they will not proceed with this arrangement for their LNG shipments unless the CBM charge is less than 90 cbm.

We are also requesting that BIMCO revise the wording of the applicable provision in the GCM/Voyage Charterparty to ensure clarity and alignment with our customer's requirements.

Best Regards,
David Dalschaert

email_chain.subject: Proposed Amendment to GCM/Voyage Charterparty
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Parkin,

In line with our previous email communication, please find attached a proposed amendment to the current GCM/Voyage charterparty draft that BIMCO has produced for consideration.

The proposed amendment is as follows:

18.30.1 Freight shall be calculated at $1.20 per CBM based on the CBM declared by the cargo.

This amendment would be effective for cargoes delivered after 1st January 2003.

Please let us know if you would be agreeable to this amendment. If so, we will proceed with submitting this to BIMCO for their review.

With many thanks,
Best Regards,
David Dalschaert

email_chain.subject: Available adhesives space? Antwerp to Liverpool.
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

Could you handle a 2,600MT cargo of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool before month’s end? Also, can you provide your typical demurrage and dispatch rates?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Available bitumen space? Yanbu to Jeddah.
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

Got a question: any chance you have space this week for 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah? Please let me know if demurrage might be an issue.

Cheers,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on adhesives shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Olsen,

One of the greatest challenges we all face in the ocean freight market is breaking through the noise and finding the shipping capacity to transport cargoes from port A to port B at a good price, with reasonable delivery times. With this in mind, I'm writing to see if you can help me with some much-needed space in the coming weeks. I'll be looking to send 2,600MT of adhesives from Antwerp to Liverpool.

If this seems like a good match, please let me know your pricing, as well as any relevant booking terms and the ports you can accept. Please also send your demurrage and dispatch rates so we can plan for them in the event of a delay.

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on bitumen shipment
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Dorsey,

One of the greatest challenges we all face in the ocean freight market is breaking through the noise and finding the shipping capacity to transport cargoes from port A to port B at a good price, with reasonable delivery times. With this in mind, I'm writing to see if you can help me with some much-needed space in the coming weeks. I'll be looking to send 4,800MT of bitumen from Yanbu to Jeddah.

If this seems like a good match, please let me know your pricing, as well as any relevant booking terms and the ports you can accept. Please also send your demurrage and dispatch rates so we can plan for them in the event of a delay.

Cheers,
Adam

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on Dry Petcoke Tenders
email_chain.body:
Greetings Mrs. Bird,

We are waiting on a number of tenders for an 8,000MT cargo of dry petcoke to Port Elizabeth. We’re currently unsure if the US Gulf can produce enough tonnage to meet our requirements. Can you please provide some estimated tonnages, and inform us of any other points of origin that could be competitive?

Kind regards,
Lewis Brereton

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on Dry Petcoke Tenders
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

The M/V Ostende is due to load a cargo of Petcoke from Grays Harbor, and delivery is scheduled for early November. The US Gulf is the only origin that we can produce in volume. We currently expect to have sufficient petcoke available to meet all of our charterers' requirements. However, you will still need to present your documentary requirements (full set of Bills of Lading (BLs), your Charter Party, LPA Form 1, and their most recent IOPPCA, etc.) to obtain our booking approval.

The US Gulf produces 3 grades of petcoke: a very fine grade, a coarse grade, and a lamellar (wax-contaminated) grade. We are able to book all 3 grades of petcoke on an as-available basis.

We will soon update our webpage with the latest information.

Best regards,
Mrs. Bird

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry for Cargoes to China
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

Would you please kindly provide us with detailed freight rates for the following cargoes to China:

- S/2106: 60,000MT LDPR 18-20%CL 42,000 – 56,000
- S/2196: 6,000MT N-HEXANE

Thank you for your attention.

Yours faithfully,
Ms. Ho

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

These are some of the best pricing sources for dry bulk ship broking data. However, I am unable to assist with specific brokerage inquiries at this time.

Best regards,
Mr. Tompkins

email_chain.subject: Dry Petcoke Availability for November and December
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

We shall have dry petcoke available for November and December loading. We shall have about 10,000-15,000MT per load. Please advise the price, including the cost index.

Kind regards,
Mr. Shan

email_chain.subject: Request for Confirmation of PVC Shipment to Manila
email_chain.body:
Dear Luca,

Could we get our 8,600MT shipment of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) to Manila delivered on time? Let us know if you have room on your laycan this week, and how quickly we can get the freight rate confirmed.

Thank you,
Simon

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on PVC Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

You sent me a confirmation from Sofia last week, but unfortunately they cancelled it when they received the revised request for freight and the quote for 1,650,000ft² in which we required that they make it 100% Ullage and also allowed for the customs duties and transportation cost to Sofia to be paid from their end.

If you were to confirm the space, the cargo would be allowed to be imported under the Free on Board Freight term, in which the clearance cost and custom duties are the responsibility of the shipper.

Please let me know the best way forward as soon as you can.

Kind regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Agreement Reached for PVC Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

You may be interested to know we've reached an agreement with our supplier to get the entire shipment delivered for 14,400 USD! Great news! Please confirm our booking as soon as you can.

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on PVC Shipment Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hi Luca,

I'm writing to you again to let you know that we're still waiting to hear about our shipment. I hope you're able to take the time to reply soon.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation Documents
email_chain.body:
Dear Luca,

I have been tasked with looking after the quotation you sent to my company. I would like to know when you are going to send me the quotation documents?

Kind Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Discrepancy in Coal Shipment Invoice
email_chain.body:
Dear Hanz,

The coal shipment from last month was supposed to be 15,000MT, but the final invoice was for 30,000MT. We need a swift resolution for this. Can you please provide us with a new invoice?

Yours Sincerely,
Simplice

email_chain.subject: Re: Discrepancy in Coal Shipment Invoice
email_chain.body:
Dear Simplice,

This is not the first time I'm receiving similar complaints. The new invoice is not your fault. The information we have is that the coal came in 30,000MT instead of 15,000MT. However, you can rest assured that we are going to check this ourselves and provide you with a new invoice in less than two weeks.

Yours Sincerely,
Hanz

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Maria,

We have 24,100MT of coal ready in Pulau Belawan bound for Kuantan. Is there a way we could move this to Muara Berau instead? Kindly provide us an updated estimate for delivery date and draft limitations.

Best regards,
Makara

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thank you for your email. I have asked our shipping department to look into the availability of tugboats in Kuantan. We shall confirm with you as soon as we have further information.

Best regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

Thank you for your enquiry. Unfortunately, we cannot guarantee the availability of tugboats at Muara Berau due to limited resources. However, we will do our best to assist you with your transportation needs. Our vessel is currently sailing from Muara Berau towards Pulau Belawan and we estimate arrival at Muara Berau on 13 May. We will provide updates on the availability of tugboats as soon as possible.

Kind regards,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Makara,

There are no vessels available at Muara Berau for the next 4 days. In order to minimize your waiting time, we have found a tugboat service company that has vessels available near Jakarta, which is about 12 hours away from Muara Berau. Their pricing is higher than our normal tugboat services, but they are able to guarantee availability within 48 hours. Would you like us to proceed with this option? Kindly confirm with me on your decision.

Thank you,
Maria

email_chain.subject: Request for Diesel Movement
email_chain.body:
Hello Tom,

Could we move 40,000MT of diesel from Panama to Nantes next week?

Kind regards,
Susan

email_chain.subject: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I am writing to you as I need your help. A couple of days ago, I received an email from my contact person in the company. The reason is that the invoice of the company has not been paid. But I cannot understand it.

It has been explained to me that the delivery documents have been lost. So, according to my knowledge, it is important for the company to give me a copy of those documents. I will do my best, but I cannot reach the person in charge right now. I will contact him later this evening.

But my friend, we are talking about a considerable amount of money.

The contact person told me that it could be a problem to get the copy of those documents, but it should not be a problem. However, I wonder if you have any idea what could be the problem? I need to know how much.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Can you help me? I want to check the grammar in this email, but I need to know if my analysis is correct.

The email is talking about the documents that have been lost. So, the writer is asking the receiver about the documents, not to pay the amount of money.

I would like you to help me. Can you please check the content and analyze it?

Thanks for your help.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I would like you to check the email to make sure I did not make any mistake. If the email is about money lost, I need to do something. Otherwise, the contract will be broken. I will be at my office next week.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Dear Tomas,

Your email is not about money. The email is asking for help. But the manager has already been informed about the problem, and he will help you. You need to help the manager and try to explain to him that the mistake has been made and not you. He will give you all the documents you need.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Thanks for your help. I have received your last email and I am now sure I understood the content of the email. So, there is no problem.

By the way, I will be out of my office next week. I will not be able to receive emails for a week.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Help Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I am happy that you are still out of your office. But I am still looking for a way to make sure that the documents were not lost. The manager of my company is furious. He does not want to give me any help. I do not understand it. He is my friend, so I do not understand his behavior. What should I do? Could you help me?

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request for Barley Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Nudell,

My company wishes to book a vessel to transport 15,000 MT of barley from South Africa to India. We have contacted the cargo port today, and they confirm a loading window of 10-15 August.

email_chain.body:
Good day, Mr. Nudell,

I would like to inquire if you can arrange an FOB shipment of soya cake (13,500 MT) from South Africa to China. The expected cost is $310-330 per MT, plus an agency fee of $220-250 and insurance cost of $0.60/MT.

Please let me know if your rates fit within this range.

I look forward to your reply.

Regards,
Isenia

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, I hope this message finds you well. We are looking to ship approximately 5000 metric tons of wheat from Houston to Rotterdam. Could you provide us with a freight quote and available vessel options? Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body: Dear John, Thank you for your inquiry. We can offer a rate of $25 per metric ton for the shipment. The vessel 'Ocean Carrier' is available and can accommodate your cargo size. Please let us know if this works for you. Best, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, Thank you for the quick response. The rate and vessel sound acceptable. Could you confirm the laytime and any potential demurrage charges? Best regards, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body: Dear John, The laytime is set at 72 hours with a demurrage rate of $5000 per day thereafter. Please confirm your acceptance so we can proceed with the booking. Best, Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Shipping Rates
email_chain.body: Dear Jane, We accept the terms. Please proceed with the booking and send us the contract details. Thank you, John Doe

email_chain.subject: Update on Our Collaboration
email_chain.body:
Hello Jorge,

I hope you and your family are doing well.

I've enjoyed working with you over the last couple of years, and I am sure that I am not the only one who feels this way.

Although things are looking good right now, I'm afraid we may have to part ways due to merger and alignment talks going on in the background.

Best wishes,
Dana

email_chain.subject: Concerns About Company's Current State
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Munoz,

I hope you are doing well.

I think we met at the last GM Conference, though I don't believe we've spoken since. I am writing because I am concerned about the current state of my company.

As you may know, our CEO, Mr. Smith, is leaving and is rumored to be heading for JPS. The news had a significant impact on the market cap, with our stock down 8 percent on the day of the announcement.

The plan is to name an interim replacement while a search is conducted to find a successor. Obviously, this is not the best time to be making a change, but it seems unavoidable.

With that said, I'm looking for advice on how to turn this situation around.

Best regards,
Jeff

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Recent Developments
email_chain.body:
Carlos,

I recently...

email_chain.subject: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body:
Hi Paul,

We heard that our competitors are in the market to ship 9k refined from Hamburg to Singapore. Do you know their fixing level?

Regards,
Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body:
Dear Claudio,

As per my knowledge, those I have worked with in the past in Germany are fixing $30 above the market. However, they are very difficult to deal with.

Regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body:
Claudio,

Do you know their plans for February? They are asking $30/barrel above the market for January delivery.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

You got it. They are holding their views and intend to continue with their own price fixing.

Regards,
Claudio

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body: That's interesting. Could you tell me anything more about them? What makes them different from others?

email_chain.subject: Re: Competitor's Market Activity
email_chain.body: They are absolutely different from the rest of the players in the market. They are very conservative and they are not happy with the low margins they have.

email_chain.subject: Welcome to Hopa Freight - Your Freight Solutions Partner
email_chain.body:
Dear Monica Zhang,

Welcome to Hopa Freight, part of the Shipyaari Group. Based on your profile, you have been pre-screened as a potential partner in the freight market. We specialize in providing innovative freight solutions tailored to your needs.

If you wish to stop receiving emails from us, please click here: [Unsubscribe].

For more information on how we handle your data, please review our [Privacy Policy].

To update your details, click here: [Update Your Details].

We encourage you to visit our FAQ page to learn more about our services, including what to expect when you book with us and how our freight buying model differs from traditional approaches.

Thank you for considering Hopa Freight for your logistics needs.

Best regards,
Hopa Freight Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Broker Agreement and Next Steps
email_chain.body:
Dear Monica Zhang,

Thank you for your interest in Hopa Freight. As requested, I am attaching our Broker Agreement to this email. Please review the terms of service carefully. If you agree, kindly sign and return the document to us via email.

From your feedback, I understand that you are particularly interested in exporting freight to China. Once we receive the signed agreement, I will assign a dedicated broker to assist you with your needs. Our extensive network in Europe and beyond allows us to handle freight to various destinations, including China and other European countries.

We look forward to collaborating with you and supporting your international transport requirements.

Cheers,
Phil McBride
Hopa Freight

email_chain.subject: High Sulphur Naphtha Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: High Sulphur Naphtha Inquiry

email_chain.subject: Re: High Sulphur Naphtha Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Dear Dylan,

Please find attached our P&L/Specification. The cargo would need to ship immediately.

email_chain.subject: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Sterling,

Would you provide a quote for shipping 13,000MT of diesel from Singapore to Savannah, Georgia? Additionally, do you typically allow free discharge time?

Thanks,
Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Ben,

Thank you for your inquiry. To provide an accurate quote, I need some additional details:

1. Do you have 13,000MT ready to ship in one lot or in smaller lots?
2. What vessel type are you shipping with?
3. What is the quantity in one shipment?
4. Is this one shipment or a continuous cargo?
5. Is this a contract or spot charter?
6. Will the cargo be drummed or bulk?
7. Do you need an L/C, or are you paying with cash?
8. Would you like C&F or FOB rates?
9. When is the earliest the cargo can be shipped?
10. Would you like a freight guarantee?
11. Will you be applying for a bank guarantee? If so, what kind of guarantee do you need?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards,
Mr. Sterling

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Shipping Quote
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Sterling,

Thank you for your prompt response. Here are the answers to your questions:

1. I have between 8,000 and 12,000MT ready to ship immediately, and 13,000MT ready in the next 3 weeks.
2. The vessel type is a 75,000MT T1 Double Hull Tanker.
3. The quantity per shipment will be between 8,000 and 12,000MT.
4. This will be a continuous shipment, with one trip at a time.
5. This is a contract charter.
6. The cargo will be shipped in bulk.

For the remaining questions, I will need to consult with my team and get back to you shortly.

Best regards,
Ben

Regards,
Svetlana

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Freight Finalization
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

For the above email that you have sent to Minoo, I wonder, was the information contained in that email a true reflection of what the company was looking for, or did she just request that particular bit of information?

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Freight Finalization
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

She had asked for it in her last email.

Regards,
Svetlana

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Freight Finalization
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

Well, that's pretty cool! I suppose I just wanted to hear it from you, directly from the horse's mouth! It just wouldn't be cricket to let it drop without asking you a few direct questions. That little bit of information was probably something of an over-simplification, because I know for sure that it is not always possible for her to finalize freight within 24 hours of quoting.

Best regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Freight Finalization
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

I'd just like to say that I really appreciate you being so forthcoming with information. It has helped me to understand the situation better. So thanks for that!

Best regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Freight Finalization
email_chain.body:
Dear Svetlana,

I am very grateful for you clearing this up for me. It is much appreciated.

Best wishes,
Robert

email_chain.body:

Regards,
Thomas Rosenthal

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body:
If you quote us for a delivery of 10,000MT of crude oil from Panama to Singapore, you will have the following obligations:

1. For an amount of 180,000,000 tons to be loaded at the Panama Canal and discharged in Singapore, you should pay the price of the cargo of US $2,700,000 in advance.
2. You shall send the packing list to us and place the FOB cargo on 5 vessels owned by us for a period of 15 days after we receive the payment from you. This is to demonstrate your intention to close the transaction and to check your ability to fulfill your obligations.
3. You should take full measures to ensure the completion of the cargo loading procedures and inform us in writing that you have the cargo loaded on our vessels for a period of 3 days upon completion of these procedures.

email_chain.subject: Confirmation and Payment Terms
email_chain.body: Upon our receipt of your above-mentioned confirmation, the balance of the funds shall be transferred to your account. This means that we shall have a problem with the closing of this transaction if you do not send us confirmation of the loading of the cargo on our vessels within 5 days. In such a case, we shall not refund the advance payment to you.

email_chain.subject: Requirements for Closing the Deal
email_chain.body:
In order to close this deal, we shall transfer you the payment for the balance in advance and we would like to receive the following information:

1. That you have actually placed the cargo on the 5 vessels as promised (if so, please provide us with full information on each of the vessels and photographs of the ships to ensure that the cargo has been loaded and to avoid any issues upon completion of the transaction).
2. Confirm that our office in Latvia shall receive within 5 days from the receipt of the funds by you, in full, the agreement on the conclusion of the contract of carriage for this cargo between your company and the charterer of the vessels on which you have placed the cargo, and that you will provide us with a copy of this agreement, in full, for our office in Latvia by the above-mentioned date, signed by all parties.
3. Confirm that our office in Latvia shall receive within 5 days from the receipt of the funds by you, in full, the shipping documents, and you will provide us with a copy of these documents, in full, for our office in Latvia by the above-mentioned date, signed by all parties.

email_chain.subject: Angular 2 FormsModule Setup
email_chain.body:
Hi Team,

I wanted to share a quick tip on setting up email input validation in Angular 2. If you're using Angular 2, you'll want to import FormsModule. Here's how you can do it:

1. Import FormsModule:
```typescript
import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
```
2. Add FormsModule to the imports array in the @NgModule declaration:
```typescript
imports: [ BrowserModule, FormsModule ]
```
3. Add [email] to the input tag.

This will give you an input that looks something like this:
```html
<input type='email' [email]>
```

At the end of the day, I found it quite trivial, and I suspect that most people would, too.

Best,
Developer

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 FormsModule Setup
email_chain.body:
Hi Developer,

Thanks for the detailed explanation. I tried it out, and it works perfectly. Just one question: does this approach handle all edge cases for email validation, or should we add additional checks?

Best,
Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 FormsModule Setup
email_chain.body:
Hi Team,

Great to hear it worked for you! The [email] directive in Angular handles most standard email validation cases. However, if you need to handle more specific edge cases, you might want to add custom validation logic. For example, you could use a regular expression to ensure the email follows a specific format.

In the end, I ended up going with the approach that I outlined in the first email. It's super easy to read, and it takes care of most scenarios.

Best,
Developer

email_chain.subject: Re: Angular 2 FormsModule Setup
email_chain.body:
Hi Developer,

Thanks for the clarification. We'll proceed with the standard validation for now and add custom logic if needed later.

Best,
Team

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Author,

I recently read your article on reflective materials in Nature and found it very insightful. Specifically, I was intrigued by the two equations you provided for the refractive index. I am particularly interested in the equation that uses lambda and n. Could you kindly provide a reference or derivation for this equation?

Thank you,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thank you for your message. The equation n=1-sqrt(1-f)/2 is quite general and can be found in most textbooks on electromagnetism and optics. I referenced it in my Nature paper on page 3. Additionally, you might find it in more recent books on plasmonics, such as the one by Jain.

Best regards,
Author

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Thank you for your response. I am specifically looking for a derivation of the equation f2=1-2n, particularly when n=4*Pi/lambda*d*n*d. Do you have any notes or references that could help with this?

Best,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Your question is quite specific and not directly related to the content of my article. However, I can suggest two references that might be helpful:

1. P. Drude, Handbuch der Radiologie, Leipzig: Barth, 1922 (p. 369)
2. N. Jain, C. J. Kryzhanovsky, and C. H. Chen, Excitation and Detection of Surface Plasmons on Gold Films. In: T. Zimmermann, and A. Berger, eds., Coherence, Statistics, and Quantum Optics IV (Springer, 2005) 146-165

Drude's book is considered foundational for metallic materials.

Best regards,
Author

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Author,

Thank you for the references. I have already read them, but I was hoping for a clearer derivation that explicitly shows how the refractive index in the form d*n/d relates to the frequency, lambda, and amplitude of the refractive index.

Best,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Reflective Materials Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I am not aware of a clear derivation that matches exactly what you are looking for. While you might find related derivations in other books, they may not be as clear as you hope. If anyone in the community has a clearer derivation, I would be very interested to see it as well.

Best regards,
Author

email_chain.subject: Visit from the Yip Sisters
email_chain.body: Hey Henry, can we expect a visit from the Yip sisters next week? Please let me know as soon as possible. Kind regards, Evin

email_chain.subject: Re: Visit from the Yip Sisters
email_chain.body: Dear Evin, I’ll be there tomorrow afternoon. Let me know if the timings need changing. Kind regards, Greg. P.S. My son says, 'Yip' to you. Helen

email_chain.subject: Re: Visit from the Yip Sisters
email_chain.body: Good morning, Mr. Evin, how are you today? Yes, I’m coming to your house to learn. But, it’s raining. My parents and my brother, Arian, can’t come. We’re waiting for a better day. It’s a big problem. It’s about rain. Thank you. Yours, Kevin

email_chain.subject: Re: Visit from the Yip Sisters
email_chain.body: Good afternoon. Glad to hear from you. Hope you are doing fine. Thank you so much for the great video. There is no doubt it is very helpful for us. One question I have is when I sent a message by email, can I use 'This is' to introduce myself? I saw a very interesting movie at the cinema. It is about a cat with a magic ability. What do you think about it? The movie is really enjoyable. Thanks a lot. Kevin

email_chain.subject: Re: Visit from the Yip Sisters
email_chain.body: Hello Kevin, thank you so much for sending us a lovely song. Your friend Kevin is a great singer. Your English is really good, too. I'm happy you wrote to us. You can use 'This is' to introduce your message. You can say something like 'This is a song my friend Kevin sings.' 'This is an email I sent my friend Kelly last week.' You can ask a question and talk about a movie like this: 'How was the movie about the cat with a magic ability? It sounds interesting.' Or you can say, 'I'm glad you liked the movie about the cat with a magic ability.' I hope you have a great day. Be well! Olivia and the Yip sisters.

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Acquisition Analysis
email_chain.body:
Dear [Recipient],

I appreciate your email dated [date]. We are still analyzing our options and have not yet reached a final conclusion. The timing of our acquisition of the remaining 15% is part of that analysis. In the meantime, the rest of our business remains as before, and the Board of Directors of ABC will continue to oversee its management.

Kind regards,
Jason McGroarty
RBC Capital Markets
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: RE: Removal of Assets from Controls of ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

I was copied on your email yesterday to Mr. Frank and Messrs. Calloway and Vaughn. Please be advised that pursuant to Section 14.4 of the Purchase Agreement dated November 4, 2004, we have placed certain assets that are subject to the asset transfer agreement that you recently sent over to us in our depository at 15 York St., in Toronto, to await the return of those assets to ABC. These assets are detailed in a list attached to our email of December 14, 2004 (see attachment A). I assume these are the assets that are under your custody. If you have any objections to this deposit, you must advise us.

Best regards,
Jason McGroarty
RBC Capital Markets
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.subject: RE: Removal of Assets from Controls of ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

Thank you for your email. Please be advised that we have no objections to the list you provided to us. However, the list in question has not been previously reviewed by the Board of Directors of ABC, and therefore we are unable to provide you with any information regarding the specific assets. It is our understanding that our list does not conform to the requirements of the Sale Agreement, particularly since the list reflects that we are permitted to retain certain files and information despite the fact that we are prohibited from using or retaining any ABC Confidential Information, as set out in the Sale Agreement. This is a concern to our Board of Directors.

Please be advised that your proposal to place certain of our assets in a depository pending return to ABC is inappropriate and contrary to the terms of the Sale Agreement. Specifically, Section 2.1(a).

Best regards,
Ms. Flippo

email_chain.subject: RE: Removal of Assets from Controls of ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

I just spoke with Martin, but I was copied on the email below. Today is December 17th, 2004, and we continue to have no approved and executed sale agreement. In the meantime, ABC is purging all of our assets and information and sending same to various unidentified third parties and law firms.

We simply cannot accept these proposals in light of ABC's wrongful purging of our assets. All of the discussion contained in your email is irrelevant in light of the purging. Please provide us with a confirmed list of all assets that have been sent to third parties and their names.

Best regards,
[Recipient]

email_chain.subject: RE: Removal of Assets from Controls of ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear [Recipient],

You must withdraw any claim that ABC has breached the purchase agreement. You are not our trading partner; you are our custodian, holding assets that belong to ABC until such time as the transaction is closed.

Best regards,
Jason McGroarty
RBC Capital Markets
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on D2 Cargo Movement from Singapore to Tozeur
email_chain.body:
Good morning Joseph,

I am looking to move 500 metric tons of D2 from Singapore to Tozeur in early August. Do you have any knowledge of how the current strikes are affecting cargo movements?

Kind regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on D2 Cargo Movement from Singapore to Tozeur
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Yes, we've seen significant delays and cancellations due to the industrial action.

Kind regards,
Joseph

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on D2 Cargo Movement from Singapore to Tozeur
email_chain.body:
Hi Joseph,

Do you have any idea how long these delays will continue for? Just wondering if it's worth waiting and seeing what happens or if we should already be looking at alternative routings.

Best regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on D2 Cargo Movement from Singapore to Tozeur
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

With the strikes still continuing, it's difficult to say for sure when cargo movements will return to normal. However, it's worth considering alternative routings, as delays and cancellations are likely to persist in the short term.

Kind regards,
Joseph

email_chain.subject: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Gonzales,

Our team has been reviewing the contract for freight containers between Rotterdam and Naples for some weeks now. Do you have any further business questions or suggestions regarding our market analysis?

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body:
Morning Christa,

If I remember correctly, that contract included only containers shipped by steam ship, but I now know that steam ships have been replaced by modern container ships. I'd like to amend that contract to include all types of modern container ships, with an expiration date.

Regards,
Hugo

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body:
Hi Hugo,

I've found some documentation from the 1970s that state there was still a fair amount of containers transported by steam ship, despite being a less economical way to transport containers. What do you think?

Regards,
Christa

email_chain.subject: Re: Review of Freight Container Contract
email_chain.body:
Hi Christa,

That is no doubt true. Steam ships are extremely dangerous for the containers, even the newest containers. The vibrations produced by the steam engines, and the leaks from the boilers, damage most of the containers in transit. That is why we should focus on modern container ships.

Regards,
Hugo

The vessel may need to bunker in Houston or be repositioned to Houston. Below are the details for a voyage from Houston, US Gulf Coast, to Antwerp, Belgium:

- Cargo discharge must be completed within 21 days.
- Loading must be completed within 24 hours of the vessel's arrival in Houston.
- The vessel will be available for loading up to April 25.

- Current SGS dry cargo logbook

Please provide these documents at your earliest convenience.
