email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Jelena,

We have 6,000MT of bitumen from IADC to Maputo. Could you share your available windows and dispatch incentives?

Best regards,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Bitumen Shipment to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Thank you for your inquiry. Unfortunately, our operations are limited to a small network of petroleum engineers within our company hierarchy. As we are not agents of any refineries, our trucks are not available to transport goods from other refineries.

Thank you for your understanding.

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Bitumen Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Jelena,

Good afternoon. I apologize if our previous email was misunderstood. We do not have any other refinery involved in this shipment; the deal is solely between IADC and us. The CIF price offered is specifically for Maputo.

Sincerely,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Clarification on Bitumen Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Greetings. We refer to the emails you have sent and our last response. For clarification, please be advised that we are not a refinery; we are an Oil Services Company, and the trucks belong to us. We have recently entered into a contract with the IADC refinery to ship 6,000MT of bitumen to Maputo. We are inquiring if you have any interested buyers in this location.

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.body:

Thanks for your help,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
Are you sure of your MT readings? Or is this based on MBBL's? These readings seem to be off by a lot. It will probably be several months till the ethanol has finished being stored in the tanks. Check if you can and let me know, please.

Thanks,
X

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request for Ethanol Shipment
email_chain.body:
I just looked up prices for ethanol in Houston from Singapore, from Brazil, and from Egypt. They are all pretty much the same, with a $3 difference. In July, Brazil was cheaper; now in August, Egypt is slightly cheaper. But, you know how quickly that could change.

Now I know that I've tried everything, and I will go back to $1 USD delivered from Maceió and maybe try again later. You could really try and find out the MT readings; I'm going to go with them. I need this so I can estimate how much gas it will take for the sale to be profitable.

Thank you for all your help. You are a great addition to the company.

Best,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Inquiry on New C/P and Panama Canal Tolls
email_chain.body:
Hey Sam,

We are interested in the second shipment of cotton under a 50-ton container in direct sail from Santa Cruz to Newark. Will the new C/P apply the New Panama Canal toll?

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on New C/P and Panama Canal Tolls
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Where can I find this 'new C/P' you mention? I have the latest canal treaty with me, and it says nothing about a new C/P. Can you please clarify?

Best,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on New C/P and Panama Canal Tolls
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

I haven't seen anything in the canal treaty that mentions a new C/P. In fact, there's nothing there at all about rates. It may have something about how the current method of charging is broken down. There is an addendum, which I assume will be applied to container ships and not to other vessels such as your DWT which sail through. It's not my fault.

Since the signing of the Neutrality Treaty between the United States of America and the Republic of Panama of 1926, the Panama Canal has been operated as an interoceanic highway in a manner which has been equitable and impartial to all the merchant vessels of all nations, and in a manner consistent with the operation of other interoceanic waterways. The tolls for the use of the waterway have been established in the Treaty at rates which would be consistent with the tolls charged to vessels.

Best,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on New C/P and Panama Canal Tolls
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I suspect we will have to hire a cargo lawyer. I think you should make the accusation of discrimination then. See if the Secretary of State for Transport will provide a legal opinion. Or failing that, then get a private firm to challenge the 'owners' of the canal in their own backyard. With a guaranteed doubling of the revenue, they should have no interest in the details.

As a minimum, get them to explain the 'adjusted and equitable tolls' arrangement.

Best,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry on New C/P and Panama Canal Tolls
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

I suspect you are right. We won't be challenging it as our masters are scared to death of their nemesis, a lawyer. If the neocons had their way, most of the lawyers in the world would be out of business.

Best,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Cargo Survey
email_chain.body:

We are not familiar with cornstarch cargoes, so I don't know what to survey. I recommend that you try to find someone who handles cornstarch cargoes. Thanks for asking.

Brian

- Country of loading: Malaysia
- Weight of cargo: 30,000 MT
- Dangerous goods: No
- Name of consignee: Cebu Exporters Corp
- Port of discharge: Sual port
- Country of discharge: Philippines
- Price: US$ 500 per MT
- Packing: 100 kg bags
- Payment: L/C at sight

Kindly find attached our original bill of lading, which will be mailed to your port of discharge. We have completed all documentation to facilitate the smooth sailing of our vessel. Please inform the captain of your ship that he can sail at any time. We look forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Tobias

email_chain.subject: Re: Ship's logs (Premium)
email_chain.body:
Dear Judy and Jaime,

Thank you for your interest in our global ISLA services. I appreciate the opportunity to provide some brief highlights about ISLA and our unique Global Data Relays.

At ISLA, we have been providing global telemetry data services for the last 6 years. During this time, our clients have asked us to expand our data services to include other types of monitoring data. We now have a total of 12 data relay stations worldwide, ensuring comprehensive coverage for all your needs.

Best regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Ship's logs (Premium)
email_chain.body:
Dear Jaime,

Thank you for your feedback. I appreciate it.

I am afraid that I may not have fully understood your query. We have the data servers, and the logistics of deploying our data relay receivers is part of our global services. We have had one of our colleagues contact HMA_AMUNDSEN and inform her of your enquiry. We are able to send this sort of data. The hard copy I received from you does not list any vessel name or owner, but I am sure that we can resolve this shortly.

Best regards,
Anders

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Model Batteries
email_chain.body:

Let me know.

Best,
Amin

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Model Batteries
email_chain.body:
Hi Amin,

If a company were to open a trade account with us, we could extend credit up to $500,000. For a commercial account, we could offer credit up to $5 million. This account is for trading products between companies, not individuals.

We do provide shipping services from both Hong Kong and Los Angeles. We also have offices in Sydney and Auckland. Please visit our website for more details.

Feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Regards,
Rob

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Grain Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

I am enquiring about your ability to transport grains from your Sydney port to ours in Seattle. We would like to ship approximately 40,000 tons of grain using your containers.

Could you advise me on the approximate cost and delivery timing? Please also provide a copy of the relevant carriage conditions, along with a contact number, name, and fax number.

Thank you.

Regards,
Jill

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Grain Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding the transport of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

As requested, I have enclosed a schedule and conditions of carriage. The estimated cost for shipping 40,000 tons from Sydney to Seattle is as follows:

- Container service: $55,000.00
- Insurance of goods: $25,000.00
- Total: $60,000.00

This total includes the cost of shipping and insuring the goods. For insurance purposes, we require a complete list of the goods to be shipped, along with their approximate value and quantity. The freight charge is paid directly to the shipper.

The estimated time of arrival is one month from the date of departure. If you have further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Grain Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

Thank you for your request for a quote for shipping 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

Unfortunately, we are unable to provide a firm price at this stage due to missing details. Specifically, the goods to be shipped are not specified, and no approximate value or fixed quantity has been provided.

Once you provide this information, we will be able to give you a firm price. Please provide these details at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Grain Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Slater,

We are pleased to advise that we can offer shipping for 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle. The approximate cost, inclusive of insurance, is $50,000. To proceed, please specify the exact quantity of goods to be shipped.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter,

It’s been a while, how’s everything going with you? I trust you’re still doing well on the ship, and I hope there are no problems! I’m really excited for your plans for the new year. I heard that you’re doing very well as the 2nd Officer on board your new vessel. Great work!

We’re sourcing a 2,500 MT shipment of LPG from Dalian to Fujairah. Do you have a vessel available that’s open in the next two weeks, and at what cost?

Kindly,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah!

Thanks for the email. We just came in from our shift, and we’re happy to hear from you. Please accept our apologies for the delay.

We’re doing well on board. How about you? I heard that you just took a new job, congratulations!

I’m glad to hear about your plans for the new year. You’re looking to find a ship soon, right? We have a vessel that’s available from Dalian to Fujairah in two weeks. At what rate do you wish to move the cargo?

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Peter!

Thanks for the response, we’re doing well on our end. How about yourself? I heard you just started a new job, congrats!

We’re still looking for a vessel to transport the cargo. How soon do you wish to move forward with this?

Best,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sarah,

Thank you for the email. Sorry about the delay.

How are you doing? I heard that you’re still looking for a new vessel to transport your cargo. Don’t worry about it, we understand.

We’re very open for business. We’re actually available now if you can confirm your details by the end of the day.

Regards,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

We’re really excited for the news! Let’s proceed with the details.

Best,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation - Macho Power Office Supply Relocation
email_chain.body:

Our new client Macho Power is looking for a specialist office supply relocation from Boston, USA to Antwerp. It’s a 1,500MT shipment and we require immediate transportation. Can you give us a ballpark quote, if possible?

Thanks,
A

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Quotation Request - Macho Power Office Supply Relocation
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Just following up on my previous email regarding the Macho Power office supply relocation. We need a ballpark quote for the 1,500MT shipment from Boston to Antwerp. Could you provide this as soon as possible?

Thanks,
A

email_chain.subject: Clarification on Transport Mode - Macho Power Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Ian,

I hope you're doing well. My company is currently unsure about the best mode of transport for the Macho Power shipment. We are considering Airfreight, Road, or Ocean freight. Our primary concern is cost-effectiveness. Could you provide a quotation for each mode of transport?

Thanks,
God

email_chain.subject: Urgent Quotation Request - Macho Power Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

We urgently need your quotation for the Macho Power shipment. Could you provide costs for Airfreight, Road, and Ocean freight? Additionally, do you handle full container loads only? Could you also give us an idea of the cost for 100 pallets from the USA to Europe? Please confirm if the transportation costs include insurance and delivery to the factory door.

We are under time pressure and need a prompt response. Please send your rates as soon as possible.

Many thanks,
AA

Hi Ian,

The client has called me today to express dissatisfaction with the current price. They are requesting a new quotation for the following shipment:

- 1,500 pallets of Home Office Furniture

Could you provide a revised quote as soon as possible?

Thanks,
A

email_chain.subject: Python Script and Company Rumors
email_chain.body: I heard rumors about company Z buying company A, is it true? Also, please write a Python script that takes an input file and writes to an output file. Name the script python_exercise_13.py. Run it in the terminal with the command: `python python_exercise_13.py YourInput.txt YourOutput.txt`. Copy the output file to this folder and also to ~/Python_Submission/ex13.

email_chain.subject: Re: Python Script and Company Rumors
email_chain.body: I heard the same rumors about company Z buying company A. Regarding the Python script, I have started working on it. The script will be named python_exercise_13.py and will be executed as per your instructions. The output file will be copied to the specified locations.

email_chain.subject: Re: Python Script and Company Rumors
email_chain.body: Great, thanks for the update. Also, could you write a function that returns True if all the words in a string appear? This will be part of the script.

email_chain.subject: Re: Python Script and Company Rumors
email_chain.body: Sure, I will include a function that checks if all words in a string appear. The function will be integrated into the script. I will also ensure that the script handles input and output files correctly.

email_chain.subject: Request for Loading Rate and Demurrage Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Zou,

I am looking to ship 2000MT of rice from Manila to Qingdao. Can you provide me with a loading rate for the next two weeks? Also, does your liner include daily demurrage?

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Loading Rate and Demurrage Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

The loading rate for rice from Manila to Qingdao is approximately 65 to 70 USD/MT. Please note that this rate is a rough estimate for reference. Our liner does not include daily demurrage.

If you have any further questions, please feel free to let me know.

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: Update on Loading Rate Due to New Regulation
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

According to the new regulation on rice import to China, the loading rate for rice from Manila to Qingdao has increased. The new loading rate is approximately 80 USD/MT.

Please let me know your latest information.

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: Request for Additional Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Zou,

We have already purchased a shipment from Nantong, but we need one more shipment. The cargo will be loaded in Qingdao in June. Can you tell me whether you can provide this service? I hope you can send me a quotation as soon as possible.

Thanks,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Additional Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Alice,

Thank you for your information. The rate is as follows:

Qingdao: 65 USD/MT (with demurrage)
Qingdao: 80 USD/MT (without demurrage)

Please let me know if you need further details.

Sincerely,
Zou

email_chain.subject: Finalizing HFO Discharge Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hello Jin,

We’re finalizing 18kt of HFO for discharging in February-March. Could you please check the cargo’s grades and provide a quick schedule?

Best regards,
Leo

email_chain.subject: Re: Finalizing HFO Discharge Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hello Leo,

Thank you for your email. I’ve reviewed the cargo grades and can confirm the schedule. Additionally, I noticed the favorable price of oil. I understand there’s a 0.5% discount available. Could you confirm if selling to buyers who pay the discount would reduce our commission to 5% instead of the usual 7%?

If you can confirm this, I’ll work on securing the discount for you.

Best regards,
Jin

email_chain.subject: Urgent Need for 50,000dwt Vessel for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chen,

We have an urgent need for a ship, 50,000dwt size, with good dry-bulk and/or ore carrier experience for the transportation of between 20,000 and 25,000 MT of iron ore from Dampier to Yuan Island. Please confirm your vessel’s availability, draft, and size, as well as the availability of existing ballast water. Additionally, when can you have your vessel at sea, and does it accept 'dumping' of cargo in the event of a strike?

We would be most grateful if you could provide a detailed specification of your vessel, including crew, safety records, and insurance policy information, by 7th August.

We will contact you regarding further details after this date.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Need for 50,000dwt Vessel for Iron Ore Transport
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vernon,

Thank you for your enquiry.

We are pleased to inform you that we have an 87,000dwt ocean-going ore carrier on our register. The vessel is 12 years old and has passed rigorous safety inspections. She has been chartered to an oil company for the past 3 months and is now available from 15th August.

In the event of a strike, the vessel has the capability of ‘dumping’ her cargo.

We would be most grateful if you would advise the load port, discharge port, estimated cargo quantity, loading time, and estimated number of loading/discharging crew.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposed Charter Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your swift reply.

With your permission, I enclose an outline of the proposed charter, which covers the period 10th September to 31st October 2011. In addition, I enclose a Letter of Inquiry, which we have requested from Dampier Iron Ore and from Port Walling.

I would be grateful if you would check these and advise on any corrections that you require.

I trust that the agreement will meet with your approval, and look forward to hearing from you soon.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Proposed Charter Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Richard,

I have reviewed your letter, and I confirm that our vessel will be ready at sea by 15th August, so your preferred dates are acceptable.

With regard to the charter, the only changes that I require are the amounts and unit prices for port, light, and insurance; and the percentage of each of these that are to be deducted from the charter.

I trust that these amendments will be acceptable to you.

I will revert with confirmation and insurance policy documents once we have both agreed on the terms.

Yours faithfully,
Jin Jing

email_chain.subject: Re: Final Charter Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

The amendments to the charter agreement are acceptable to me.

I enclose a signed copy of the charter agreement, together with a draft insurance policy.

I would be most grateful if you could confirm that the vessel is ready for loading by 17th August.

Yours faithfully,
Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Jane, I hope this email finds you well. We are looking to ship 50,000 metric tons of wheat from Houston to Rotterdam. Could you provide a freight quote for this shipment? Best regards, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, Thank you for your inquiry. I can offer a freight rate of $25 per metric ton for the shipment. Please let me know if this works for you. Best, Jane.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Jane, Thanks for the quick response. The rate seems reasonable. Could you also confirm the laytime and any potential demurrage charges? Best regards, John.

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Wheat Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, The laytime is 72 hours, and demurrage charges are $10,000 per day. Let me know if you need any further details. Best, Jane.

email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Patel,

My name is Kate, and I am writing to inquire about the status of the clay shipment mentioned in our conversation last week. Would it be possible to get an update on when the shipment will take place and if there is anything else I need to do to complete this order?

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Shipping Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Jones,

We are looking to ship 1,100MT of shoes from Rotterdam to Boston. Can you confirm your earliest available sail date, and can you let me know if you have a regular schedule?

Kind regards,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Schedule
email_chain.body:
Anne,

We would be happy to help with your shipment. Our regular weekly sailing is on the 23rd of the month. This shipment will sail on the 25th of March. Please confirm your delivery address and let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Don

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Shipping Schedule
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

Yes, I think that works for us. The final destination for the goods will be Boston, MA. We will be clearing the goods through Port Newark, NJ.

Thank you for your help!

Anne

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on Shipping to Boston, MA
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I’m following up about the shipping to Boston, MA. I spoke with our customs broker who said they will need to ship from NJ. Can you let me know if that will be a problem?

Thanks,
Anne

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Shipping to Boston, MA
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

NJ is not a problem. The vessel leaves from Rotterdam, then stops in Houston and NJ, before going to Boston. The final destination for the cargo is Boston, and you will clear the cargo in Boston, so that is fine.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Don

email_chain.subject: Carrier Information for Your Shipment
email_chain.body:
Anne,

The carrier for this shipment will be ZIM Lines. They will export from Rotterdam, and stop in Houston, before sailing to Boston. All shipments are delivered FCA (Free Carrier). This means the carrier will deliver the cargo at their warehouse in Rotterdam, from where you will be responsible for paying for the cargo and the customs duties. You will also be responsible for unloading the cargo, or arranging for that to be done.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on Shipping to Boston, MA
email_chain.body:
Anne,

Can you please let me know if you have any questions about our quote? We’ve already run out of our weekly quota, so we will have to sell your cargo at market price.

Regards,
Don

email_chain.body:
Ryan,

Are there any shipments between Singapore and Surabaya? Please feel free to quote your best rates. Thanks!

email_chain.subject: Vessel Space for Styrene + Benzoate
email_chain.body:
Dear Ryan,

It looks like we will have another vessel space for styrene + benzoate from Singapore to Surabaya in February. Can you please get me the details and rates? Preferably, for vessels that are ready to sail in January or February, with last loads of styrene + benzoate, by emptying. Thanks Ryan!

C.C.: William Ok (VM Doc 77)

email_chain.body: Dear Marc, We'd like to discuss in detail about hazelnuts in large quantities. The purpose is to sell directly to factories in China. This email is for urgent contact. It's urgent as you might know that hazelnuts are running short in Turkey. Please reply at your earliest convenience. Very Respectfully, William

email_chain.subject: Introduction to Business Partner in China
email_chain.body: Hello John, I would like to introduce you to our business partner for nuts and dried fruits in China. As you probably know, we buy your hazelnuts, walnuts, and almonds in Turkish supply and then we export them to China, for our business partner. From the market side, we do a lot of sales with their clients. As a result, we are very interested in establishing a direct relationship with your company. When we have products, we could share the direct deal with you, for the price, quantity, and time to be determined. From now on, for future quotations, please send them to me directly. If you have any questions, please contact me at any time. Kind Regards, Emine

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Turkish Hazelnuts Supply

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Turkish Hazelnuts Supply

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hey Aziz,

Our vessel is scheduled to discharge 11,000MT of methanol in Saudi Arabia. Your FOB looks promising, do you accept CIF as well? Also, are there any charges for net tankering?

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Abe! Greetings from the sea.

Our agent in Saudi will do a lift-booking and transport methanol from Red Sea to Yanbu. In addition to your FOB price, do you foresee any additional costs such as bunker charges?

Our priority is the safety of the cargo. However, in the unlikely case of any spillage, our liability will be limited to cleaning cost only. Can we discuss?

Yours,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Aziz!

Thank you for your swift response. However, the transit time from Red Sea to Yanbu by road is 3 days and this has added to our costs considerably. We would like to work out a compromise to ensure that this cargo reaches Yanbu in the minimum possible time.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Abe! I have attached a CIF quote.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Thank you Aziz, but we prefer FOB.

Best,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry
email_chain.body:
We are also open to FOB.

Regards,
Aziz

Sincerely,
Owen Vincent

Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipping
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Sorry for the late reply. Yes, we can carry 35,000MT of ore from Korea to China. We have a team ready to charter a vessel. Please share the details of the vessel so we can proceed.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry for Iron Ore Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Scott,

I will reply with the details of the vessel shortly.

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

The vessel specifications are as follows:
- Length: 164 meters
- Width: 27 meters
- Height: 11 meters
- Cargo capacity: 7,000MT

Additional details:
- Built in 1995
- Used for shipping raw materials
- 6 layers lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We’re ready to charter your vessel for shipping iron ore from Korea to China. We propose a 10-day charter from September 5 to 14, carrying up to 35,000MT of iron ore. Our team is available to discuss terms and address any questions.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

I have a question about the vessel. Have there been any modifications since it was built in 1995?

Thanks,
Frank

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Yes, there have been modifications:
- In 2010, a new engine was installed, increasing cargo capacity to 7,000MT and improving efficiency.
- In 2017, the six layers were lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy, enhancing durability and leak prevention.

These modifications have significantly improved the vessel’s performance.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Charter Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

We are still interested in chartering your vessel for shipping iron ore from Korea to China. We propose a 10-day charter from September 5 to 14, carrying up to 35,000MT. Our team is available to discuss terms and address any questions.

Regards,
Scott

Michelle

- Shipment: Polyester Chips

- Route: Qingdao to Genoa
- ETD Qingdao: Immediately or at the earliest opportunity

Mr. Ahmed

Dave

email_chain.body:

Terry

email_chain.body:

Kind regards,
Dave

Terry

Andre

email_chain.subject: Freight Opportunity - Diesel Transport
email_chain.body:

Kindly,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Opportunity - Diesel Transport
email_chain.body:
Joe,

Are you asking me if I want to do the job or not? I will lift the diesel at US$75 per metric ton. I hope that is a more reasonable price. Please call me back so we can arrange.

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Opportunity - Diesel Transport
email_chain.body:
Joe,

US$75 is our final offer and we must close this deal in August. If we don't close by August, I can't guarantee this rate. We hope you will work with us.

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Opportunity - Diesel Transport
email_chain.body:
Max,

I'm sorry but we can't go any higher than US$60 per metric ton. Would you be interested in 10,000MT instead of 7,000?

Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Opportunity - Diesel Transport
email_chain.body:
Joe,

Are you insane? I will lose money if I lift at US$60 per metric ton.

Max

email_chain.subject: Urgent Cargo Request for Antwerp

Can you suggest any cargo in NY or NJ that we can ship to our Antwerp port this weekend? It’s for a client who is in a hurry.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johan,

We have received your enquiry and can confirm that we have a regular cargo out of Port Newark (New Jersey) this week which we would be happy to include your freight.

Here are the details:
- Departing on Tuesday 21st December.
- Collection of goods by 1200 hours Monday 20th December.
- Pickup from 1 Star. East Coast Express.
- Contact name is John.

For details regarding the vessel and sailing time, please contact Vanessa Stuart (081-7109099 or email vstuart@vohgroup.com).

If this is acceptable, please respond back to me via email as soon as possible. If you wish to discuss anything in more detail, please call.

Thank you for your enquiry.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johan,

I just need to confirm whether you are proceeding with the space for your cargo from New York on our vessel. We are collecting on 18th of October and departing the 19th, so would need a positive answer in the next few days so we can reserve space for you. Please advise.

Many Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH.
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I am forwarding this email to John who is our contact with 1Star Express. If you can discuss direct with John and agree on a pickup date, that would be great.

Thanks,
Vanessa Stuart
Vice President
VOH Global Cargo Management, Dublin

Dear John,

Vanessa was saying we are still waiting for confirmation of 18th of October for our collection in Newark, NJ. We would need a reply from you to let us know if that is OK or not.

I’ll be out of the office on Friday but Vanessa can contact you if you can let us know by Thursday.

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH.
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thanks, we are ok for Monday the 18th. Is that still ok with you? We will collect the 17th at the latest if required.

Regards,
John

email_chain.subject: Maersk confirms opening of new Singapore-Yantian-Busan-Vladivostok service

- Opening to Busan and Vladivostok from Yantian.
- Direct Vladivostok import & export service.
- Full-weekly service.

- YB - Yantian Thursday port stay two days.

- YV - Yantian Monday port stay two days.

email_chain.subject: Request for Quotation and Port Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robertson,

Could you supply the following: 50MT of graphite, 40 pallets of leather, and 6,000 units of button batteries?

In what ports are you based? What are your freight rates, and could we have a couple of alternate port options?

Warm regards,
Luciana

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation and Port Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Bice,

We currently have the required inventory at our port of origin in Sydney, Australia. Our shipping service is scheduled for this Friday (30th March), and the vessel arrives on the 5th of April.

As you have indicated the products, we can dispatch straight to your preferred port. However, due to our contracts with major partners, we are obliged to transport our merchandise through our domestic port (and not your preferred port). Your goods will therefore be transported to Melbourne and discharged at the port of Melbourne, Australia.

Your goods will arrive between 8-10 days from dispatch and can then be collected by yourselves.

We look forward to hearing from you in the next 48hrs so we can make the necessary arrangements to dispatch your order.

Best regards,
Fergus

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quotation and Port Information
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

I would like to advise that as per our agreement with the company, we will be dispatching your order via the contracted port of Melbourne, Australia.

Please note that your products will not be available for collection until 8-10 days from dispatch, as this is the delivery time from the port of origin (Sydney) to the port of Melbourne.

We would greatly appreciate if you could also let us know when the delivery address is confirmed, so we can make the necessary arrangements.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Fergus

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Inquiry for 4,500MT Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
We have a 4,500MT shipment of high-quality fuel ready to export from the Murmansk port. Can you provide a freight rate and advise your earliest available berth?

Thanks,
Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for 4,500MT Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Marvin,

Thank you for your email of 5th June.

Our current rates (including all charges) for the carriage of fuel in bulk to various destinations are as follows (if you have other ports, please let me know):

- Murmansk Port, Russia - Hamburg, Germany - Rotterdam, Netherlands - Le Havre, France - Antwerp, Belgium (Main ports only)

- 3,500 metric tonnes up to a maximum of 300 metres on 34,500 DWT tankers: €200 per metric ton
- 3,001 to 5,000 tonnes on tankers up to 23,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton
- 6,001 to 12,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton
- 12,001 to 16,000 tonnes on tankers up to 50,000 DWT: €260 per metric ton

Please let me know if you need further details.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for 4,500MT Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Bryan,

Many thanks for your quotation. It is a little too high. I am trying to find a carrier who can offer a more competitive rate. Can you please send me your best freight rate in bulk? I have found that another carrier has offered the following rates:

- Murmansk Port, Russia - Rotterdam, Netherlands
  - 2,001 - 10,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €218 per metric ton
  - 10,001 - 15,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €215 per metric ton
  - 15,001 - 20,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €213 per metric ton

I hope you can assist.

Kind regards,
Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Inquiry for 4,500MT Fuel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Marvin,

Thank you for your email of 14th June.

Our best rates on tankers up to 34,500 DWT are as follows:

- 2,001 - 10,000 tonnes: €210 per metric ton
- 10,001 - 15,000 tonnes: €208 per metric ton
- 15,001 - 20,000 tonnes: €205 per metric ton

Please let me know if this works for you.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.body: You guys are like the backbone of this market. I'm so happy that we are trading with a company that's really good at it!

email_chain.subject: Sharing Your Content
email_chain.body: This post will be sent to one of my friends from NYC and to a couple of friends from England. Would you mind if I copied and pasted this to a couple of emails? No spam, just stuff you might find interesting. It's just really interesting.

email_chain.subject: Gratitude for Your Work
email_chain.body: I just wanted to let you know how happy I am that I found you. Now I don't have to scour the web to find solid stories, analysis, and humor. Your commentaries help me focus on the markets and do my own research. I just wanted to tell you how much I appreciate your hard work.

email_chain.subject: Enjoying Your Posts
email_chain.body: I'm not an investor, but I am a person who enjoys the information that you provide. I really appreciate the effort you put into your posts and the way you include different points of view. I hope that you are enjoying this post, and I hope that it's useful.

email_chain.subject: Thank You for the Information
email_chain.body: I really appreciate all the information you provide. I don't have the time to keep up with the news, so this helps me get the information that I need. Thank you again for this. I hope this post has been helpful.

[Insert five (5) more price points that are current, as well as deals in a price range showing these are happening within the last month or so.]

Regards,
Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Price Update and Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the update.

In reference to our email regarding our offer of 2780: You confirmed to us that your sales team confirmed the deals in place were between 2845 to 2870 for the 1st of November delivery. Yet you are demanding we confirm our offer of 2770.

I am not sure why this is so, but it is clear to me the market price is closer to 2870. At this point, we would rather make our arrangements for 1st of November delivery at a time when we know the market has risen, rather than a time when it is sitting on its low.

But please advise what exactly you expect from us.

Sincerely,
Johannah Zabcjok

Regards,

Johannah Zabcjok

Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: dOCUMENTA(13)
email_chain.body:
Dear Sandra and Tom,

I think this type of conversation is a sign of a completely new kind of content. When many people read an email, they don't think too much about it. They just get the information they need to keep doing their jobs.

However, if you put the same information into a 'smartcard', suddenly it becomes very interesting. A Smartcard can contain information, documents, images, videos, and even music. It can also include online links and information that can be downloaded from the Internet, as well as many other things. Smartcards can be sent as gifts.

Best regards,
Logistics Team

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Port Facilities and Transportation
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Ron,

I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to inquire if your port is currently operational. Are there any terminals or ship agents available to assist with operations?

Additionally, could you please provide more details about the tanker port and the transportation facilities there?

Thank you for your time and I look forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Port Facilities and Transportation
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your message. I am able to communicate using my full name, but not through an account name.

My port is open for business, but I currently do not have any ship agents stationed here as I am in the process of developing the port. For now, I am utilizing foreign agents since the harbor is not fully operational. However, I anticipate that the harbor will be completed and fully operational by the end of this year.

I hope this information is helpful and I look forward to staying in touch.

Best regards,
Ron Liang

email_chain.subject: Long Time No See
email_chain.body: Hey Mom, It’s been 6 years since we saw each other. Are you still in Hong Kong? I am now a captain in the army. I can’t believe how fast the time has gone by.

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body: Dear Captain Yang, I was glad to get your email. Yes, I am still in Hong Kong, but I will be moving to Beijing soon. Please don’t worry. I am very well, and I hope you are as well. Now you can tell me about your life. Where are you stationed? And where are your wife and children? How old are they?

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body: Hi, Mom, I am glad that you are still doing well. My family is fine. My children are getting bigger. My oldest is almost 6 years old, and my youngest is 4. I will have to wait a little longer until I can send you pictures of them. I am stationed near Guangzhou. My wife and I don’t see each other very often, so I guess you could say that we are basically divorced.

email_chain.subject: Re: Long Time No See
email_chain.body: Hi, Captain Yang

email_chain.subject: Cargo Arrangements
email_chain.body: Good morning, I was just speaking with your colleague Janice Williams about your cargo. We have almost finalized all the arrangements. Attached is a document for your review. I will be going to Jamaica in the next few days and I am happy to make all the necessary arrangements for the shipment. Cheers, Charles

email_chain.subject: RE: Cargo Arrangements
email_chain.body: Dear Charles, Please let me know when to pick up the cargo from Kingston Wharves in Jamaica. Regards, Matt

email_chain.subject: RE: Cargo Arrangements
email_chain.body: Matt, Thanks for confirming. I will make arrangements to send the cargo to Kingston Wharves by Monday, January 31, 2011 at 10:30 a.m. I will have all the documents to go with the cargo to you by Saturday, January 29, 2011. I will also have an invoice ready for your signature for the cargo and transportation. Hope that you are having a wonderful day. I look forward to hearing from you. Best Regards, Charles Denton

email_chain.subject: Document for Signature
email_chain.body: Good morning, Please sign the document attached and email it to me as soon as possible so that I can proceed to make arrangements to send the cargo to Kingston Wharves. Regards, Charles Denton

email_chain.subject: Assistance Needed
email_chain.body: Matt, Thanks for your support. I need your assistance as I intend to go to Jamaica in the next few days. Please send me your contact details as I have a lot of questions on the arrangement of the cargo in Jamaica. Looking forward to your reply. Best Regards, Charles Denton

email_chain.subject: Request for Quote: Bunkers Shipment from Singapore to Yangon
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Wolf,

I am looking to ship 20,000 metric tons of bunkers from Singapore to Yangon. Are you able to provide quotes for a fixed price? Additionally, can you accommodate a 5-day laycan?

Kind regards,
Chloe

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Bunkers Shipment from Singapore to Yangon
email_chain.body:
Hi Chloe,

Thank you for your inquiry. I have checked and confirmed that we have the capacity to handle your shipment to Myanmar. Below are the available options:

1. On board ship:
   - Delivery: 1st June onwards, ex-Singapore

2. On TBN & TCA ship:
   - Delivery: 15th April onwards, ex-Singapore

3. Barges:
   - Delivery: 5th June onwards, ex-Singapore

Prices are approximately $75,000 - $80,000 USD per 1,000 metric tons, FOB Singapore.

Kind regards,
Benny Wolf

email_chain.subject: Inquiry About Bunkers Storage and Services
email_chain.body:
Hello Benny,

Please provide further information about your services between Singapore and Yangon, including any current charter rates for clean bunkers.

Kind regards,
Richard Phillips
Managing Director
Marine Bunkering Systems Ltd.
Corporate HQ, Singapore
Tel.: +65 6227 3673

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Bunkers Storage and Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Phillips,

Thank you for your email. We do not typically buy or store bunkers in bulk. We handle small quantities for our own ships and usually work through brokers. Do you currently have bunkers stored in Singapore?

Kind regards,
Benny Wolf

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Quote: Bunkers Shipment from Singapore to Yangon
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Wolf,

For the quantity of 20,000 metric tons of bunkers, I require a fixed price FOB Singapore. Due to time constraints, we cannot address additional logistical issues. Please confirm if you can meet this requirement.

Kind regards,
Chloe

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry About Bunkers Storage and Services
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Phillips,

Thank you for your email. We will be storing bunkers at the Singapore port. Please send your request for a quote via email, and we will respond promptly.

Kind regards,
Vincent

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:

I'm looking for a suitable vessel for an 1,800-1,900MT volume of HFO to be loaded around December from Saudi Arabia to East Africa.

Kind regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Matthias,

Thanks for your message! I'll be following up with you on Monday by email. Kindly advise the content of your message again, as I didn't get your email.

My number is 0103894873.

Kind Regards,
Clinton

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Vessel Charter
email_chain.body:
Hi Clinton,

I'm looking for a suitable vessel for an 1,800-1,900MT volume of HFO to be loaded around December from Saudi Arabia to East Africa.

email_chain.subject: Transport of fresh fruit from West Africa to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Hi,

I am interested in moving 9,600MT of fresh fruit from West Africa to Singapore. Do you handle a laycan and preferential liner service for this trade?

Thanks,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport of fresh fruit from West Africa to Singapore (Laycan and liner service)
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

We handle the laycan and preferential liner service for this trade. If you wish to move the fruits by ship, please contact the following representative in your nearest ports.

Please use the following quote format when requesting a quote for service from us.

We can provide the lowest freight rate for sea transport of fruits, vegetables, etc. For ship charter, ship line freight, container, warehouse space, etc.

We have a network of professional & authorized representatives all over the world.

With any shipper that uses our service, you will be provided with:
- Shipment tracking service from origin to destination port
- Free access to all cargo manifests
- Arrangement of logistics

Best regards,
Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Transport of fresh fruit from West Africa to Singapore (Laycan and liner service)
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Thanks for your interest.

We have branch offices in both countries, as follows:

Our Ghana office:
Mr. Michel Gbaro
Cell: +233 262 346 762
Mobile: +233 204 338 289
Fax: +233 212 222 334
E-mail: michelegbaro@gmail.com

And Singapore Office:
Ms. Jenny Kay
Tel: +65 6473 8508
Mobile: +65 9387 5549
Fax: +65 6679 8475
E-mail: jennykay@mmm.com.sg

I have forwarded your request to the Ghana and Singapore branch offices. You will receive a quote from the branch office in the respective countries.

Best regards,
Shipping Team

email_chain.subject: Request for Vessel Options - Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

We would like to load approximately 6,000 tonnes of diesel from Antwerp to Beira by the end of January. We are interested in any vessel options on a CFR basis.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options - Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Ahoy Sophia,

I have attached a document with our current space availabilities. If you are interested, please review and let me know if any of the options work for you. I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options - Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your offer, Alex. We need to check with our headquarters and will get back to you shortly.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options - Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Alex, could you please provide a quote for a vessel that can load both diesel and bunker fuel simultaneously? We will advise you on how to proceed once we have your quote.

Best regards,
Sophia

email_chain.subject: Re: Request for Vessel Options - Diesel Shipment
email_chain.body:
Sophia, could you clarify your requirements? Are you looking for 6,000 tonnes of diesel, 6,000 tonnes of bunker fuel, or a combined 6,000 tonnes of both diesel and bunker fuel to Beira? Please let me know so I can provide an accurate quote.

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Bunker Settlement Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ken,

Can you confirm if the full bunker settlement has been cleared by the bunker supplier?

Best regards,
Julie

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

Yes, I see the draft already. Can you please confirm the signing party in the bunker supply contract? We will forward the PO once we get the confirmation from your side.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

I received a 'Hello' email from the receiver. Ken mentioned on 22nd Oct that the completion date should be done by 1 Nov 2020.

Regards,
Bunker Supplier B

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Anil,

The payment has been done from our end to your nominated account. Please process the supply accordingly so we can proceed with the payment.

We will wait for your information as soon as you receive our payment from our nominated bank account.

Best Regards,
Ken Vongkok

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

The other 2 bunker suppliers have paid the settlement in full. For your reference, attached are the copies of the payment receipts.

Please arrange for payment accordingly and also the issuance of the bunker delivery note asap. The last day for settlement is 29 Oct 2020.

Thank you for your prompt assistance.

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

As per our conversation, please arrange to settle all bunker by tomorrow (28th Oct 2020) for bunker delivery note issuance.

We are running out of time to arrange a new contractor. Once the bunker settlement has been paid, please provide the bank remittance as soon as possible. The bank account is as follows:
xxx

Regards,
Anil

email_chain.subject: RE: For MBZ
email_chain.body:
Hi Anil,

You should have the payment receipt after their delay in making the settlement. We shall refer to the proof in place.

Regards,
Ken Vongkok

email_chain.subject: LNG Availability and Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Availability and Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Jon,

The vessel is subject to contract, but the shipment is confirmed should the conditions of the charter be satisfied.

With regards,
Marcello

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Availability and Price Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Marcello,

Just to double-check – do you have LNG available for shipment from Italy to Dubai? If so, can you please quote your price?

email_chain.subject: Vessel Inquiry for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bayuk,

I am seeking a vessel for 9,600MT of sugar from Nouakchott to Kotka. Could you advise me if your vessel is available at the end of September, and if so, how long your laytime is?

Thank you,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hi Kelly,

In response to your email regarding the sugar shipment to Kotka, we cannot start the sugar movement at the end of September. The vessel must be here by the 25th of August, or there will be delays.

Kind regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Alasdair,

1. Could you please confirm your position?
2. If you can start the load before the 25th of August, please indicate, as we do not have any vessel yet.
3. How long do you need for the complete vessel loading?

Best regards,
Kelly

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Inquiry for Sugar Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Kelly,

1. My position is that we cannot start sugar movements before the 25th of August, so your vessel will have to be here before this date.
2. Please provide your owners’ vessel to fix this movement at the latest before the 25th of August; otherwise, the loading won’t be possible, and you will have to find another loading port.

Kind regards,
Alasdair

email_chain.subject: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Bob,

I am intrigued by the media reports suggesting that Chemical Inc. is a potential acquisition target. Do you have any comments on this story?

Additionally, I would appreciate it if you could forward me your internal report on the market impact of the falling price of naphtha in the U.S.

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Martin,

This has to be a joke. I am not aware of any report suggesting that Chemical Inc. is a target for acquisition.

Cheers,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

No joke here. I just read in the news that 'Chemical Inc. is reviewing its strategic alternatives.' Does this mean that they are considering acquiring you?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
No worries, Martin. We are closely monitoring the market. The naphtha market is highly unpredictable, and we are all at the mercy of OPEC production decisions. The question we are facing is whether to buy long-term, short-term, or even consider storage. What are your thoughts on this?

Cheers,
Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I am an external consultant for Chemical Inc. and am currently preparing a report on the impact of naphtha price movements. I would greatly appreciate your comments on this. You can reply via email or call me directly at (123) 456-789, and I will share your insights with my colleagues at Chemical Inc.

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

I have managed to obtain a draft copy of the report by the Chemical Inc. consultant on the naphtha market. I understand that this is a confidential document. Can you confirm if this is indeed the case?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Media Reports and Market Impact Report
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

Can you comment on whether the announcement of a 1.5 percent reduction in the price of naphtha will impact your business?

Cheers,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Coal Transport Capacity Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Antonia,

We need 6,000MT capacity for coal from Port Elizabeth to Cape Town next week. Can you offer your open slot?

Regards,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Transport Capacity Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Martin,

How do you want to manage pricing? We prefer letters of credit but can also do via DP. We have 2 x 30m3 trucks available to transport the 20Kg bags to the storage facility in Cape Town as well.

Thanks,
Antonia

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Transport Capacity Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Antonia,

Thank you for your response. We will not accept a dry FOB price, please send a letter of credit for the pricing.

Regards,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Transport Capacity Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Antonia,

I do not want a letter of credit as per your email 1. I need a letter of credit per the email 2 that I received from you for our ongoing contract.

You can reply here, to me, or at my email address. And as I said, I do not want to discuss dry FOB pricing as per your email 3.

Regards,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Re: Coal Transport Capacity Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hi Antonia,

Thank you for your reply. I will make sure this is not the case for our ongoing contract.

Regards,
Martin

email_chain.subject: Proposal Request for Shipping Sugar
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Ling,

Would you please provide a proposal to ship 500MT of sugar from Bangkok to Colombo on FOB terms by the 15th of December?

Thank you,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Revised Proposal Request for Shipping Sugar
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Ling,

I would like to revise my earlier request. Could you please provide a proposal to ship 500MT of sugar from Bangkok to Colombo on FOB terms by the 20th of December?

Thank you,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Palm Oil Shipment from Bintulu to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
I’m interested in moving 5,000 tons of palm oil from Bintulu to Tocumen (Panama). Freight and laycan are negotiable, so please respond with an offer.

Best,
Monet

email_chain.subject: Proposal for Palm Oil Shipment from Colombia to Tocumen
email_chain.body:
My name is Olga. I am the director of the international department at one of the largest palm oil exporting companies in Colombia. I am writing to offer you the opportunity to be our agent for the delivery of 5,000 tons of palm oil from Colombia to Tocumen (Panama).

If you are interested in cooperating with our company, we can sign an agency contract and begin export-import operations immediately. I would like to know how much you charge as an agency commission for this kind of shipment.

Please let me know your thoughts on this opportunity.

Best regards,
Olga

email_chain.subject: Confirmation of Interest in Palm Oil Shipment Proposal
email_chain.body:
My name is Colibri. I am the manager of this company. I would like to confirm our interest in your proposal to act as our agent in Panama for the delivery of 5,000 tons of palm oil to Tocumen.

As requested, we are offering you a commission of $5 per ton. Once you confirm your acceptance, I can arrange a video conference to discuss the details of the agreement and begin operations immediately.

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Colibri

email_chain.subject: Cost-Effective Palm Oil Sale Proposal
email_chain.body:
Hi,

This is likely the most cost-effective way to sell our surplus palm oil to the buyer in Panama. Our company has over 100,000 tons of palm oil available from Bintulu, and we would like to sell 5,000 tons to this buyer, as well as the rest.

We are willing to offer you $1 per ton of palm oil, meaning that if you can sell the 5,000 tons at $9.95 per ton, you will earn $4.95 per ton.

Please let me know if you are interested.

Regards,
Ivan

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability and Loading Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Client,

Please confirm your vessel's availability for the above cargo. Additionally, provide your draft requirements, the earliest date you can start loading, and the estimated time of arrival (ETA) in Casablanca.

Thank you for your prompt response.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Cargo Loading Forecast and Sailing Dates
email_chain.body:
Dear Client,

Our team is currently preparing a cargo loading forecast for the upcoming month, which will be shared with all shippers in the first week of January. If you have multiple vessels scheduled to sail during this period, kindly confirm the earliest expected sailing dates to help us avoid any potential double bookings.

Thank you for your cooperation.

Best regards,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Offer for Empty Containers
email_chain.body:
Good day Hong,

Thank you for your offer to buy empty containers from us. Our containers are currently located in Aqaba, and the port of discharge is Tripoli. We believe the following offer will be of interest to you:

2,000 x 20ft reefer containers - Free of Cost

Please advise if the offer above is still available. Thank you.

Regards,
Ms. Banks
HNB International LLC

email_chain.subject: Re: Offer for Empty Containers
email_chain.body:
Good morning Ms. Banks,

Thank you for your email and inquiry. Could you please clarify if you are a trading house or a trading firm? Have you ever traded with the Gulf region before or purchased containers from the Middle East?

If you are serious about this business, I can invite you to become an agent of HNB International, LLC. As an agent, you would be responsible for reselling our products in your country, and we would buy back from you for further reselling to your local customers or for re-exportation.

To proceed, you would need to open an account with your local bank, and we can then process your purchase order. I would be glad to assist with all the necessary documentation to get the transaction started.

Please provide the requested information, and I will forward the contract to you. Please note that I am not familiar with your country, so additional details would be helpful.

Best regards,
Hong

email_chain.subject: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

We have two pallets of IT equipment that need to be moved from Stockholm to Oslo ASAP. The value of the goods is between $40,000 and $50,000. Could you arrange pickup in Stockholm on Monday and delivery in Oslo before Friday?

We look forward to working with you on this project.

Sincerely,
Ulf Vikman

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for your response.

Our client needs to pick up the goods on Monday, but they want to ship the goods the same day (today). They want to have them delivered to them in Oslo by Thursday morning.

I hope this is not a problem for you. We need to confirm that this is possible by this evening.

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Mjönes,

Yes, we can deliver the goods on Monday morning. We can pick them up at your office in Stockholm this afternoon.

You may not need this, but our client also requires a clean bill of lading.

Let us know if this meets your needs.

Thank you for your business.

Sincerely,
Ulf Vikman

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

That is perfect. You are in luck, as our client needs a clean bill of lading.

We would like to send you the bill of lading this evening. Can you arrange the pickup with our client tomorrow?

I think our client will be at the warehouse from 8 AM to 6 PM tomorrow. Is that acceptable to you?

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

My colleagues and I just reviewed the bill of lading. We noticed that it was missing our address. We need to make sure that the address on the bill of lading is correct.

Can you check it and make sure it is correct?

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: IT Equipment Transport from Stockholm to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vikman,

Thank you for sending me the updated bill of lading.

I spoke to my colleagues and we all agree that the address on the bill of lading looks right. Can you please check your end and make sure that the address matches your files?

Let me know if you have any questions.

Thank you for your help.

Sincerely,
Anna Mjönes

email_chain.subject: Urgent Delivery Inquiry - Yellow Melamine Plastic Chairs
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Blanc,

Our company requires urgent delivery of 20 pallets of yellow melamine plastic chairs. These need to be moved from Hong Kong to Las Vegas. Please can you advise the cost of this delivery to arrive by the end of January?

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Urgent Need for Stainless Steel Container Bins
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Blanc,

Thank you for your email. We have an urgent need for 100 stainless steel container bins in the Las Vegas area. These need to be delivered to Las Vegas by the end of January. Can you advise the cost of these products delivered?

Regards,
Maxine

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Quote for Yellow Melamine Plastic Chairs
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Blanc,

Thank you for your quote of $4500 for 100 stainless steel bins. Could you also provide a bid for 100 yellow melamine plastic chairs with the following dimensions:
- 700mm high
- 700mm deep
- 700mm wide

Please provide the total cost for 100 chairs delivered to Las Vegas by the end of January 2020.

Regards,
Maxine

email_chain.subject: Vehicle Condition Feedback
email_chain.body:

Thank you for the photographs. I noticed a few scratches and dents, as well as a crack in the rear window. If these issues can be resolved in a timely manner, I will agree to purchase the vehicle.

I look forward to your response.

Yours,
John

email_chain.subject: 1978 Dodge Omni Hatchback for Sale
email_chain.body:
To whom it may concern,

I have a 1978 Dodge Omni Hatchback for sale. I have taken the necessary steps to ensure the safety and well-being of the vehicle. Please feel free to contact me with any questions.

You can reach me at 555-555-5555 or Geraldine@domain.com.

Thank you,
Geraldine

email_chain.subject: Concerns About Vehicle Condition
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

Thank you for the photographs. I am still concerned about the scratch marks on the body of the vehicle. I will contact you again next week regarding this matter.

Regards,
Helga

email_chain.subject: Vehicle Inspection Update

I will examine the vehicle next week and notify you of the outcome.

Sincerely,

email_chain.subject: Follow-Up on Vehicle Inspection

email_chain.subject: Request for Freight Rates - Crude Palm Oil
email_chain.body:
Hey Tony,

email_chain.subject: Request for Truckload Rates - Crude Palm Oil Drums
email_chain.body:
Good morning Tony,

We have the cargo loaded in Vancouver. We are looking for a location to reload into drums. The cargo is crude palm oil with 2% max water, 2% max sulfur, and 20-30 deg API. Approximately 2,700 drums of 150kg each are required. The drums will be 12.5" in diameter, 35" in height, with 2 handles, screw-on caps, and 4 labels on the sides. The drums will be lined with nylon, and we will also need outer boxes for protection. The shipper is prepared to pick up the drums and outer boxes. We are looking to deliver to western Ontario, Canada, or the United States.

Let me know if you have any questions, and thanks for your help.

Best regards,
Bryan
